loans.name: Acela

texts.en:
Acela is 60 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Acela runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, shampoo, snack foods, biscuits, milk, juice, soft-drinks, etc. to sell.

Acela has been in this business for 11 years and sells a variety of items. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, shampoo, snack foods, biscuits, milk, juice, soft-drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is 30 years old, married, and has five children, four of whom are currently in school.

Eden is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Eden has been in pig fattening for 9 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  In the future, Eden would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Quy

texts.en: Quy is requesting a new loan to buy sewing tools, sewing equipment and materials. Quy's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sewing tools, sewing equipment and materials

loans.name: Thu

texts.en: Thu would like to take a loan to buy a larger quantity of food products such as noodles and soft-drinks to sell from her stall. Thu's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of food products such as noodles and soft-drinks to sell from her stall

loans.name: Dieu

texts.en:
Dieu, 51, is married and has three children: one son and two daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn an income selling fish in the market.

She started this business 10 years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of fish to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of fish to better satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Diep

texts.en:
Diep is 65 years old and married with six children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn a living by running a general store and selling sugarcane juice. 

She started her business three years ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying more soft-drinks in bulk to sell to her customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more soft-drinks in bulk to sell to her customers

loans.name: Sharof

texts.ru:
Шароф родился в семье колхозника в районе Рудаки. Он живёт в кишлаке Маргзор. Он занимается животноводством. Покупает на рынке района Рудаки животных по дешевле, откармливает их и продаёт немного увеличив цену.  Шароф женат и имеет четырех детей. 
Шароф пришёл в МДО Арванд, чтобы получить кредит, для того чтобы улучшить свой бизнес по  животноводству.Он заранее благодарит МДО Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Sharof was born in a farming family in Rudaki.  He lives in the village of Margzor and works in animal husbandry.  He purchases cattle for a cheap price at the local market in Rudaki, fattens the animals, and then sells them for a higher price.  Sharof is married and has four children.  Sharof came to MDO Arvand for a loan in order to improve his animal husbandry business and thanks Arvand in advance for its support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Unidas es un grupo rural, donde todas las integrantes se dedican a actividades eminentemente rurales, que pese al sacrificio que hacen luchan por sus familias.
La Sra. Clara integra este  es una de las integrantes, ella se destaca por ser una mujer entusiasta, trabajadora, y por sobre todo muy humilde, ella sueña con poder superarse cada día y luchar por sus seres queridos. Clara se dedica a la cría de animales y por medio de este humilde trabajo lucha para poder ganarse la vida de una manera honrada.
Clara pide este préstamo para poder comprar animales para la cría, como ser gallinas y cerdos, y con ello poder continuar con su trabajo. Ellas agradecen por la oportunidad que reciben de dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Unidas group is a rural group where the members work in predominantly rural jobs. Despite the sacrifices they make, they fight for their families.

Clara is one of the group members. She stands out for being an enthusiastic, hard-working and above all humble woman. She dreams of being able to survive every day and fight for her loved ones. Clara raises animals and through this humble work is able to earn a living in an honorable manner.

Clara seeks a loan to be able to buy animals to raise such as chickens and pigs, and thus be able to continue with her work.

The group members are thankful for the opportunity that they receive to give to their loved ones that which they were not able to have.

loans.use: to buy animals to raise such as chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
El señor Angel es casado, tiene  41 años, vive  con su esposa y tiene un hijo. Comenta que desde muy joven trabajaba como ayudante de albañil y allí fue adquiriendo conocimiento del ramo y hoy en día es el albañil oficial, cuenta con muchos trabajos gracias a la buena calidad de sus obras.
Él está luchando por su familia para poder darles una vida digna y sin privaciones como las que él tuvo que pasar. Pide este préstamo para poder comprar herramientas para poder usar en su trabajo de albañil. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibió.
texts.en:
Angel is married, 41 years old, and lives with his wife and son. He states that from a young age he worked as a bricklayer's helper and from there began acquiring knowledge about the work and today he is an official bricklayer. He has a lot of work thanks to the good quality of his labors. He is fighting to support his family and be able to give them a dignified life without the hardships like those he had to endure.

He asks for this loan in order to buy tools to use in his work as a bricklayer. He is thankful for this opportunity that he has received.

loans.use: to buy tools to use in his work as a bricklayer.

loans.name: Orustamo

texts.ru: Орустамо проживает в городе Куляб. Она замужем. У нее есть четверо детей. Сыновьям по 25, 23 и 15 год. Дочке 12 лет. Муж занимается строителем в городке Куляб. Старшие сыновья находятся за границей, по той причине, что не нашли себе работу в стране. Орустамо занимается животноводством у себя во дворе. Она начала заниматься 6 лет назад. У нее есть корова, которое Орустамо доить корову и обеспечивает семью молочными продуктами. Орустамо хочет увеличить поголовье коров. Она доить корову, потом продает молоко и сливки. С помощью этого бизнеса она обеспечивает условия жизни семьи. Орустамо обратилась за кредитом для купли коров. Ваша поддержка поможет ей приобрести корову и улучшить бизнес. Поддержите ее.
texts.en: Orustamo lives in the city of Kulob.  She is married and has four children.  Her sons are 25, 23, and 15 years old, and her daughter is 12.  Her husband works as a builder in Kulob.  Her older sons live abroad because they could not find work in the country.  6 years ago, Orustamo started a business raising cattle in her own yard.  She owns cows, which she milks to provide her family with dairy products.  She also sells the milk and cream, and with the help of this business is improving her family's standard of living.  Orustamo wants to increase the size of her herd, and is asking for a loan to buy cows.  Your support will help her to buy a cow and improve her business.  Please support her.

loans.use: to purchase cows

loans.name: Sarvinoz

texts.ru: Это Сарвиноз. Ей 38 лет. Она замужем и имеет 6 детей. Две дочери в возрасте 9 и 3 лет. Четыре сыновья в возрасте 20,17,16 и 13 лет. Ее муж с сыном находятся на заработках в Российской Федерации. Они уехали на заработки, чтобы обеспечить семью. Сарвиноз сама занимается шитьем «курпа» и «курпача» у себя дома. «Курпа» и «курпача»- это ватные матрасы. «Курпа» шьют стандартно квадратном размере, ее используют в качестве одеяла. Курпача длинные матрасы используется как диваны.  Сарвиноз начала деятельность в 2009 году. У Сарвиноз золотые руки, она шьет красиво. Она имеет свою клиентскую базу. У Сарвиноз сейчас не большой недостаток денежных средств. Сарвиноз запрашивает кредит для купли ткани, нитки и швейных принадлежностей, чтобы продвигаться дальше.
texts.en: This is Sarvinoz.  She is 38 years old, married and has 6 children.  Her two daughters are 9 and 3 years old, and her four sons are 20, 17, 16, and 13.  Her husband and sons work in Russia - they left in search of work in order to support the family.  Sarvinoz sews "kurpa" and "kurpacha" in her home.  "Kurpa" and "kurpacha" are cotton mattresses.  "Kurpa" are sewn in a standard, square size, and are used as blankets.  "Kurpacha" are long mattresses that are used as couches.  Sarvinoz started this business in 2009.  Sarvinoz has golden hands - she sews beautifully and has her own client base.  Sarvinoz now has a small shortage of funds and is asking for a loan to purchase fabric, thread, and sewing accessories in order to continue on.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, and sewing accessories

loans.name: Langcheng

texts.en: Langcheng is a 29-year-old married factory worker with a dependent child. She lives in the Kampong Chhnang province of Cambodia. She has worked in the factory since 2010. Her husband is 33 years old and he is a motorcycle mechanic and he also sells motorcycle parts. The family can make an income of $14 each day. To help improve her husband’s business, Langcheng would like to secure a loan to buy more motorcycle parts for her husband to sell to his clients. With this loan, her husband will be able to generate more income to support his family. In the future, she is going to send her child to school.

loans.use: to buy more motorcycle parts for her husband to sell to his clients

loans.name: Kimiyokhon

texts.en: Kimiyokhon is a kind woman. She was born in 1952. She is widowed and has 3 children. Her husband died some years ago. Kimiyokhon works to earn a living. She always tries to help her children for the well-being of her family. She has been busy sewing hats and selling them. She has great experience in this field. Kimiyokhon has regular customers in a local market. She tries to offer high quality hats and in this way to attract more customers. She is asking for a loan of 7,000 TJS to buy raw materials for sewing more hats to increase her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for sewing more hats

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is grateful because her previous loan was a big help for her business. She was able to purchase merchandise for her clothing retail business. The loan is also useful in the education of her children. Her income from the loan assisted with their everyday expenditures at home. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Lydia would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan. It will be used to buy additional bridal gowns and dresses she needs in her business. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from this business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Lydia hopes that her business will continue to flourish and she dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more quantities of bridal gowns and dresses to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria, 46, is married and has four children. Two of her children are currently in school.

Gloria is in the agricultural business, in pig fattening, in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years and she has borrowed seven times from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to sustain her business.

Gloria has now requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Qurbomurod

texts.ru:
Курбомурод  родился в семье колхозника в районе Рудаки. Ему 40 лет. Он женат и имеет четырех детей.  Он занимается  животноводством. Покупает на рынке района Рудаки животных по дешевле, откармливает их и продаёт немного увеличив цену. 
 Бизнес животноводства приносит хороший доход, поэтому Курбомурод хочет расширить этот бизнес, увеличив поголовье своего скота. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд, чтобы получить кредит на покупку скота. Он заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Qurbomurod was born in a farming family in Rudaki.  He is 40 years old, married, and has four children.  He works in animal husbandry - he purchase cattle at the market in Rudaki for cheap, fattens the animals, and then sells them for a slightly higher price.  The animal husbandry business provides a good living, and so Qurbomurod wants to expand the business and increase his herd.  For this reason he turned to Arvand for a loan to purchase cattle.  He thanks Arvand in advance for its support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Anh's Group

texts.en:
Anh is 57 years old and lives with her two children. Her husband works as a guard. For the past 10 years Anh has been running a general store and selling coffee from the front of her house to earn an income to support her family. Anh is the Group Leader of a 4-member loan group that live in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture she is in the second from the left, wearing a white wool jacket. The other group members are requesting loans to fund income-generating activities.

Anh is requesting a loan to purchase a better quality and greater variety of products such as food and beverages to restock her store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional ones. She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase a better quality and greater variety of products such as food and beverages to restock her store

loans.name: Orostamo

texts.ru: Это Оростамо. Ей 40 лет. Оростамо проживает в городе под названием Куляб. Она замужем и мать троих детей. Дети учатся в школе. Муж работает учителем. Оростамо уже более 5 лет занимается животноводством. Она выращивает скот у себя во дворе. Животноводческая деятельность является основной, потому что доход от этого бизнеса обеспечивает семью. Оростамо обратилось за кредитом, потому что у нее осталось малое количество скотов, чтобы сохранить деятельность и увеличить поголовье скота. Это кредит поможет ей приобрести несколько скотов. Оростамо заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en: This is Orostamo.  She is 40 years old and lives in a city called Kulob.  She is married and is the mother of three children.  Her children are in school and her husband works as a teacher.  Orostamo has been working in animal husbandry for over 5 years.  She raises cattle in her yard.  Her work is important because the income from her business provides for the needs of her family.  Orostamo is asking for a loan because she has only a small number of cattle with which to continue her business and increase the size of her herd.  This loan will help her purchase several head of cattle.  Orostamo expresses in advance her gratitude.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Guzalhon

texts.en: Guzalhon was born in 1975. She is married with three children. She is from northern part of Tajikistan where she lives in small town. Guzalhon is generous, brave, kind, honest and hardworking. She was a participant in “Achieve Success” training and has demonstrated a strong willingness to open a new business. She has an idea to buy and sell died fruits, but she needs financial support to start her business. Guzalhon is asking for a loan of 15,000 TJS to buy dried fruit to start her business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy dried fruits for her business.

loans.name: Anelyn

texts.en:
Anelyn, 28, is a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. Married to Erlito, her business partner, she has two children who are still in the elementary and preparatory levels in school. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to provide for her family's daily personal and household needs and to send her children to school. 

Anelyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this she also has a fish culture business as added income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of PHP 1,000 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan, which she will use to buy grocery items such as fresh meat, sacks of rice, charcoal, soda and other grocery items. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given to her, for it will surely help fund the family's everyday needs and the schooling needs of their children.

Anelyn hopes to maintain and grow her business to improve their quality of life. She prays for a happy life and a quiet life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is 49 years old, married, and has four children. She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Marjorie requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marjorie has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertiliizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Salesa

texts.en:
Salesa is 55 years old and married with two children. 

Salesa is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been fattening pigs for 15 years now, and borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Salesa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly is 49 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Shirly is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional new seeds and other farm supplies.

Shirly has been farming rice for 12 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional new seeds and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Zokirjon

texts.ru:
Зокирчон мужчина 30 лет, женат, молодой отец вот уже четверых детей. Зокирчон по семейным обстоятельствам не смог окончит школу и пошел работать, чтобы помогать родителям с деньгами. Зокирчон устроился рабочим на стройке, также работал продавцом на рынке. Зокирчон не смог поступить в университет, потому что его родители не могли позволить себе оплатить обучение. Поэтому Зокирчон решил продолжить дело отца, и начал смотреть за домашним скотом. Сейчас на своем участке земли Зокирчон имеет три коровы и пять баранов. В его делах ему помогает жена. Она доит коров и относит молоко на рынок для продажи.
Зокирчон планирует закупить корм для скота, но у него нет полной суммы денег. Поэтому он обратился в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой. Зокирчон надеется,что МДО Арванд выделит нужную суммы. Заранее благодарит за доверие.
texts.en: Zokirjon is 30 years old, married, and is already a young father of four children.  For family reasons, Zokirjon was unable to finish school and instead began working to help his parents with money.  Zokirjon got a job at a construction site and also worked in sales at the local market.  Zokirjon could not go to university because his parents couldn not afford to pay his tuition.  For this reason, Zokirjon decided to continue his father's business, and started raising cattle.  He now has on his plot of land three cows and five sheep.  His wife helps him with the business - she milks the cows and takes the milk to the market to sell.  Zokirjon plans to purchase feed for his cattle, but he does not have the full amount of money needed.  For this reason he turned to MDO Arvand for financial support.  Zokirjon hopes that MDO Arvand will deliver the needed funds.  He thanks you in advance for your trust.

loans.use: to buy feed for his livestock

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over twenty years, Saumu has operated an open-air food business, selling food from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the 40,000 KES she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Sherwin

texts.en: Sherwin continues his studies for the second semester for Automotive at EMCOTECH. He never gives up on fulfilling his dreams to finish his studies and to have a stable job in the future. Indeed, he wants and is willing to help his parents too. He took another student loan from GDMPC to pay his second semester school tuition fee. He is hopeful that someday he will march on the stage claiming his diploma.

loans.use: to pay his school tuition fee for the current semester

loans.name: Umriniso

texts.en: Umriniso is a challenged woman who was born in 1975. She is living in a remote district and is married with four children. She is an active, brave, gentle and merciful person. She has an idea to start a business of buying and selling birds like chicken. She participated in training and decided to realize her idea. She has a cell in her house for keeping chickens. She is planning to sell chickens in the domestic market. Her husband and son are willing to help and support her in business. Umriniso is asking for financial support from Kiva to buy chickens to keep and then sell them in the domestic market. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Mariela

texts.en:
Mariela is grateful she was granted a 50,000 PHP loan that she used for spare parts, accessories and maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in her family's personal, household and business expenditures. 

Mariela would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her two tricycles. It is important that her tricycles are always in a good running condition to ensure efficient service and steady income. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help.

Mariela aspires to have another business to improve her family's living condition. She wants to have a deeper relationship with God to raise her children to godly living. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle units.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 54 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Maria is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Maria has been in pig fattening for four years and earns additional income from food vending. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Mely requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, coffee, noodles, etc. She has been in this business for 27 years now, and also earns additional income from fishing.

Mely would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, coffee, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 23-year-old married woman with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Jane has a dried coconut milk business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more coconuts for her business.

Jane has been in this business for two years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts for her business

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a videoke machine rental business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts and payment for electric bills for her videoke machine rental business. Vicenta has been in this business for 2 years. She earns more income from a general store.

Vicenta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and to pay electric bills

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lolita is 59 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Lolita has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials for her fishing business like fish net and bamboo.

Lolita has been in this business for 30 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her fishing business like fishnet and bamboo

loans.name: Ludilyn

texts.en:
Ludilyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Ludilyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Ludilyn has been in this business for one year now.  She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nenita is 52 years old and has one child, who is in school. Nenita has a dried coconut milk business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. Nenita requested a 13,000 PHP loan through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, to buy more coconuts for her business. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts for her dried coconut milk business

loans.name: Romela

texts.en: Romela works hard to support her family. Romela is married with eight children and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Romela requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her fishing business like fish net and bamboo. Romela has been in this business for six years now, and also earns additional income from a general store. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her fishing business like fish net and bamboo

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en: As a married parent of one child, Sharon works hard to support her family. She has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Sharon is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her buy and sell rice grains business. Sharon has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a married woman who has three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food. She has operated a business for the past six years selling milk to the community and the nearby restaurants. She mentioned seasonality and transportation in her business as challenges.  With the loan she is requesting of 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase more stock of milk for resale. She decided to join Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of milk for resale

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena is 43 years old and has three children.  Rowena is married and has three children who are currently in school. Rowena is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Rowena requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Rowena has been in this business  for 10 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Batima

texts.ru: Батима, 51 год, есть сын, замужем. Образование у Батимы среднее, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 19 лет назад с 4,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Батимы, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 1 корова, 1 лошадь и 27 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет примерно 22,000 сом (KGS). Дополнительно Батима шьет уздечки для лошадей, которые реализует на скотном рынке один раз в неделю, примерно по 10 штук. На участке мерою 1,80 Га она выращивает фасоль для реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Батима обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 телят и 20 овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Батима планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.
texts.en: Batima is 51 years old, married, and has one son.  Batima has a secondary education.  Batima's work in animal husbandry and farming, beginning 19 years ago with 4,000 KGS, serves as an additional source of income for her family.  Thanks to Batima's hard work, she now has 1 cow, 1 horse, and 27 sheep.  Her monthly income is about 22,000 KGS.  In addition, Batima sews bridles for horses, which she sells at the cattle market once a week, usually selling about 10 bridles each time.  On her 1.80 hectare plot of land she also raises beans to sell.  With the goal for further expanding her business, Batima turned to the bank "Bai-Tushum" for a loan of 150,000 KGS to purchase 2 calves and 20 sheep to increase the size of her herd.  With the income from the loan, Batima plans to save toward the further development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase two calves and 20 sheep to increase the size of her herd

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru:
Матлуба  молодая и трудолюбивая женщина в возрасте 34 лет. Она замужем и имеет троих детей. Матлуба очень заботливая мать и жена. По профессии она швея  и любить свою работу. Она научилась у своей мамы и  занимается этом делом с детства.
 Матлуба хочет  получить кредит в Арванде для покупки авиабилета. Её муж хочет поехать на заработки в Российскую Федерацию. Она заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку!!!
texts.en: Matluba is a young and hardworking woman of 34.  She is married and has three children.  Matluba is a very caring mother and wife.  She is a seamstress and loves her work.  She learned from her mother and has been sewing since childhood.  Matluba hopes to receive a loan from Arvand to purchase an airplane ticket so that her husband can travel to Russia for work.  She thanks Arvand in advance for its support!!!

loans.use: to buy an airplane ticket for her husband

loans.name: Hoiriah

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Hoiriah. Hoiriah lives in South Tangerang, located about an hour's drive from Jakarta, the capital city. She lives there with her husband and her three children (one daughter and two sons).  Hoiriah owns a stall where she provides photocopy service and mobile payment service for her community.  She joined Ruma in 2013. As a woman, she wanted to join Ruma because she wants to learn about how to improve her business, as well as make more contributions to her community. 

As the business grows, Hoiriah is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community, especially on weekends. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Hoiriah improve her business and accordingly, her community which needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Hoiriah is the one who is standing and smiling. She will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for her community

loans.name: Djunijasto

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Djunijasto. Djunijasto lives in South Tangerang, located about an hour's drive from Jakarta, the capital city. He owns a stall where he sells drinking water, liquid gas and provides mobile payment service for his community. He joined Ruma in 2013. He wanted to join Ruma because he wanted to learn about how to improve his business, as well as make more of a contribution to his community. He feels happy as well because the sales executive is being kind and helpful to him.

As the business grows, Djunijasto is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to his community, especially on weekends. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help him improve his business and accordingly, his community which needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Djunijasto is the one who is standing in front of his own stall. He will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services to his community

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo kuña Guapa está en su ciclo número 5 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan para salir adelante, son mujeres jefas de familia que se unieron para que sus familias tengan una vida digna y sin privaciones gracias a la ayuda que les da la fundación y Kiva.
La Sra. Angela es una de las integrantes, ella es una mujer muy sacrificada, que se ha unido a este grupo para dar a su familia todo lo que ella no ha podido tener, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de remedios naturales. Angela es una persona muy trabajadora que pese a los contratiempos busca ayudar a su hogar. 
Pide este préstamo para la compra de remedios naturales varios, para que asi pueda seguir con sus ventas y pueda seguir luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The Kuña Guapa Group is in its fifth cycle of the Women’s Communal Bank Program, where they all work and help each other to get ahead.  They are women heads of household who joined together so that their families may have decent lives without deprivation, thanks to the help that the foundation and Kiva are giving them.

Señora Angela is one of the members; she is a very selfless woman who has joined this group in order to give her family everything that she was not able to have.  She works buying and selling natural remedies. Angela is a very hard-working person who despite the obstacles, seeks to help her household. 

She is requesting this loan for the purchase of various natural remedies so that in this way, she may continue making sales and fighting to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase natural remedies to sell.

loans.name: Barno

texts.en: Barno is a generous woman. She was born in 1982. She is living in a village. She is a widow and has two children. She was a participant of a training and decided to have her own business. She has an idea to trade in the domestic market through buying and selling clothes for women. She wants to be a seller. She learned how to start a new business in the training. She needs to buy a collection of women's clothes to start up the business. She has requested financial support from Kiva to buy women's clothes. Barno awaits for your mercy.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 30 years old and a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Elmer, a driver, and has two kids. The older one is still in the Elementary Level and the youngest is not of school age yet. She manages her household while operating the business. She works to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal and household needs. 

Mary Grace operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this she also sells electronic loads to mobile subscribers in their area for added income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of PHP 1,000 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business, she is requesting a Php 18,000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items such as fresh meat, sacks of rice, charcoal, soda and other grocery stuff. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. Her earnings are their source to meet their daily expenses and to send her children to school. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Mary hopes to maintain and grow her business so they can have a better quality of life.  She strives hard to save for the schooling of her children and prays for good health and a happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for groceries, beverages and toiletries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Gulsunoi

texts.en:
Born in 1971, Gulsunoi is married and has four children. She is a hardworking woman who lives in a rural area in Tajikistan. 

Gulsunoi has been working in agriculture for about 10 years. She plants agricultural products in her yard and sells her products at a domestic market. She has a great number of satisfied clients. 

Gulsunoi is planning to broaden her activity. She is asking for financial support through Kiva to buy fertilizers and seeds for new plantings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for new plantings

loans.name: Mae Amor

texts.en:
Mae Amor works hard to support her family. She is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

Mae Amor requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell. She has been in this business for 3 years now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta, 54, is a married woman with eight children, three of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Violeta has a firewood and charcoal vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more firewood and sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers.

Violeta has been in this business for one year. In the future, Violeta would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more firewood and sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en: As a married parent of four children, Melanie works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Melanie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase empty plastic bottles and ingredients like peanuts for her food vending business. Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase empty plastic bottles and ingredients like peanuts

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel is 28 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of household goods to sell. Maricel has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buy and sell dried fish. She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household goods to sell

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena is 43 years old and widowed with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Ma. Elena is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ma. Elena has been farming rice for seven years and earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 48 years old and married with six children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Susan is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies. Susan has been farming rice for 10 years and also earns additional income from buy and sell charcoal. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma works hard to support her family. Wilma is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Wilma requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell. Wilma has been in this business for three years now, and also earns additional income from a general store. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Babylonia

texts.en: Babylonia is 68 years old and widowed with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, canned goods, milk, noodles, etc. Babylonia has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an income from raising pigs. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, canned goods, milk, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is married and has four school-going children. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. Luvuno has operated a business of selling paraffin for use in cooking as retail to neighbors.  She faces a challenge of delayed payments  hence low profits in her business.

With the loan of 50,000 KES that she is requesting, she wants to establish rental houses, and to purchase cement and sand for construction. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cement and sand for construction.

loans.name: Demetrio

texts.es:
El Sr. Demetrio tiene 67 años, está casado con la Sra. Basilisia de 65 años, ellos tienen 3 hijos,  que con esfuerzo ha podido crear, y que hoy ya son mayores e independientes.
Don Demetrio se inició hace 8 años en el comercio, tiene una despensa que con mucho sacrificio monto, y  que es el sostén de su familia. Es una persona muy sacrificada y trabajadora.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de fideos, azúcar, gaseosas, vinos, etc., lo cual lo ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Señor Demetrio is 67 years old, and he is married to Señora Basilisia, age 65. They have three children, now grown and independent, whom they were able to raise by working hard.

Don Demetrio started out in business 8 years ago. He has a small grocery store that he worked hard to open, and it is his family’s means of support. He is a very selfless and hard-working person.

He is requesting this loan for the purchase of noodles, sugar, soft drinks, wine, etc., which will help him to improve his income.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, sugar, soft drinks, wine, etc.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en: Dilbar is a kind woman. She is 34 years old and lives in Qubadiyon district with her two children in her parents’ home. She is divorced from her husband. Two years ago Dilbar started to work in plant growing. This kind of activity is the main source of income for Dilbar and her children. Her brother and his wife help her in her work. Dilbar wants to get a loan to use in purchasing seed, fertilizer, fuel and other things for her new sowing. Her difficulty is lack of finances. She needs your support and kindness. Because without support, Dilbar is unable to improve the living conditions for her children.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and fuel

loans.name: Kurbongul

texts.en: Kurbongul is a bright woman who was born in 1967. She lives in a village, is a widow, and has three children. She has been working as a sewer for about 20 years. She sews traditional dresses for women. She has a lot of satisfied clients around and is well known among sewers. She was a participant in training. Now she is planning to open a new business of sewing new designed dresses for women. She needs to buy textiles for sewing new designed dresses for women. She is requested financial support from Kiva to buy textiles to start her activity.

loans.use: to buy textiles

loans.name: Lanilyn

texts.en:
Lanilyn is 21 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines and has been in this business for three years. 

She has requested a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos through  Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Lanilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Julie is 54 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business. Julie has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal for 10 years and also earns an income from raising pigs. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business

loans.name: Mujeres Del Barrio San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
21 mujeres integran este grupo llamado Mujeres del Barrio San Cayetano, ellas son personas muy trabajadoras que se unieron para mejorar sus condiciones de vida, ellas podrán ir mejorando a través del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, y con ello conocer la situación de vida de cada.
Rosana es miembro de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas, ella tiene todo tipo de prendas que ofrece a sus clientes y es por ello que le va muy bien. Comenta que hace sus ventas de manera ambulante, y que de esa forma puede tener los medios para poder ayudar a su familia.
Rosana pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de jeans, remeras, pantalones, camisas y otros. Agradece por la oportunidad que tiene de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y mejorar su situación de pobreza.
texts.en:
Twenty-one women form this group called “Mujeres del Barrio San Cayetano.”  They are hardworking individuals that came together to improve their living conditions. They will be able to do this through the Eliminate Poverty Program and they will learn about each others living situation.

Rosana is a member of this group. She works selling a variety of clothing items. She has all kinds of garments that she offers to her clients and that is why it is going well for her. She mentions that she is a street vendor and this way she is able to have the resources to help her family.

Rosana is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of jeans, knit tops, pants, shirts and others. She is thankful for the opportunity to improve her living conditions and improve her poverty status.

loans.use: to buy jeans, knit tops, pants, shirts and others items.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Modesta works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a repair shop. 

Modesta has sustained her business activities through 14 previous loans from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She is now borrowing 15,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF for her fish vending business. She will use the loan to buy additional fish to sell.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo kuña guapa está en su 5to ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para poder conocer la situación de vida de cada una y conforme a ello poder mejorar sus vidas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Delia, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que está en una situación de pobreza extrema. Ella a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa y por medio de la venta de bebidas ella lucha por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
La señora Delia pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas varias, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group Kuña Guapa is in its 5th loan cycle of the women's committee program where they committed to work and help each other get ahead.  They are participating in the Eliminate Poverty survey to be able to learn about their living conditions and to improve their lives accordingly.

One of the members is Delia whose survey showed she is in the level one of poverty. This means that she lives in extreme poverty. With effort, constant work, practicing the behavior of a successful woman and by selling beverages is how she struggles to be able to improve her living conditions.

Delia is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of various beverages to continue selling.  She is thankful for the opportunity to improve her living conditions and her revenues.

loans.use: to buy a variety of beverages to sell.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina lives in Ermera and is married with four children. She has been doing business since 2012 with her own working capital of 700 USD. She is requesting a loan of 600 USD from Tuba Rai Metin. She will add this to her working capital to buy more additional supplies to keep in her store including aqua, candies, cooking oils, salts, sugar, candles, noodles, cigarettes, lighters and other things to sell including soft drinks and hard drinks. There are six members in the family; herself, her four children and her husband. She wants to open a big store in the future, so she is taking this loan to improve her management for her business and to increase her income. Georgina also cultivate animals like pigs, chickens, goats and dogs.

loans.use: To buy aqua, candies, cooking oils, salts, sugar, candles, noodles, cigarettes, lighters and other things to sell including soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Eng's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Thala Barivath district of Steung Treng province, Eng is 30 years old and married. He has five children, all of whom are dependents and still in school. To support the big family, he and his wife have been farming rice and raising pigs for three years. The current business earns his family about 20,000 KHR per day to meet his family’s needs. 

Eng has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one cycle already and he successfully used the past loan to better support his family to have sufficient food and support his children’s education. Now he and his group member, who live in the same village, are applying for a loan. As the leader, he is going to use his portion to buy sesame seeds for growing in order to earn additional income, and also use a portion of the loan to buy more pigs to raise. With this loan, he hopes to increase his new business to earn a larger income to improve his family’s living condition and keep their children in school.

loans.use: to buy sesame seeds for growing in order to earn additional income

location.town: Steung Treng Province, Thala Barivat District

loans.name: Nan's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Siem Reap province’s Srey Snom district, Nat, 50, has five children. Nat and her husband are rice farmers who have been farming for 32 years. She also raises cows and pigs in order to earn additional income for her family. The current business earns her about 15,000 KHR per day. 

Nat has been with VisionFund for five cycles and completely paid back the loans, which have helped her improve her livelihood from cycle to cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy more pigs and pig feeds. She hopes to fatten her group of pigs so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and pig feeds

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna is 56 years old and married with two children.  With children in school, Edna works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, egg, milk, sugar, etc. Edna has been in this business for two years. In the future, Edna would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, egg, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth works hard to support her family. Elizabeth is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, egg, noodles, etc. Elizabeth has been in this business for 25 years now. In the future, Elizabeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, egg, noodles, etc

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en: Criselda is 49 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy equipment like fishing net and other materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat. Criselda has been in this business for 20 years and she earns additional income from buy and sell rice. In the future she would like to save enough money she can expand her business.

loans.use: to buy equipment like fishing net, and other materials for the maintenance for her fishing boat

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Mariam has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling meat goat in the market and to passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition and transportation in her business. With the loan of 40,000 KES she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of goats for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goats for resale

loans.name: Hoery's Group

texts.en: Hoery, 57, lives in a rural area of the Srey Snom’s district of Siem Reap province. Hoery is a married mother with five children, one of whom is still in school. To make a living, she has been farming rice and raising chickens. The current business earns her about 24,000 KHR per day.  Hoery has been with VisionFund for two cycles. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Hoery wants to use her portion to pay for labor fees in farming rice. She hopes to earn more income from her rice business in order to support her child’s education.

loans.use: to pay for labor fees

loans.name: Ines

texts.en: Ines is requesting a loan of 800 USD to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as slippers, gambling cards, shampoo, pulse, noodles, biscuits, candies, cigarettes, candles and other things to sell. Ines started to open her kiosk in 2009 with her own working capital of 200 USD. She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods. Ines is married with five children and her husband is a farmer. She also has animals in her place like cows, pigs, chickens and dogs.

loans.use: To buy slippers, gambling cards, shampoo, pulse,  noodles, biscuits, candies, cigarettes, candles and other things to sell.

loans.name: Kuña Pojoaju Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado” kuña pojoaju “está en su 3ro ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 4 de las 18 señoras se encuentran con una pobreza extrema.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Rosalia quien según su encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza está en un nivel de pobreza extrema. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de prendas varias, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora que poco a poco quiere salir adelante y todo por medio de su esfuerzo.
Rosalia pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas varias para la venta, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo para mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Agradece
texts.en:
The group called “Kuna Pojoaju” is in its third cycle of the program “Comite de Mujeres” where they all commit to work and help each other to move forward.  They are doing the inquiry into the “Elimination of Poverty” and 4 of the 18 women find themselves in extreme poverty.

One of the members is Senora Rosalia who, according to the inquiry into the elimination of poverty is at a level of extreme poverty.  She works at the buying and selling of various garments.  She is a hard-working, persistent woman who, little by little, wants to move forward and all through her own efforts.

Rosalia is asking for this loan in order to be able to buy assorted garments to sell, and in this way to be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing in order to improve the conditions of her life.

Thank you.

loans.use: to buy assorted garments to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetology products such as a dryer and a hair iron for her practical courses

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es:
Alvaro es de la ciudad de Luque, está estudiando la carrera de Ingles, a la par que estudia también trabaja en su propio taller de motos.
Comenta que le gustaría poder ter minar su carrera, para poder enseñar en colegios y algún día poder mejorar su ingles viajando al extranjero.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de sus estudios y seguir luchando por su meta.
texts.en:
Alvaro is from the city of Luque.  He's studying English and, at the same time, working in his own motorcycle repair shop.

He's requesting this loan to be able to pay the fees for his studies and keep on striving for his goal.

Alvaro said he would like to finish his program so he can teach high school and one day be able to travel abroad and improve his English.

loans.use: to pay his university fees

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor es de la ciudad de Ybycuí, está estudiando la carrera de ingeniero Agrónomo, comenta que está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder convertirse en un profesional útil no solo a si mismo, sino también a la sociedad.
Victor pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir luchando por sus metas. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en: Victor, from the city of Ybycui, is studying to become an agronomist. He is putting forth his best effort to become a professional who is useful not only to himself, but also to society. Victor requests this loan so that he can pay his university fees, and in this way, keep fighting to achieve his goals. He is thankful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Holbibi

texts.en: Holbibi is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1958. She is living in remote district. She is divorced. She has three children. She used to be an employee in a store,  selling shoes. Then with support of her employer she opened her own store. For the past ten years she has been busy with buying and selling kid’s shoes. Her business is growing every quarter. She is planning to buy additional stock of goods for resale. She is asking for financial support from KIVA project to buy kid’s shoes for resale.

loans.use: to buy kid’s shoes for resale

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 54 years old and married with seven children, two of whom are in school. Julieta works very hard to provide for them. She runs a buy and sell charcoal in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell. Julieta has been in this business for 13 years.

In the future Julieta would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ariel

texts.es:
Ariel es de la ciudad de Villarrica, es una persona que se está esforzando para poder ser alguien en la vida, es por ello que está poniendo todo de sí para poder cumplirlo.
Él esta estudiando la carrera de administración de negocio, con la meta de poder tener su propio negocio y de esa forma poder aplicar todo lo que aprendió.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera y seguir luchando.
texts.en:
Ariel, from the city of Villarrica, is striving to be someone in life. To accomplish this, he gives his all every day to accomplish his goals. He is studying business management with the goal of having his own business, and in this way, applying everything that he has learned. 

He is requesting this loan so that he can invest it in his university fees and keep fighting.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Mujeres Poderosas Group

texts.es:
18 son las mujeres que integran este grupo el cual lleva por nombre Mujeres Poderosas, ellas ponen su mayor esfuerzo para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, todo esto por medio del programa de comité de mujeres y también por medio del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
La Sra. Lorena integra este grupo, ella se dedica a hacer y vender empanadas, comenta que hace todo tipo de empandas y que luego sale a vender de manera ambulante. Ella es muy buena en lo que hace, es por ello que ya se ha hecho de muy buena clientela.
Lorena pide este préstamo para poder comprar carne, jamón, queso, pollo, choclo, y demás, de manera a poder seguir haciendo sus empandas y poder venderlas. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de manera a poder seguir mejorando sus condiciones de venta.
texts.en:
Eighteen women make up this group, which is called “Mujeres Poderosas”.  They are doing their best to be able to improve their living conditions, all by means of the Women’s Communal Bank Program and the Elimination of Poverty Program.

Señora Lorena is a member of this group. She makes and sells empanadas. She says that she makes all kinds of empanadas and then goes out to sell them on foot. She is very good at what she does, and that is why she has already made many good customers.

Lorena is requesting this loan in order to be able to purchase meat, ham, cheese, chicken, corn, and other items, so that she can continue making and selling empanadas. She is thankful to be receiving the opportunity to be able to continue improving her sales.

loans.use: to purchase meat, ham, cheese, chicken, corn, and other items, in order to make empanadas to sell.

loans.name: Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es:
El grupo Sagrada Familia es un grupo nuevo, está en su primer ciclo, forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde todas por medio de la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza podrán conocer la situación de vida de cada una, y conforme a ello poder trabajar.
La Sra. Liz, una de las integrantes de este grupo se dedica a la venta de ropas, realiza esta actividad desde hace tiempo y tiene clientela en la zona. Su marido también trabaja y de esa forma se ayudan para poder salir adelante e ir creciendo poco a poco. 
La Sra. Liz  solicita  este préstamo para la compra de prendas de vestir de temporada, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos e ir creciendo poco a poco.
texts.en:
The group Sagrada Familia is a new group in their first loan cycle. They make up part of a poverty-elimination program, where all of the members can come to know their life situation by completing a survey, and use the results to work. 

Liz, one of the members of the group, makes her living selling clothing. She has been doing this work for some time, and has customers in the area. Her husband also works, and in this way, they help each other to get ahead and grow little by little. Liz requests this loan to purchase seasonal articles of clothing, which will help her increase her earnings and grow little by little.

loans.use: to purchase articles of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Elvio

texts.es:
El señor Elvio es dueño de una despensa bien surtida que pudo montar en su propia casa y con mucho esfuerzo. Es una persona que esfuerza mucho para poder seguir creciendo cada día.
Elvio pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para su despensa, como ser verduras, frutas, carne, enlatados y otros, de manera a poder seguir luchando y trabajando.
Elvio está muy agradecido por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo como lo viene haciendo y poder dar a su familia para una vida digna.
texts.en: Elvio is the owner of a well-stocked grocery store that he was able to open in his own home, through much effort. He fights hard to grow every day. Elvio requests this loan to purchase various supplies for his store, such as vegetables, fruits, meat, canned goods, and more, so that he can keep fighting and working. Elvio is very thankful for this opportunity to keep growing as he has been doing, and to be able to give his family a decent life.

loans.use: to purchase fruits, vegetables, meat, canned goods, and more to stock his business.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana es una persona dedicada, proviene de una familia humilde, y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. El espera ser un buen profesional, es por ello que se está esforzando para salir adelante.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, y pone su mejor esfuerzo para poder sobresalir y ser un profesional exitoso.
Ana pide este préstamo para poder comprar una notebook, y de esa forma poder cumplir con los trabajos que recibe en la universidad.
texts.en:
Ana is a very dedicated; she comes from a humble family, and is very eager to get ahead. She hopes to become a good professional, and it is for that reason that she is striving to get ahead. She is studying accounting, and puts forth her best effort so that she can stand out and become a sucessful professional.

Ana requests this loan so that she can purchase a notebook that will allow her to complete the assignments given to her at university.

loans.use: to purchase a notebook computer to do university assignments.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
El Sr. Nelson es de la ciudad de Carapeguá,  es casado, y tiene una hija. Nelson es docente y su esposa es enfermera. Aparte de dicha actividad el cliente se dedica a la ganadería, ya que proviene de familia ganadera, cuya actividad desde muy niño aprendió como se realiza.
Nelson es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, que con su esfuerzo y sacrificio ha ido creciendo poco a poco.
El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de animales ya que se dedica a la compra y venta de los mismos.
texts.en: Nelson is from the city of Carapegua. He is married, and has one daughter. Nelson is a teacher and his wife is a nurse. Apart from this job, he also works in animal husbandry, as he comes from a ranching family, and he learned at a young age how to do this kind of work. Nelson is very hardworking, and with his effort and sacrifice, he has been growing little by little. This loan was requested for the purchase of animals, as he makes a living buying and selling them.

loans.use: to purchase animals for sale.

loans.name: San Blas 2 Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres  San Blas 2 se encuentra en el Ciclo 3 del programa de comité de mujeres en donde todas ellas están haciendo la encuentra de eliminación de pobreza en donde la mayoría se encuentran en el nivel amarillo y verde, superando asi poco a poco la pobreza extrema.
La señora Marlene está casada y tiene 2 hijos con su esposo, quien es un militar. Ella se dedica al servicio de fiestas de Globo Loco para eventos infantiles con el cual genera sus propios ingresos, y con lo cual ayuda a su marido.
El préstamo lo solicita para la refacción de su material de trabajo el cual es su globo loco. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe, de manera a poder continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en:
The women's group San Blas 2 is in their third loan cycle with the women's committee program in which they are all doing poverty-elimination surveys, in where the majority are located in the green or yellow level, overcoming extreme poverty little by little.

Marlene is married and has two children with her husband, who serves in the military. She makes her living running inflatable games (Globo Loco) at events for children, through which she earns her own money. Her husband helps her with this. 

She is requesting this loan to make repairs to her work material (her Globo Loco). She is thankful for having received this opportunity, which will allow her to continue working.

loans.use: to repair her inflatable game.

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
Las 18 integrantes de este comité cuentan con diversas actividades, cada una de ellas se esfuerza para poder crecer y mejorar sus vidas por medio del esfuerzo en conjunto y con la ayuda de todas.
La Sra. Estanislaa es una de las integrantes del grupo, ella tiene una despensa muy bien surtida, que monto con su esfuerzo y con su lucha diaria. Ella es una persona muy sacrificada que lucha por un mejor porvenir no solo para ella, sino también para sus familias.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de azúcar, lácteos, panificados, para cargar con más productos su pequeña despensa. Agradece por la oportunidad que reciben de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The 18 members of this group all have different areas of work. Every one of them works hard to grow and improve their lives. They depend on each other for support. 
Estanislaa is one of the member of the group. She has a well placed grocery store that she worked hard on a daily basis to start. She is a person who sacrifices and fights for a better life. Not only for herself but also for her family. 
She is requesting this loan to buy sugar, diary and bread products so that her small store can sell more products. She is grateful for the opportunity to improve her life.

loans.use: to buy sugar, diary and bread products so that her small store can sell more products

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Cayetano está en su decimo Ciclo, es de Ciudad del Este, donde todas las integrantes están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, es por ello que forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Teodora en su última encuesta mostró un nivel del pobreza extrema, lo que quiere decir que debe esforzarse más por poder ir mejorando cada día. Ella es la presidenta de este grupo, una mujer  muy trabajadora y luchadora, quien por medio de la venta de frutas y verduras lucha por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y ayudar a su familia con ello.
Teodora pide este préstamo para poder comprar frutas y verduras variadas para la venta, de manera a poder seguir con su negocio como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
The San Cayetano Group is in its tenth cycle. The group is from Ciudad del Este where all of the members are doing their best to improve their living conditions. That is why they are part of a program working towards eliminating poverty. 

One of the members is Señora Teodora who in the last survey showed a level of extreme poverty, which means that she makes an effort each day to get better.  

She is the president of this group and is a very hardworking, determined woman who through the sale of fruits and vegetables fights to improve her living conditions and help her family. 

Teodora is asking for this loan in order to buy various fruits and vegetables to sell, so as to continue with her business as she has been doing. She is grateful for the opportunity she has received -- being able to continue with her business venture.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Nrika

texts.en:
Nrika is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling mats in the market. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With this loan of 30,000 KES she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock weaving materials for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock weaving materials for resale.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Ama est une femme mariée âgée de 50 ans et vit à Gbomame avec ses quatre enfants. Ama est une femme dynamique et cherchant l’épanouissement de sa famille, elle vend des perles en se promenant de quartier en quartier et gagne bien sa vie dans ce commerce. Elle s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché d’Aflao au Ghana pour disposer de bonnes qualités. En sollicitant ce crédit, Ama veut promouvoir l’éducation de ses enfants et avoir plus de bénéfice pour agrandir son commerce.
texts.en: Ama is a 50-year-old married woman who lives in Gbomame with her four children. Ama is an energetic woman wanting to see her family thrive. She sells beads by going from area to area, and she does well earning her living through this business. She gets her supplies once a month at the Aflao market in Ghana in order to have the best quality supplies. In requesting this loan, Ama wants to advance her children’s education and to make more profit, so as expand her commerce.

loans.use: to purchase 25 pouches of small beads and 10 pouches of large beads

loans.name: Otgonjargal

texts.en:
