Three years ago Otgonjargal used his previous loan for home renovation. Last year he changed his job and started working as an assistant carpenter at a furniture making company. His wife stays at home, taking care of household work. Now he is requesting a loan of 2,000 USD to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam for further home renovations. 

For the past three years, his family has lived in a comfortable and warm place but recently the house was damaged by heavy snowfall. It became the main cause of heat loss and his family began burning lots of coal for heating. So a renovation became necessary which will reduce coal usage and prevent air pollution.

loans.use: to renovate his house in order to burn less coal for heating

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase condiments, such as salt, pepper, tomatoes, and oil.

loans.name: Pyalo

texts.fr: Agée de 33 ans, Pyalo est une femme mariée et mère de deux enfants vivant ensemble à Gbomame. Pour soutenir sa famille, Pyalo vend des chaussures dans divers marchés en s’approvisionnant deux fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé et réalise assez de rentabilité dans son activité. Pour bien satisfaire aux besoins de ses clients, Pyalo désire ce prêt pour favoriser l’évolution de son activité et aider son mari à couvrir les charges du ménage.
texts.en: Pyalo, aged 33, is a married woman and the mother of two children living together in Gbomame. To support her family, Pyalo sells shoes in various markets by stocking up twice a month at the Grand Market of Lomé. She makes enough profit in her business. To do well in meeting customer needs, Pyalo would like this loan for the sake of improving her business and helping out her husband in covering household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase 27 pairs of shoes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase condiments, such as salt, tomatoes, and shea butter.

loans.name: Pha's Group

texts.en:
Pha, aged 32, lives in a village of the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province. Pha has three children, all of whom are in school. To make a living, she has been farming rice and raising chickens for 14 years. Currently, this business earns her about 16,000 KHR per day.

She has been with VisionFund for four loan cycles. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Pha wants to use her portion to plow the land for growing cassava. She hopes to grow her business so as to earn more income for supporting her family.

loans.use: to plow the land for growing cassava

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is a 44-year-old married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Liza has requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional baskets of fish to sell.

Liza has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Liza would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional baskets of fish to sell

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Abla est femme divorcée et à l’âge de 43 ans elle vit seule dans le quartier de Gbomame pour entreprendre ses activités. Pour subvenir à ses charges et ses besoins quotidiens, Abla est une  vendeuse ambulante de tomates et des poissons fumés et s’approvisionne au marché d’Assiyéyé une seule fois par mois. Abla sollicite ce crédit pour disposer d’un lieu de vente afin de satisfaire parfaitement aux besoins de ses clients.
texts.en: Abla is a divorced woman who is 43 years old and living by herself in the Gbomame district for pursuing her work. To cover her expenses and meet her day-to-day needs, Abla goes from place to place selling tomatoes and smoked fish. She gets her supplies at the Assiyéyé market only once a month. Abla is requesting this loan in order to have a sales outlet, so as to satisfy her customers perfectly.

loans.use: to purchase 2 boxes of tomatoes and 3 baskets of smoked fish

loans.name: Leopoldina

texts.en: Leopoldina is requesting a loan of $800 to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as water, milk, balm, paste, toothbrushes, toothpaste, candles, slippers, biscuits, cooking oils and other things to sell, including soft drinks. Leopoldina opened her kiosk in 2002 with her own working capital of $200. She is very interesting with her business because many come to buy every day in her store so she is very happy with her business. And she also happy with the loan that she was offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods. Leopoldina is married and she has 6 children.

loans.use: To buy water, milk, balm, paste, toothbrushes, toothpaste, candles, slippers, biscuits, cooking oils and other things to sell, including soft drinks.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 39 years old and married with one child.  

Emma is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Emma requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Emma has been in this business for 6 years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Emma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 42 years old and married with three children, who are in school. Lucia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. She has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, Lucia would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past ten years she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge in high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to help her husband to purchase tools for constructing houses.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is a married woman. She lives at her house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years she has operated a cereals shop, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Farida dreams of establishing a wholesale cereals shop in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 40,000, she wants to purchase stocks of wheat, maize, beans and rice for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stocks of wheat, maize , beans and rice for resale

loans.name: Nhor

texts.en:
A 48-year-old mother of six children, Nhor resides in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Ou Reang Ov district, in Cambodia. To earn her living, she farms rice and raises pigs. Together, the family can earn about KHR 57,000 per day from the current business.
 
This is Nhor's first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Because of a lack of working capital to better support her family’s business, she is applying for a loan of KHR 4,000,000. She will use this loan to buy more pigs and pig feeds, and will also spend a portion of it on fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. 

Nhor hopes to increase her family’s business and gain more income, in order to build some savings and grow her family’s business further.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland, and more pigs and pig feeds

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Villa Yvate Group

texts.es:
Las 17 integrantes de este comité se formaron para poder trabajar de manera unida, y conforme a ese trabajo poder ir mejorando  para poder dar a sus familias todo lo que no pudieron tener y evitar que no pasen por necesidades.
La Sra. Nilsa es una de las integrantes, ella es la presidenta de este grupo, una mujer muy trabajadora que siempre se esfuerza para poder dar a su familia  una vida digna. Ella siempre motiva a sus compañeras para poder esforzarse por poder salir adelante. Nilsa se dedica a la venta de comestibles que ella misma prepara y que luego sale a vender de manera ambulante.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos varios para poder seguir haciendo sus comidas, como ser verduras, condimentos, hortalizas y demás, de manera a seguir con su negocio como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The 17 members of this communal bank formed the group to work together to improve their families' living conditions.

Nilsa is one of the members and also the president of the group.  She is a very hard worker who does all she can to give her family a dignified lifestyle.  She always motivates the other members to work hard to get ahead.  Nilsa sells food that she makes and sells as a street vendor.

The loan she is requesting is to buy different supplies to continue her work.  She will buy vegetables, seasonings, leafy greens, etc. to be able to continue what she is doing.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, seasonings, leafy greens, etc.

loans.name: Familia Unida Group

texts.es:
El grupo Familia Unida está en su ciclo número 20 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para ir mejorando.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Waldima quien es su encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza mostró un nivel de pobreza extremo.  Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que esta poniendo todo de si para poder ir superando su pobreza, todo por medio de la venta de prendas que viene haciendo desde hace ya un tiempo.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas, como ser remeras, camisas, jeans, pantalones y demás, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe, y que les permitirá ir mejorando su situación de vida.
texts.en:
The communal bank Familia Unida is in its 20th loan cycle through the women's program.  All the members work and help each other to get ahead.  They are participating in the poverty elimination survey to improve their situations.

One of the members is Waldima who shows an extreme poverty level on the survey.  She is an enterprising, hard worker who does all she can to overcome poverty by selling clothing.  She has been in business for some time.

The loan she is requesting is to buy different clothing such as t-shirts, shirts, jeans, pants and other items.  This is so she can continue her sales activity.  She is grateful for the opportunity to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy t-shirts, shirts, jeans, pants and other items to sell.

loans.name: Fermín

texts.es:
El Sr. Fermin es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que con sacrificio esta saliendo adelante, es por ello que se esta esforzando cada día. El comenta que su anterior préstamo le fue de mucha ayuda, ya que pudo comprarse herramientas para su taller de motos. Tiene como meta poder ir mejorando su taller de motos e ir dando un mejor servicio a sus clientes cada día.
Pide este nuevo préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de repuestos para su taller de motos para poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Fermin is a very hard worker who is getting ahead through much effort. He says the previous loan was very helpful since he was able to buy tools for his motorcycle workshop.  He wants to improve the shop and provide better customer service day after day.

Fermín is requesting a loan to buy tools for his workshop so he can continue expanding his business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his shop.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 56 years old and married with ten children. With two children still in school, Myrna works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like eggs, cigarettes, condiments, groceries, etc. She has been in this business for 6 years now. 

In the future, Myrna would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like eggs, cigarettes, condiments, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 37 years old and has three children who are in school.

Anabelle has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase spare parts and other materials for the maintenance of her business.

Anabelle has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and other materials for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Viola, from the Messut, Molo area of Kenya. Molo is an area where the earth is red and smells fresh from the rain. The trees are lush. For the past years Viola has been involved in mixed farming, and her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, vegetables, and some personal business she engages in to make extra cash. Viola has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. She passionately loves dairy farming. “Cows are part of me. I love cows, I walk cows, I sleep cows, I eat cows,” she says. The village women call her Mrs. Cow. She sells milk to her neighbours and to the local market, but the demand has been overwhelming, and she cannot meet the demand. For this reason, she is seeking a loan to buy an extra dairy cow, which will assist in increasing milk productivity.

The dairy cow that she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow. It’s a quality breed of dairy cow that will be producing between 10-20 litres of milk a day. This will immediately translate to more profit margin and increased income levels. Profits from selling milk will be used to repay the loan in full, and the extra income will be used to increase her business enterprise. Viola is very visionary, and she intends that in the near future she will start adding value to her milk business by packaging the milk before selling. She will also start selling dairy products such as yogurt. An improved income level will assure her family of a secure future. By joining Juhudi Kilimo, which assists smallholder farmers, she will also benefit from free extension services and links to markets.

loans.use: To buy a quality breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
Mao, 34, is married with three children living in the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province. To make a living, Mao has been selling  grocery items and raising pigs. Sometimes she works for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 27,000 KHR per day. 
This is the seventh micro loan for Mao with VisionFund. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan to buy more pigs to raise and use a portion to buy pig feed. She hopes to fatten her pigs so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to raise

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Da's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house with her family members in a rural village of the Tbaung district, Da is 36 years old and married with 1 son who is in school. 

She and her husband earn a living through planting corn. Having been in this business for 18 years, she manages to earn about 27,000 KHR per day and can save about 15,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

This is a group loan for Da with VisionFund, and she is the group leader. This is her first loan cycle with VisionFund. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. 

Da hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Soun's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village located in the Banteay Meanchey province’s Moungkul Borey district, Soun is aged 59 years and the widowed mother of one child. For the last 39 years, she has been farming rice on two hectares of farmland to support her family. With the current business, she can earn about KHR 28,000 per day and can save about KHR 15,000 each day for future needs.

Soun has been a member of VisionFund for 10 cycles already and she completely paid back the loans, which have enabled her to better support her child and extend her business. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice fruitfully so as to sell if for a good price to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more vegetables for her husband's shop

loans.name: Guldasta

texts.en: Guldasta is 22 years old. She lives with her mother-in-law, husband and her two children. She has a secondary school education. She has engaged in agriculture for two years. Her husband and mother-in-law help her. Guldasta plans to continue developing her activity. She requested a loan to buy fertilizer, fuel and seeds.  She intends to use the earnings from the loan to further develop her business, which will allow her to improve her family's welfare. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, fuel and seeds.

loans.name: Temur

texts.en: Temur is 65 years old. He lives with his wife and two children in Kobuleti district. His wife works as a nurse and gets a small monthly income. Temur is unemployed at the moment and he decided to start his own business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 3000 GEL. With the received credit he will purchase a minibus and will transport people. This will give him a chance to generate income. Temur is very motivated to start this business and improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus and transport people.

loans.name: Nzadze

texts.en:
Nzadze is a married woman and has two kids who attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Nzadze has operated a tailoring business for the past six years. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase cloth material and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth material and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more tools for her son's vehicle repair shop.

loans.name: Sin

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Cheung Prey district, Sin is 60 years old and married with six children. She earns a living through farming rice to feed and support her family members. Having been in this business for 40 years, she is able to earn about US $10 per day and manages to save about US $4 each day for future needs.

Sin is a first cycle client with VisionFund. Now requesting a loan, she wants to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for labor. She hopes to grow more rice so as to earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Davlatbi

texts.ru: Давлатби 59 летняя жительница города Куляб.  У нее две дочери. Им 38 и 24 лет. Они замужем и имеют детей. Старшая дочка находится за границей. Давлатби сейчас занимается животноводством.  Она уже более 10 лет занимается этой деятельностью. Это бизнес выгодный и важный для Давлатби, потому что животноводческая деятельность является основной, доход от этого бизнеса обеспечивает семью. Многие жители кишлака занимается этой видом бизнеса. Она хочет купить несколько молодых телят, чтобы расширить животноводческую деятельность. По этой причине она берет кредит. Вы можете помочь ей с финансовыми трудностями. Она очень нуждается на Вашу помощь.
texts.en: Davlatbi is 59 years old and a resident of the city of Kulob.  She has two daughters who are 38 and 24 years old.  They are both married and have children of their own.  Her oldest daughter currently lives abroad.  Davlatbi raises livestock and has been involved in this activity for more than 10 years.  This is a profitable business and it is very important to her because it is the family's main source of income.  Many other residents of her village are involved in the same activity.  Davlatbi wants to buy a few calves in order to expand her animal husbandry business.  This is the reason why she is taking a loan.  Please help Davlatbi solve her financial difficulties.  She really needs your help.

loans.use: To buy a few calves.

loans.name: Cinthia Jakelina

texts.es:
Cinthia tiene 31 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Morropón que se encuentra ubicado en la región Piura, costa norte de Perú. La comunidad donde vive es un lugar en donde sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio y cuenta con servicios básicos como son agua y luz.

Ella se dedica a la venta de aves de corral como gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, actividad que realiza desde hace más de 5 años, contando con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de aves así como alimento balanceado para el engorde de estas, con esto Cinthia espera ofrecer una mayor cantidad de aves a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos y le va a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cinthia is 31 years old and has a partner. She lives with her family in the Morropón district of the Piura region on Peru’s northern coast. Here the people make a living in farming, cattle-raising and trade. The local area has running water and electricity.

Cinthia makes a living selling poultry, such as hens, ducks, turkey and more. She has been doing this work for more than five years. With experience with the business, she now receives good personal and professional references locally. This loan will be used to buy a larger number of birds and feeds to fatten them up. Cinthia hopes that this loan will allow her to offer her customers a larger number of birds, providing her with a higher income and allowing her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a larger number of birds and feeds to fatten them up.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her daughter's university tuition fees.

loans.name: Deive

texts.es:
Deive tiene 32 años de edad, es casado y tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, en una zona rural que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Las actividades que se desarrollan en este distrito son la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, cuenta con más de 8 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito, su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Adicionalmente se dedica a brindar servicio de jornalería en las fincas de las personas que lo contratan y cuenta con herramientas propias. Solicita préstamo para la compra de más animales para incrementar el stock de su negocio así como alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, con gran influencia en el negocio, Deive espera incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender los diversas gustos y necesidades de los clientes de la zona lo que le permitirá obtener mayores ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Deive is 32 years old, married and has two children. He lives with his family in the Oyotún district, a rural area in the province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region of Peru's northern coast. Here people work in farming, cattle-raising and trade.

Deive makes a living raising and selling animals. He has more than eight years’ experience with his business, and has very good personal and professional references locally. Deive’s business is located in his home. As well as his business, Deive works as a labourer at different farms. He owns his own tools. Deive is applying for this loan in order to buy more animals to increase stock at his business, and feed to fatten up the animals. 

This investment will help Deive to offer a wider variety of products to customers, and will increase productivity. This will have a big impact on the business. Deive hopes to increase his stock of animals in order to cover the range of tastes and needs of local customers. This will allow Deive to increase his income and thus his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more animals to increase stock at his business, and feed to fatten up the animals.

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David tiene 27 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su esposa e hijo en casa familiar en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana del distrito de Cayaltí que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La población de este distrito se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral como pollos, gallinas y cuyes, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Realiza esta actividad desde hace más de 2 años contando con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus clientes y vecinos. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales y alimento balanceado para el engorde de los mismos, de esta manera David espera hacer crecer más su negocio, obtener más ingresos y poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
David is 27 years old and has a partner. He lives with her and their son in the family home in a large urban community in the Cayaltí district of Chiclayo province. Situated in the Lambayeque region, Cayaltí is on Peru’s northern coast. Here, the people make a living in farming, cattle-raising and trade.

David makes a living raising farmyard animals, such as chickens, hens and guinea pigs. The business is located in David’s home. He has been doing this work for more than two years and, with this experience, now receives good personal and professional references from customers and neighbours.

David is applying for this loan in order to buy a larger number of animals and feeds to fatten them up. David hopes that, with this loan, his business will expand and that he will be able to earn a higher income and improve both his and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a larger number of animals and feeds to fatten them up.

loans.name: Govsiddin

texts.ru:
Говсиддин  молодой и жизнерадостный парень 22 лет.  Он женат. По профессии он мастер.  Он любит свою профессию.  Вот уже несколько лет он мечтает приобрести новую мебель в своем доме. Но не как не может накопит на это деньги 
Он хочет закупить комфортную мебель в дом. Но у него сейчас не достаточно средств, чтобы закупить сразу всю мебель по оптовой цене. Поэтому Говсиддин обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку мебели. Он заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку и надеется на положительный результат.
texts.en: Govsiddin, age 22, is a young man with a positive attitude.  He is married and works as a foreman.  He loves his job.  For a few years now he has been thinking of buying new furniture for his house, but he hasn't been able to save enough money for this purchase.  Govsiddin wants to buy some comfortable furniture for his house, but he doesn't have enough money right now to buy all the furniture he needs at a wholesale price.  For this reason, he has turned to MDO Arvand to receive a loan to buy furniture.  He thanks Arvand in advance for their support and hopes for a positive outcome.

loans.use: to buy furniture.

loans.name: Tuychiboy

texts.ru: ТУйчибой мужчина 30 лет ,женат,молодой отец троих детей. Туйчибой с отрочества занимается животноводством. В начале он помогал родителям на поле, ухаживал за скотом, так же собирал овощи и фрукты с поля и продавал на рынке. Сейчас Туйчибой расширил бизнес отца, закупил еще несколько голов домашнего скота. Во всех его делах ему помогает его жена. Туйчибой понимает, что должен работать усердно, чтобы прокормить свою большую семью. Туйчибой планирует закупить корм для скота,но у него не хватает денег. Поэтому он обратился в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой.Он надеется на то, что МДО Арванд откликнется на его просьбу о получении кредит и выделит нужную сумму. Заранее благодарит за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en: Tuychiboy is a 30-year-old married man and a father of three children. Since his boyhood, Tuychiboy has been involved in animal husbandry. At the beginning he helped his parents on the field, took care of livestock, and also picked vegetables and fruits from the field and sold them at a market. Since then Tuychiboy expanded his father's business by buying several heads of livestock. His wife helps him with all the business. Tuychiboy understands that he has to work hard in order to feed his large family. Tuychiboy plans to purchase livestock feed, but does not have enough money. This is why he came to MDO Arvand for the financial support. He hopes that MDO Arvand will respond to his request to obtain a loan and disburse the needed sum. He is grateful in advance for the support and trust.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed

loans.name: Nozimjon

texts.ru:
Нозимджон молодой парень в возрасте 23 лет. Нозимджон пока  ещё не женат,но хочет поскорее женится и для этого ему необходимо небольшое количество денежных средств. Он по профессии мастер по изготовлению шкатулок. Он изготавливает национальные шкатулки из древесины и укрощает его рисунками. Этому он научился у своих родителей и имеет 5 лет опыта работы. 
Нозимджон  занимается этом делом уже давно. Каждые два три дня он едет в город для покупки материалов для изготовление  шкатулок. У него есть свой собственный старый автомобиль который нуждается в ремонте и  он хочет отремонтировать  свою автомашину. Но у него не хватает собственных средств. Он обратился в Арванд за кредитом. Он заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку!!!
texts.en:
Nozimjon is a 23-year-old young man. Nozimjon is not yet married, but wants to get married soon and needs a small amount of money for this. He is a craftsman, who makes small chest boxes. He makes national chest boxes from wood and decorates them with paintings. He learned this trade from his parents and has 5 years of work experience.

Nozimjon has been involved in this business for a long time. He goes to the city every two or three days to buy materials for making the chest boxes. He has his own old car that needs to be repaired, and he wants to repair his car, but does not have enough of his own money. He requested a loan from Arvand. He thanks Arvand for the support in advance!!!

loans.use: to buy spare parts in order to repair his car

loans.name: Dilbarniso

texts.ru: Дилбарнисо  жительница района Дж.Руми. Она замужем и мать четверых детей. Ее муж работает трактористом на районе. Дети уходят в школу. Дилбарнисо в  жизни  занимается шитьем женской одежды. В швейном деле Дилбарнисо нравится ежедневный доход и общение с новыми людьми. Она 1 год назад начала параллельно заниматься животноводством. У нее была мечта заниматься выращиванием скота, потому что Давлатнисо любит домашних животных и по причине, что ее мама занималась этой видом бизнеса. У Давлатнисо сейчас закончилось запас корм для скота. Она берет кредит для купли корм скота. Без корма она не сможет обеспечить своих животных. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет ей сохранить деятельность и улучшить деятельность животноводство.
texts.en: Dilbarniso is a resident of the J. Rumy district. She is married and a mother of four children. Her husband works as a tractor driver in the district. The children go to school. Dilbarniso is involved in sewing women's clothing. What Dilbarniso likes about the sewing business is a daily income and interactions with new people. She also became involved in animal husbandry one year ago. She had a dream of being involved in fattening up livestock because Dilbarniso loves livestock and because her mother was involved in this type of business. Currently Dilbarniso's inventory of livestock feed has run out. She is requesting this loan to buy livestock feed. She will not able to provide for her livestock without the feed. The requested loan will help her save her business and improve her animal husbandry business.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed

loans.name: Almagul

texts.ru: Алмагул, 64 года, замужем, дети взрослые, самостоятельные, старший сын помогает по хозяйству, также он предоставляет услуги трактора местному населению. У Алмагул высшее образование, сейчас она на пенсии, занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Алмагул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 7 коров, 5 овец. Также имеется земельный надел, мерою 2,4 ГА, где Алмагул выращивает фасоль для реализации. На ежедневной основе продает молоко. Совокупный ежемесячный доход Алмагул составляет 32,500 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы, часть средств, а именно 15,000 сом (KGS) она направит на ремонт рабочей машины, которую семья использует для сельскохозяйственных нужд. Доходы от кредита позволят Алмагул развить ее бизнес и накопить на покупку кошары.
texts.en: Almagul is 64 years old, married and has grown, independent children. The oldest son helps her with the household and also provides tractor driving services for the local residents. Almagul has a higher education and is now retired, and involved in animal husbandry and farming. Thanks to Almagul's hard work, today her farm contains 7 cows and 5 sheep. She also has 2.4 hectares of land, where she grows beans for sale. She sells milk on a daily basis. Almagul's combined monthly income amounts to 32,500 som (KGS). She requested a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy a cow and to use some of the money, specifically 15,000 som (KGS), to repair a car that her family uses for agricultural needs. The earnings from the loan will help Almagul develop her business and save money to buy a barn for sheep.

loans.use: to purchase one cow and repair her work car

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr: Divorcée, Ami est une femme de 21 ans qui vit à Sagbado avec deux enfants. Pour vivre et venir en aide aux besoins de ses enfants, elle vend des  glacières et des casseroles en se promenant de lieu en lieu. Elle s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché d’Assiyéyé et réalise un bon bénéfice grâce à son activité génératrice de revenu. Ami désire ce microcrédit pour favoriser l’éducation de ses enfants et  générer assez de revenus.
texts.en: Ami is a 21-year-old mother to two children, now separated from her partner, who lives in Sagbado. In order to provide for her children, she sells ice-boxes and casserole dishes as a street vendor. She gets her supplies twice monthly from the market in Assiyéyé and earns sees decent profits from this venture. Ami is requesting this loan so she can support her children's education and her business.

loans.use: to purchase two ice-boxes and one casserole dish

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr: Ami est une femme mariée âgée de 27 ans qui vit dans le quartier de Sagbado avec ses deux enfants. Ami participe activement à l’épanouissement de sa famille grâce   au commerce ambulant d’huile rouge d’où elle tire une bonne rentabilité. Elle achète  une fois par mois au marché sa marchandise et circule dans les quartiers pour les vendre. Ami sollicite ce prêt pour améliorer sa condition de vie et aider son mari dans les besoins quotidiens de la famille.
texts.en: Ami is a 27-year-old married mother to two children who lives in Sagbado. Ami actively contributes to her family's well-being through selling red oil as a street vendor, which has proven to be a profitable venture. Once a month, she purchases her supplies from the local market then walks around selling her wares. Ami is requesting this loan in order to improve her living standards and to assist her husband with their family's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase six containers of red oil

loans.name: Céline

texts.fr: Céline est une femme mariée de 45 ans et vit à Anomé avec ses quatre enfants. Avec son dynamisme et son courage Céline est une vendeuse du riz et de l’haricot devant sa maison afin de disposer d’une bonne capacité financière. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Céline s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé. Céline désire ce prêt pour financer son commerce et aider son mari dans l’éducation de leurs enfants.
texts.en: Céline is a 45-year-old married mother to four children who lives in Anomé. A dynamic and brave woman, Céline earns a living through selling rice and beans outside of her house in order to secure her financial assets. In order to realise her goals, Céline gets her supplies twice monthly from the main market in Lomé. Céline is requesting this loan so she can support her business and assist her husband pay for their children's education.

loans.use: to purchase one sack of corn, seven cartons of spaghetti and two sacks of rice

loans.name: Assane

texts.fr:
Assane est marié à deux femmes et est père de 14 enfants dont son ainé, âgé de 22ans et le plus jeune, de 4 ans. Il s’active dans le transport depuis 1986. Ayant obtenu son permis, il a d’abord travaillé pour le compte d’un particulier pendant quelques années ; avant de se faire proposer d’acheter le véhicule qu’il conduisait. Depuis lors il est à son troisième véhicule qu’il conduit lui-même. Il démarre sa journée à 6h du matin pour rentrer à 19h, il ne le remet pas à quelqu’un d’autre pour  pouvoir prolonger la durée de vie de sa voiture, d’ailleurs, ce prêt consenti servira à faire quelques travaux de réparation sur son présent véhicule. Assane s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne de la famille, mais appuyé de son fils ainé et de son frère aussi. 
Comme souhait, Assane désire renforcer son parc automobile et devenir un grand transporteur.
texts.en: Assane is married to two women and has fathered 14 children, his eldest being 22 years old and his youngest four years old. He has worked in the haulage business since 1986. After having obtained his driving licence, he first worked for a small business for a few years, before he offered to buy the vehicle which he was driving. He is now onto his third vehicle, which he himself drives. He starts his day at 6 AM and returns home at 7 PM. He doesn't turn to anyone else to prolong the life of his vehicle. This loan will be used to carry out some repair work on his present vehicle. Assane provides for his family's daily expenses, but also looks to his eldest son and his brother for assistance. Assane hopes to grow his fleet of vehicles and become a large haulage contractor.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fish and palm oil for resale

loans.name: Lidia

texts.en:
Lidia lives in Ermera, she is married and she has two children. She is applying for a loan of $ 1,500 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a shop of clothes and she also sells in the market. She is taking this loan because she wants to add to her working capital to buy more clothes such as t-shirts, school uniforms, short sleeves, shorts, pants and other clothes to sell. 

Lidia has been involving in business activities since 2011, she started with her own working capital of $ 850. She is earning a good income from selling her clothes because many people like to buy them - so she is still happy to do her business. 

With the loan from Tuba Rai Metin she hopes to make her business into a bigger store. She also has animals like pigs, chickens and dogs.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, school uniforms, short sleeves, shorts, pants and other clothes to sell.

loans.name: Menchie

texts.en:
Menchie is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Menchie is 42 years old and has four children who are in school.

Menchie has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Menchie requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase boxes of fish to sell.

Menchie has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Menchie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Zenaida works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food-vending. Zenaida is borrowing PHP 4,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell in her charcoal business.

Zenaida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn, 64, is a married woman with seven children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Marlyn has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to sell.

Marlyn has been in this business for 30 years.  In the future, Marlyn would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Shabana's Group

texts.en:
Shabana is 37 years old, a married woman, residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of two children and her husband is a vehicle repair mechanic by profession. Her husband provides services to the people in the form of vehicle repairing. He has been running a vehicle repair workshop in the market, where he performs his services. He has also spare parts in the workshop which he uses when he repairs vehicles. 

He needs to purchase some equipment for his workshop. This will help him to continue his work and to work more efficiently and professionally. He does not have enough funds to purchase the needful things. Therefore his wife, Shabana is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. This loan will help him to buy workshop items like tires, tubes, axels, brake shoes, etc. 

Shabana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy items for her husband's vehicle workshop.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 28 years old and has three children who are in school.

Marivic has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Marivic requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

She has been in this business for three years. In the future, Marivic would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereal.

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”, la socia continua dedicándose a su negocio de cabinas de internet, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia a la vez continua con su negocio de llamadas telefónicas, nacionales y locales, siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de un equipo de celular.
texts.en:
The group member belongs to the "MADRES TRABAJADORES" communal bank and is an honest and diligent businesswoman. She is still running her internet cafe business, where customers can also make local and international calls. She is grateful that she can receive a loan and committed to making full and timely payments. 

The group member is applying for a loan for the purchase of cellular equipment.

loans.use: for the purchase of a cell phone.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “MADRES TRABAJADORAS, él socio  sigue dedicándose al negocio de transporte, el socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de llantas de su carro.
texts.en:
The member belongs to Madres Trabajadoras Communal Bank.  He still earns a living in the transportation business.  He's a responsible and hardworking person because this is how he gets his family ahead.

He's requesting the loan to buy tires for his car.

He's happy about the loan and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy tires for his car

loans.name: Yanett Del Pilar

texts.es:
La socia Yanett Del Pilar pertenece al banco comunal LAS HIJAS DE MARIA ; la socia sigue trabajando en su negocio de venta de artesanía ,la socia continua vendiendo lo que son chompas,polos,guantes,entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solictan,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de chompas,polos entre otros.
texts.en: Yanett Del Pilar belongs to the Las Hijas de María community bank. She still works in her business selling handicrafts, and continues to sell sweaters, polo shirts, gloves and other items to all her customers. She would like to keep working so that she can continue to support her family. Yanett is requesting the loan to buy sweaters, polo shirts and other items.

loans.use: to buy sweaters, polo shirts and other items.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 34 years old and married with five children. With four children in school, Nora works very hard to provide for them.

Nora runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, sugar, condiments, groceries, etc.

Nora has been in this business for 3 years now. 

In the future, Nora would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, sugar, condiments, groceries.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.pt:
O senhor Alfredo  e trabalhador, casado pai de 6 filhos dos quais 2 já são maiores independentes vivem em casa própria, 2 frequentam o ensino primário e os outros 2 já concluíram o nível médio.
Com o valor do empréstimo pretende comprar Varroes, cimento, blocos, e pagar a mao–de–obra para dar continuidade da sua obra.
O cliente tem como sonho concluir a sua casa , abrir um negocio em sua casa e comprar uma viatura para lhe ajudar no dia a dia.
Os principais desafios são financeiros e pretende tomar mais credito para suprir as sua dificuldades e alcançar os seus sonhos
texts.en:
Alfredo is a worker. He is married and has six children: two adults who live on their own, two who are in elementary school, and who are finishing middle school.
He will use this loan to buy beams, cement, and cinder blocks and pay laborers to continue building his house. He dreams of finishing the house, opening a business in his home, and buying a vehicle to make daily life easier.
His main challenges are financial ones, and he plans to take out additional loans in the future to overcome his difficulties and achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to buy beams, cement, and cinder blocks and pay laborers.

loans.name: Luz Carlota

texts.es:
La socia Luz Carlota pertenece al banco comunal MUJRES UNIDAS, la socia  sigue con su negocio  de venta de ropa, la socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia continua vendiendo  pantalones, chompas, polos, casacas y blusas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de chompas, polos para su negocio.
texts.en: Luz Carlota belongs to the Mujeres Unidas community bank. She still works in her business selling clothing. She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her loan repayments on time. She continues to sell trousers, sweaters, polo shirts, jackets ad blouses. Luz Carlota is a responsible and hard-working person, which is how she supports her family. She is requesting the loan to buy sweaters and polo shirts for her business.

loans.use: to buy sweaters and polo shirts for her business.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina works hard to support her family. Angelina is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Angelina has been in this business for five years now.

Angelina requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers.

In the future, Angelina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Sreyroth's Group

texts.en:
Sreyroth is 25 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. She has one small child to take care of. 

Rice farming is the primary source of her family’s income to make a living and she has been in this business for seven years. With the current business, she can earn approximately 42,000 KHR per day and save about 20,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

This is the second micro loan for Sreyroth with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, she will use her portion to buy rice seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to increase her current business so as to earn a larger income to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie, 38, is a married woman with five children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Elsie has a buy and sell bag business in the Philippines. Elsie has been in this business for five years. 

Elsie requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more bags to sell.

In the future, Elsie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more bags to sell.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
El Sr. Andres tiene 47 años y es constructor de obras y comenta que con su esposa también se dedica a vender pescado, tienen 3 hijos ya todos son grandes, que por medio de su trabajo y su esfuerzo han podido criar y sacar adelante-
Hace mas de 30 años que se dedica a la construcción y unas de sus metas es que su hijo estudie la facultad para poder ser alguien en la vida, y que no tenga que pasar por trabajos difíciles como los que el paso.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de poder invertirlo en la compra de pescados varios, para que puedan seguir con el comercio que tienen.
texts.en:
Andrés, 47, is a builder.  He said he also earns a living selling fish with his wife.  They have three children, already grown, whom he was able to raise and get ahead through his job and his effort.

He has worked in construction for more than 30 years.  One of his goals is for his son to go to college so he can be somebody in life and not have to work hard jobs like Andrés had to do.

Andrés is requesting this loan to be able to buy a variety of fish so they can continue with their business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
El Sr. Oscar vive en pareja con la Sra. Mirna, tienen una hija adolescente, por quien está luchando para que tengan una mejor calidad de vida.
El tiene una despensa, que poco a poco fue formando, y que con lucha y esmero ha ido creciendo y luchando. Quiere seguir creciendo y luchando, es por ello que pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para su despensa, como ser verduras, frutas, carnes y otros, como también de ropería.
Reconoce la importancia y agradece por la oportunidad que le otorga la Fundación Paraguaya y kiva.
texts.en:
Oscar lives with his partner, Mirna, and they have a teenage daughter. He is fighting to improve their qualify of life.

Oscar has a store which he set up little by little, and which, with hard work and dedication, has grown. He wants to continue growing and fighting, which is why he is applying for a loan to buy various goods for his store such as vegetables, fruit, meat and other items, as well as clothing.

He recognises the importance of and is grateful for the opportunity given to him by Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruit, meat and other items, as well as clothing.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Divino Niño Jesus está en su 3er ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 5 de las 21 señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, lo que quiere decir que se encuentran en una pobreza extrema.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Rosalina, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que ella se encuentra en un nivel de pobreza extremo, pero se está esforzando para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo arduo en su despensa que todos los días abre desde muy temprano hasta muy noche.
La señora Rosalina se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, es creativa y es capaz de emprender un negocio y tener éxito. Pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, carne, bebidas varias, frutas y demás, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que ella esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
This group's name is Divino Niño Jesus and it is in its third cycle in the women's committee programme. They are participating in the survey to eliminate poverty, and five of the 21 women live below the poverty line. This means that they live in extreme poverty.

One of the group's members is Rosalina, who was assessed as having a level one poverty level. This means that she lives in extreme poverty. However, she is working hard to improve her living conditions through effort and hard work in her store, which she opens every day from early in the morning until late at night.

Señora Rosalina is known as an enterprising, creative woman who has been capable of setting up a business and making it successful. She is requesting this loan to buy vegetables, meat, various kinds of drinks, fruit and other items so that she can keep selling goods as she has been doing. She is grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, various kinds of drinks, fruit and other items to sell.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La socia Isabel  pertenece al banco comunal MUJERES UNIDAS, la socia sigue dedicándose  al negocio de transporte, la socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia continua administrando el carro que presta servicio de transporte, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de llantas.
texts.en:
The member, Isabel, belongs to Mujeres Unidas Communal Bank.  She still works in the transportation business offering transportation service with her car.  She's a responsible and hardworking person because this is how she gets her family ahead.

Isabel is requesting the loan to buy tires.  She's happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy tires

loans.name: Junadeth

texts.en:
Junadeth is 22 years old and is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Junadeth has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Junadeth requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Junadeth has been in this business for a year. In the future, Junadeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Nancy is 59 years old and has two children who are in school.

Nancy has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines. Nancy requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell .

Nancy has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Nancy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Jamileth

texts.es:
Deseos de superación y de autonomía, fueron las puertas que Jamileth decidió abrir cuando su esposo la abandonó junto con sus tres hijos. Ella vio una nueva oportunidad de salir adelante vendiendo tortillas y estableciendo una pulpería, que ha logrado que todos sus hijos cumplan con su derecho a estudiar y que los dos mayores sean ya independientes. 
El negocio de Jamileth ha logrado crecer con pasos firmes, gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de su hija mayor. Es por esto que no duda ni un segundo en seguir invirtiendo, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar sacos de maíz, gaseosas, arroz, frijoles, jabón, azúcar, entre otros productos de la canasta básica de sus clientes. Esta inversión le ayudará a tener una gran cantidad de mercadería para suplir la cantidad de clientes que tiene. Sus metas es que su pulpería llegue a convertirse en una gran distribuidora.
texts.en:
Dreams of overcoming and independence are what Jamileth decided to focus on when her husband abandoned her and their three children.  She saw a new opportunity to get ahead by selling tortillas and opening up a convenience store.  Through this, she has been able to ensure that all of her children received an education and that the two eldest became independent.  

Jamileth has been able to grow her business steadily thanks to her effort and the support of her eldest daughter.  For this reason, she never doubts whether or not to continue to invest in her business, which is why she is seeking a loan to purchase corn, soda, rice, beans, soap, sugar and other basic goods.  This investment will allow her to increase her inventory in order to meet the demand of her customers.  Her goal is for her store to become a large distributor.

loans.use: purchase sacks of corn, sodas, rice, beans, soap, sugar and other products.

loans.name: Remo

texts.en:
Remo is 60 years old. He lives in Terjola district with his wife Lia. The family is involved in livestock husbandry. In particular, they have two cows. Lia milks the cows every day and produces cheese to sell locally at a good price. 

Remo is unemployed and wants to be employed. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo has enabled him to get a loan of 2000 GEL. With the received credit he will start up a trading business. He will rent a place in the market and will purchase different kinds of spices and will generate income. This will help his family a lot.

loans.use: to begin buying and selling spices

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn works hard to support her family and has a buy-and-sell jewelry business in the Philippines.

Jenalyn requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of jewelry to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for seven years now.

In the future, Jenalyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of jewelry to sell to her customers

loans.name: Seng Kea's Group

texts.en:
Seng Kea is 27 years old, living with her husband and three children in a rural village of Snoul district. Cassava growing is the main source for her family’s income, and sometimes she works as a paid worker to earn additional for her family. The current business earns her family a daily income of about 47,000 KHR but she is able to save 20,000 KHR each day. 

This is the second loan for Seng Kea with VisionFund. She completely paid back the first loan. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Seng Kea wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her cassava and and use a portion of her loan to pay for labor fees. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her cassava

loans.name: Chunlek's Group

texts.en:
A villager from the Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, Chunlek is 54 years old and married. She has four dependent children who are still small. The main source of her family’s income is from a corn plantation. 

Having been in this business for 36 years, she is able to earn a daily income of KHR 46,000 to support her family and she can save about KHR 20,000 per day for her future needs. 

This is the first loan for Chunlek with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy corn seeds and fertilizers. She hopes to increase her crop yields so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds and fertilizers.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Natsagdorj

texts.en:
Mr. Natsagdorj, 44 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. Two years ago, using his previous loan, he renovated his house and built a garage. He has been working as a driver at a transportation company. Also he renders transportation service to local people using his mini van. His wife used to be a seller at a superstore. Their elder son works as a bartender at a pub and their younger son studies at university. 

Now Mr. Natsagdorj is requesting a loan of 2,500 USD to start up a clothes sales business. He and his wife will import clothes from Korea and sell them at their rental counter. If this business succeeds, his family's living standard will improve greatly.

loans.use: to start up a clothes sales business

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Maria de 50 anos de idade, e casada mãe de 4 filhos dos quais 3 já maiores de idade e um ainda a estudar vive na casa própria.
Com o valor do empréstimo ira comprar capulanas, lenços, lençóis para revender como vendedora ambulante e as vezes na rsa.
Diz que o seu maior sonho e de ver o seu negocio crescer, diversificando os produtos fornecidos para responder as necessidades de seus clientes e adquirir uma  maquina de costura para fazer duvetes para reforçar oseu negócio .
Seu maior desafio e saturação do mercado, alteração dos preços e diz ainda que faz suas poupanças e xitique para minimizar as dificuldades que tem enfretado.
texts.en:
Maria, 50 years old, is married and the mother of four children, three of whom are adults and one of whom is still in school. She lives in her own home.
She will use this loan to buy capulanas (a sort of sarong), handkerchiefs, and sheets to sell door-to-door.
She says her biggest dream is to see her business grow, diversifying the range of products she offers to meet her customers' needs, and to acquire a sewing machine to make duvets to enhance her business.
Her biggest challenge is market saturation, which affects prices. She says she still saves a little money to minimize the difficulties she faces.

loans.use: to buy capulanas (a sort of sarong), handkerchiefs, and sheets to sell door-to-door.

loans.name: Jose

texts.pt:
José e assistente de limpeza  tem 32 anos de idade, e casado pai  de 2 filhos dos quais 1 a estudar outro ainda menor e sustenta sua mãe enviando,  vive na casa própria.
Com o valor do empréstimo ira comprar açúcar, óleo, massas, velas, caldos, sabão para revender na sua banca em casa onde sua esposa e que esta a trabalhar.
Seus sonhos e esperança e ver o seu negocio crescer respondendo as necessidades de seus clientes.
Planos para o futuro e ter uma ferragem onde poderá vender material de construção.
texts.en:
José is a cleaning assistant. He is 32 years old. He is married and the father of two children, one of whom is in school while the other is still too young, and supports his mother by sending her money. He lives in his own home.
He will use this loan to buy sugar, oil, pasta, candles, broths, and soap to sell out of the shop in his home, where his wife works.
He dreams of seeing his business grow, meeting his customers' needs.
In the future he plans to have a hardware store where he can sell construction materials.

loans.use: to buy sugar, oil, pasta, candles, broths, and soap.

loans.name: Sara

texts.pt:
A senhora  Sara è comerciante,casada mae de 4 filhos dos quais 2 frequentam o ensino secundario , 2 ja são independentes vivem na casa própria.
Com o valor do ultimo empréstimo conseguiu concluir o rebouco da sua casa , e com este pretende comprar, cimento, arreia, pedra, ferros, areia,  e chapas para dar continuidade da sua obra.  
Diz ter como sonho concluir a sua obra e oferecer um lar melhor a sua família , construir um salao e boutique e comprar uma viatura para lhe ajudar no dia a dia..
Os principais desafios que o ela enfrenta são financeiros sendo assim pretende tomar mais créditos para poder alcancar os seus objectivos e suprir as suas necessidades.
texts.en:
Sara has her own business. She is married and the mother of four children, two of whom are in secondary school and two of whom are adults and live on their own.
She used her previous loan to finish plastering her house, and she intends to use this one to buy cement, stone, iron, sand, and sheet metal to finish construction on her home.
She says her dream is to finish the construction so she can offer her family a better home, build a salon and boutique, and buy a vehicle to make daily life easier.
The main challenges that she faces are financial ones. As such, she plans to apply for additional loans in the future so she can reach her goals and meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy cement, stone, iron, sand, and sheet metal to finish construction on her home.

loans.name: Saren

texts.en:
Saren is a 23-year-old single daughter of a family from the Svay Reang province in Cambodia. She is pursuing an associate’s degree in the first year at a university in the city. Her parents are farmers, her sister is a nurse and another sister is a factory worker. 

Saren is lacking the finances to cover her university fees from the first to the third year, therefore she has decided to request a loan. With the loan, Saren will be able to have enough finances to earn an associate’s degree with skills to build her future. 

For her future job, she dreams of working in a public institution with a good salary, so she will be able to help her parents.

loans.use: to cover her university fees.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
La socia Felicitas pertenece al banco comunal MUJERES UNIDAS, la socia continua   dedicándose a su negocio de venta de fruta, la socia Felicitas se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia continua vendiendo frutas como platanos, manazanas entre otros, para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de naranjas, platanos entre otros.
texts.en: Felicitas belongs to the "MUJERES UNIDAS" communal bank. She continues working at her business selling fruit. Felicitas feels grateful for the loan and promises to comply with the payments of the loan. She continues to sell fruit like bananas and apples amongst others to all her customers that request them.  Felicitas feels grateful for the loan and promises to comply with the payments of the loan. She is requesting the loan to buy oranges, bananas, etc.

loans.use: to buy oranges and bananas amongst others.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
La socia Nieves pertenece al banco comunal MUJERES UNIDAS, la socia continua dedicándose a la  venta de comida, la socia Nieves agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas, la socia continua vendiendo arroz con pollo, saltado entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solictan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar arroz, carnes entre otros.
texts.en: Nieves belongs to the "MUJERES UNIDAS" communal bank. She continues to work selling food. Nieves is grateful for the support that she is getting and promises to comply in a disciplined manner with the payments of her loan installments. She continues to sell chicken with rice, stir-fries amongst others for all her clients that want them. She wants to continue to work in this way so she can continue to support her family. She needs the loan to buy rice and meat amongst others.

loans.use: to buy rice and meat amongst others.

loans.name: Alan

texts.es:
Alan tiene 33 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos en el distrito de Oyotún que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en esta comunidad es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en su mototaxi, realiza esta actividad desde hace 03 años, contando con experiencia en este negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Solicita préstamo para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, con esto Alan espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que tendrá un gran impacto en su nivel de ingresos y por ende le ayudará a mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alan, age 33, is in a civil union.  He lives in his own house with his two children.  He lives in the Oyotún district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.  Life in this community is peaceful.  The inhabitants devote themselves to agriculture, commerce, and raising animals.

He provides transportation service in his ‘mototaxi’ [three wheeled motorized vehicle].  He has been engaged in this business activity for three years.  He has experience in this business, and he has very good personal and work references in the area.

He is requesting a loan to make repairs and provide maintenance to his vehicle, which is currently in bad shape.  With this he hopes to offer better service to his customers.  This will have a great impact of his level of income and will, therefore, help to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to make repairs and provide maintenance to his vehicle, which is currently in bad shape.

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
This borrower's name is Minda, 46, a resident of Coron, Palwan, Philippines. She is married to Manuel, an ice cream vendor, and has four children of whom two are in college, one in high school and the youngest is in the elementary Level. She and her husband work hard to provide for their everyday needs and the school needs of their children.

Minda sells one of the curious street foods in the Philippines called “dirty ice cream”(sorbetes/sorbet). It is real homemade creamy ice cream made from local fruits. The unique ingredient in sorbetes is coconut milk and when it is sold on the streets, the customer has a choice between putting the ice cream in a bread bun or on a small wafer cone.

The common flavors of dirty ice cream are cheese, mango, ube, and chocolate. Its history began during the American occupation of the Philippines where American ice cream made in Philippines used water buffalo’s milk instead of cow’s milk. Water buffalo’s milk was cheaper and easily available. Peddlers of "dirty ice cream" do not have a permanent stand. They walk around the streets and can also be hired for private parties. As to why it is called dirty ice cream – this was a mother’s warning to a child against buying street food that may not be safe to eat. The government however has stepped in and made sure that the vendors practice good sanitation and hygiene. 
  
To help her continue with her  business, Minda would like to apply for a Php 40,000 loan which she will use to pay for carts of ice cream that she and husband peddle in their community. Adults and kids alike enjoy eating ice cream any time of the day. Even foreigners who have tasted the ice cream claim that it is a great afternoon treat. For the children on the street, the tiny tinkling of the bell is like music to their ears as they know the "sorbetero" is near. Minda and her husband earn a minimum of 2,000 PHP a day in sales.

Minda aims to grow her business and put up a mini-grocery store someday. She aims to send all her children to college and dreams to see them become professionals. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the "dirty  ice cream" she sells.

loans.name: Ana Cristina

texts.es:
Ana, es dueña de una tienda de productos de la canasta básica, es casada y madre de tres hijos, pero solamente uno de sus hijos vive con ella, los otros dos ya son independientes, el negocio lo tiene dese hace más de cinco años y poco a poco lo ha ido fortaleciendo con las ganancias, su esposo ayuda con los gastos familiares.
Invertirá en pan, huevos, aceite, arroz, gaseosas, jugos, etc., para contar con un mejor inventario y tener  satisfechos a sus clientes, espera saber administrar el crédito para que sus ganancias sean mayores.
Su aspiración es desempeñar su función de ama de casa responsable con su familia y generar ingresos en su hogar para aportar a que su familia salga a delante.
texts.en:
Ana is married and the mother of three children.  Only one of them lives with her, however; the other two are already on their own.

She owns a store where she sells staple products.  She has had the business for more than three years and has strengthened it little by little with her profits.  Her husband helps with the family expenses.

Ana will invest in bread, eggs, oil, rice, soda, juice, and so on, so she has a better inventory and satisfied customers.  She hopes to be able to manage the loan to earn more profits.

Her goal is to be a responsible homemaker to her family and to earn income at home and contribute to getting her family ahead.

loans.use: to buy bread, eggs, oil, rice, soda, juice, and other products to have a better inventory and satisfied customers

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 48 years old and has five children. She is married and two of her children are in school.

Marlyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marlyn has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marlyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jeysell Juniette

texts.es:
Desde muy temprano se ve salir el humo y se siente el olor a frijoles y tortillas recién hechas en la casa de Jeysell, una joven de veintidós años de edad, humilde, honesta y muy esforzada, que trabaja para poder ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar y cubrir las necesidades de su hija de dos años de edad. Hace tres años la difícil situación económica que estaba pasando la familia de Jeysell, le obligo buscar una alternativa que le generara un ingreso y así contribuir que ella y sus seres queridos siguiesen viviendo con lo necesario. Por esta razón esta joven mamá decidió emprender una pequeña venta de frijoles cocidos y tortillas. 
Jeysell ha logrado ganarse la confianza de sus clientes, quienes se ven satisfechos con estos deliciosos productos que nunca faltan en los hogares nicaragüenses. Actualmente ella necesita capital para aumentar su producción, es por eso que ha depositado su esperanza en Kiva a través de MiCrédito para que se le otorgue un préstamo para comprar una mayor cantidad de maíz, frijoles y leña. Esta mujer emprendedora lucha con el día a día, teniendo como motivación a los seres que más ama, que son su hija y esposo.
texts.en:
From very early, one can see the smoke and smell the freshly made beans and tortillas in Jeysell's house.  Jeysell is a humble, honest and hardworking young woman who works in order to help her husband with the household expenses and cover the needs of her two year old daughter.  Three years ago, a difficult financial situation in Jeysell's family forced her to find an alternative means of earning an income so that she could contribute to the household.  For this reason, this young mother decided to start a small business selling beans and tortillas.  Jeysell has managed to gain her customer's trust and they are visibly satisfied with her delicious, nicaraguan meals.

She is currently in need of capital to increase her production, which is why she has placed her hopes in Kiva so that she can receive a loan to purchase a large quantity of corn, beans and firewood.  This businesswoman strives everyday, using her loved ones, her daughter and husband, as her motivation.

loans.use: purchase corn, beans and firewood.

loans.name: Claudia Josefa

texts.es:
Claudia es una joven de 17 años de edad, dedicada completamente al estudio. Atraída por el perfil profesional y por su pasión por los números, ella decidió estudiar la carrera de contabilidad y finanzas. Es una señorita inteligente y comprometida por llenar de orgullo a sus padres los cuales son los únicos que la apoyan y tiene como meta ser una mujer exitosa en el mundo de las finanzas, que contribuya al desarrollo de su país. 
Verse egresada de su carrera, requiere mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, pero Claudia pone todo de su parte en el día a día, ya que esta es la única manera para lograr mejorar su calidad de vida y la de las personas que le rodean. Sin embargo, actualmente necesita capital para poder pagar sus estudios y material de apoyo como libros y cuadernos para cumplir con su plan de estudio a tiempo y no quedarse estancada.
