Es por eso que esta joven estudiante deposita sus esperanzas en un préstamo otorgado por Kiva por medio de MiCrédito, para seguir estudiando duro y lograr su sueño de superación personal.
texts.en:
Claudia is a 17 year old full-time student.  She decided to study accounting and finance because she was attracted to the profession and she has a passion for numbers. She is a very smart young lady who is committed to making her parents, who are the only ones who support her, proud.  Her goal is to be successful in the world of finance and to contribute to her country's development.  In order for her to graduate, she knows it requires a lot of effort and dedication, but Claudia puts her all into it everyday day because this is the only way for her to improve her quality of life and the lives of those around her.

However, she is in need of capital to pay for her studies and the materials, such as books and notebooks in order to complete her degree on time and not stagnate.  For this reason, this young student is placing her hopes in a Kiva loan so that she can continue studying hard and reach her dream of personal improvement.

loans.use: pay her tuition, and purchase books and notebooks.

loans.name: Iuri

texts.en:
Iuri is 30 years old. He lives with his wife and 2 children (8 and 9 years old) in Kobuleti district. Iuri is unemployed now and the family lives in poverty. 

Iuri wants to start his own business and requested a loan. The Start-Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 1,500 GEL. 

With the received credit he will purchase a used car and will start a taxi business. He will transport people and will generate income. This will give him a chance to improve the living conditions of his family, Iuri awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a car and start a taxi business.

loans.name: Martir Enrique

texts.es:
Motivado por la idea de ayudar a los demás, Martir dejó su ciudad hace 6 años para poder estudiar medicina. De donde él viene, los costos en atención médica son muy altos y no todas las personas pueden recibir asistencia en la salud, de calidad, es por eso que este solidario joven de 30 años de edad, tiene como meta poder convertirse en un doctor que atienda a este sector de habitantes que no pueden costear este servicio vital como lo es la medicina. 
Apoyado por su madre, ha ido saliendo adelante en el largo camino de su carrera universitaria. Ahora que ha llegado a la recta final y está a un paso de cumplir su gran sueño para egresar como médico general. Es por eso que el deposita sus esperanzas en Kiva a través de MiCrédito, solicitando un préstamo para pagar su curso de titulación. Así poder terminar con esta etapa de su vida y que le ayudara a cumplir el primero de sus muchos logros académicos. En un futuro planea especializarse en cirugía y desde esta especialidad desea trabajar en proyectos que apoyen el desarrollo social.
texts.en:
Motivated by the desire to help others, Martir left his hometown six years ago in order to study medicine.  Healthcare costs are very high where he comes from and not everyone can receive quality medical attention, which is why this thirty year old's goal is to become a doctor who cares for underserved populations who cannot afford medical care.  With the support of his mother, he has been able to get ahead in his college education, and he is not in the final stages and one step away from making his dreams come true.

For this reason, he is placing his hopes in Kiva and MiCrédito as he is seeking a loan to pay for a certification course.  This will allow him to finish this stage of his life, and it will help him reach the first of many academic achievements.  In the future, he plans on specializing in surgery and using this specialty to work on projects that support social development.

loans.use: pay for a certification course.

loans.name: Estrellas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESTRELLAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Julia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de lana de vicuña, venta de aguayos, venta de calzados, venta de libros, venta de verduras, venta de CD’s.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Julia es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia al observar que este negocio no existía en su zona decide implementarlo y generar recursos así como cuidad  sus hijos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de enlatados por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud, las capacitaciones y el crédito que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “ESTRELLAS” communal bank is staring their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Senkata regional office. It is composed of 9 members, led by a board of directors with Julia as President. The businesses of the members of the communal bank carry out are varied. Amongst them are: a neighborhood store, selling vicuña wool, the sales of aguayos (colorful woolen cloths), selling footwear, selling books, the sale of vegetables and the sales of CD's.

The loan will benefit all these micro-entrepreneurs one of whom is Julia. She indicated that she joined Pro Mujer 3 years ago during a massive promotion by the institute in her area. Today she has a neighborhood store. She said that she learned this business at the beginning on her own by observing that there was no business like this in her area. So she decided to open one and generate income to take care of her children.

The loan that she is now taking out is to increase her working capital (buying canned goods wholesale) that she will acquire at the wholesalers in the city of La Paz and later sell in her commercial space. This method of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically as she is married and has 3 children.

When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer she replied that she liked the health services, the training and the loans that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy canned goods wholesale.

loans.name: Mannie

texts.es:
Mannie tiene 46 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa familiar en una zona rural del distrito de Cayaltí que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Las actividades económicas principales que se desarrollan en este distrito son la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral como gallinas, patos, pavos, cuyes, entre otros, cuenta con 06 años de experiencia en el negocio y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales de ella. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de patos, gallinas, cuyes, entre otros animales, así como alimento balanceado para estos, el préstamo le ayudará a incrementar el stock de su negocio y de esta manera satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, lo que incrementará su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mannie, age 46, is in a civil relationship.  She lives in the family house in a rural area in the Cayaltí district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.  The main business activities in this district are agriculture, livestock, and commerce.

She raises and sells barnyard animals like hens, ducks, turkeys, and guinea pigs, among others.  She has six years of experience in the business, and she has fixed customers who provide her with very good personal references.

She is requesting the loan to buy more ducks, hens, and guinea pigs, among other animals.  She will also buy balanced feed for the animals.  The loan will help her to increase the stock in her business.  This way she will satisfy her customers’ needs.  This will increase her level of income and, therefore, will improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more ducks, hens, and guinea pigs, among other animals, and balanced feed for the animals.

loans.name: Papaya Group

texts.es:
Este grupo esta formado por tres mujeres emprendedoras: Nilska Jhajaira, vende productos de belleza y cosméticos por catálogos, Santos Benita, vende nacatamales en su vivienda y Maribel vende ropa usada. Todas pertenecen a la etnia miskita, viven en Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas. Las tres se han propuesto luchar para hacer crecer sus negocios, con el deseo de llegar a tener una mejor calidad de vida personal y de sus familias; se organizaron hace 6 meses para poder acceder a préstamos con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana. 

Maribel: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una señora amable de 44 años de edad, casada, tiene 6 hijos: dos de ellos son mayores de edad e independientes y 4 adolescentes que estudian su primaria y secundaria. Desde hace 2 años, vende ropa usada en el corredor de su casa de tambo de madera, con el propósito de contribuir con los gastos del hogar y en la educación de sus hijos. Esta solicitando financiamiento para comprar una paca mixta en Managua y así incrementar sus ingresos. Su sueño es ser una comerciante exitosa
texts.en:
This group is made up of three entrepreneurial women. Nilska Jhajaira sells beauty products and cosmetics from catalogs, Santos Benita sells nacatamales from her home, and Maribel sells used clothing.  All three women are of the Miskita ethnicity and live in Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas.  The three women have decided to strive to grow in their businesses with the goal of improving their and their families' quality of life.  The group was formed six months ago in order for them to access joint liability loans in Pana Pana.

Maribel is a member of the group, she is a kind, 44 year old woman.  She is married and has six children, two of whom are adults and four are teenagers who are in elementary and high school.  For the past two years, she has worked selling used clothing from her house's patio, with the purpose of contributing to the household finances and supporting her children's educations.  She is seeking a loan to purchase a package of mixed, used clothing in Managua in order to increase her earnings.  Her dream is to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: purchase a mixed pack of clothing.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is 52 years old and married with four children. Julita works very hard to provide for them.

Julita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Julita has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, cooking oil, eggs, coffee, cereals, detergent soap, etc. 

Julita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. May is 42 years old and has five children who are in school.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. May requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

May has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, May would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is 32 years old, married and has three children who are all in school, Eliza works very hard to provide for them.

Eliza runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, sugar, eggs, bread, detergent soap, noodles, etc.
 
Eliza requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, soft drinks, sugar, eggs, bread, detergent soap, noodles, etc. to sell.

In the future, Eliza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, soft drinks, sugar, eggs, bread, detergent soap, noodles, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Yolita

texts.en:
Yolita is 45 years old and married with seven children. With three children in school, Yolita works very hard to provide for them.

Yolita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like eggs, candies, condiments, canned goods  groceries, etc.

Yolita has been in this business for 7 years now. 

In the future, Yolita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like eggs, candies, condiments, canned goods  groceries.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a married woman who has been blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, she lives at their own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for over ten years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine lives in Gyumri town with her two school-aged children and mother-in-law. She is a divorced woman and teacher with five years of experience working at local school. Narine is a very lovely teacher in the school where she works due to her tireless work and nice attitude towards children.
 
Besides her work in the school, Narine also provides individual courses to her students from her house. To be able to organize her classes more efficiently, Narine asks lenders to support her with this loan, and help to purchase laptop. 

Her loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop needed for providing individual courses for students.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Norah, a hard-working, very honest and warm-hearted farmer who hails from the Kapsowar area of Kenya, an area that has one of the best weather patterns on earth that favors farming. Norah is the proud mother of lovely children that she really loves and adores and always protects. 

Norah’s upbringing was very challenging and because of this she promised herself that she would work hard and get out of the poverty situation. That is why she started farming 10 years ago and through farming she has been able to earn a decent income. Norah is the breadwinner in her family and this really pushes her to work hard so that her children will have a bright future and also her parents will have a comfortable life.

Norah is seeking a loan to start horticultural farming so that she can use the excess space on her land. She dreams of buying more land and increasing her horticulture business. Accessing funds is very difficult for a woman in Africa but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva, Norah is optimistic that her dream will be realized and her life will completely change. Through the income from horticultural farming, Norah will assure her children of a bright future and she will be able to pay tuition fees for her siblings who depend on her. 

Through your loan the promise of supporting small scale farmers will be achieved.

loans.use: To start horticultural farming.

loans.name: Phala's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Kandal province’s Kandal Stoeng district, Phala is aged 45 years and married with three children. To make a living and support her family, Phala and her husband have been farming rice as primary business for 24 years and she supplements the income by working as a garment worker. The current business earns them about 62,000 KHR per day.
 
This is the tenth micro loan for Phala  with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to request a loan, Phala will use her portion to buy rice seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to cultivate her rice to earn more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.en:
Lidia is requesting a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin to buy additional supplies to  keep in her store, including slippers, detergents, soaps, shampoos, ointments, clothes brushes, hair oils and other things to sell. 

She has been doing business since 2012 with her own working capital of $800. She has a shop of her business and she also sells in the market. Lidia also cultivate animals in her place like buffalo, cows, pigs, chickens, goats and dogs.

There are six members in the family including her four children and her husband, who is in agriculture. 

She wants to open a big store in the future so she is taking this loan to have a good management experience to improve her business. She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: To buy slippers, detergents, soaps, shampoos, ointments, clothes brushes, hair oils and other things to sell.

loans.name: Hub's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province, Hub is a 38-year-old widowed mother of one kid. Rice farming has been the main source of her family’s income for 20 years and to better support the family and help to earn more income, she also raises pigs. She can earn about 20,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs and manages to save about 13,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

Hub’s group consists of three members who live in the same village. She is in her first cycle with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan to plow the field to grow cassava to earn extra income. She hopes to grow her rice as well as her cassava fruitfully and healthily and also hopes to make more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to plow the field to grow cassava.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Maravy

texts.en:
Maravy is a 23-year-old single accountant who is working for a company in the city. She lives in the city of Phnom Penh in Cambodia. 

She has worked as an accountant since 2013, making an income of USD 8.33 each day. 

Marary is requesting a loan because she needs finances to pay the second-year tuition fees. The loan will help her to go through the second year at university successfully. 

After graduation, Maravy hopes to find a better job with a good salary.

loans.use: to pay the second-year tuition fees

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Perlita is 35 years old, and three of her children are currently in school.

Perlita has a general store business in the Philippines. Perlita requested an 11,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Perlita has been in this business for three years. In the future, Perlita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ilia

texts.en:
Ilia is 28 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and parents in Tbilisi, the capital of Georgia. His parents are employed and get a monthly salary, but Ilia wants to be involved in his own business.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 2,500 GEL. With the received credit he will start trading fruits and vegetables. He will purchase fruits and vegetables at wholesale prices and will resell with a price markup. This will give him a chance to generate his own income. Ilia awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin trading fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Pikria

texts.en:
Pikria is a 28-year-old married woman from the village Giorgitsminda. She lives with her husband, who generates the only source of income for family. He is a private vehicle artisan and gets an unstable income. There is a high unemployment rate in the region, and Pikria was unable to start her own activity. In order to do her part and give help to her husband, Pikria decided to start a family business and involve him in this activity. 

She couldn’t receive a loan from the local financial institutions because of their requirements to have business experience or stable revenue, until the Start Up program began, which is a joint product of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

With the requested amount, Pikria plans to purchase all the equipment and various kinds of vehicle oils to open a vulcanization service at a good location. Her husband will supervise the business and also will work there as an artisan. 

With the help of the loan, Pikria will get the chance to make a significant source of income for her family and make a better style of life.

loans.use: to make a family business and open an auto repair service

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a small village of Thmor Koul district, Battambang province, Mom is a 40-year-old married woman with three children. The three children are secondary school students. 

To support her family, Mom has been doing rice farming with her husband for 10 years. She also has a small grocery store at home. 

Mom has been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, for 10 cycles now. The previous loan has improved her family living condition considerably and her children are able to go to school. This time leading her group of two, she is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR each. Her purpose of the loan is to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her rice farm and to hire workers to plough it. 

She hopes that the loan continues to help her family financially.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 56 years old and married. Anecita works very hard to provide for them.

Anecita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, detergent soap, eggs, bread, candies, sugar, juice, etc. to sell.

Anecita has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, detergent soap, eggs, bread, candies, sugar, juice, etc. 

In the future, Anecita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, detergent soap, eggs, bread, candies, sugar, juice, etc. to sell

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is 29 years old and married with two children. Meriam works very hard to provide for them.

Meriam runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

Meriam has been in this business for 10 years now. 

In the future, Meriam would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional item to sell like canned goods, beverages, gorceries, etc.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Lucio, de 64 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y muy responsable dedicado totalmente a la agricultura.- Su grupo familiar está conformado por sus 2 hijos de 18 y 28 años de edad y una nieta de 6 años de edad, sus hijos le ayudan a realizar las labores agrícolas de preparación, siembra, fertilización, cosecha y pos-cosecha de granos básicos.

Lucio, siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura desde que trabajaba junto con su padre, cultivando maíz, frijol y maicillo.- Con la ayuda de su papá, ha aprendido mucho sobre cómo tratar los cultivos y así poder producir más.- Además, posee 5 vacas, que está alimentando para que cuando estén en producción, pueda tener una fuente de ingresos y pueda sacar productos lácteos derivados de la leche, para mejorar la alimentación de sus hijos.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar una vaca de producción, para elaborar quesos para la venta, ya que en esta época tienden a subir de precio y espera mejorar sus ingresos a través de la venta de lácteos.  

Su sueño es seguir cultivando granos básicos, para la alimentación de sus hijos.- Pero además quiere en un futuro comprar más ganado y así poco a apoco ir mejorando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Lucio, 64, is a hardworking and very responsible man who earns a living exclusively in agriculture.  His family is made up of his two children, ages 18 and 28, and a 6-year-old granddaughter.  His children help him with the preparation, planting, harvest, and post-harvest agricultural tasks growing basic grains.

Lucio has worked in agriculture since he worked with his father growing corn, beans, and millet.  He has learned a lot from his father about how to take care of a crop so it can produce more.  He also has five cows that he's feeding so that, when they're producing milk, he can make dairy products to have a source of income and to improve his children's nutrition.

He needs the loan to buy a dairy cow to make cheese to sell.  The price tends to go up this time of year and he hopes to improve his income by selling dairy products.

His dream is to keep on growing basic grains to feed his children.  He also wants to buy more cattle in the future so he can improve his income little by little.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Yoen

texts.en:
Yoen is aged 53 years and married with eight children. She is a rice farmer who has been in this business for 35 years to make a living, and her husband supplements the family’s income by working as a paid worker in a village. With the current business, she can earn about 29,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs and is able to save about 19,000 KHR each day for their future needs. 

This is Yoen’s first loan with VisionFund. She is applying for a loan of 4,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her current business to earn a larger income, and she also hopes to extend her current business.

Note: This picture is with her husband.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Enkhchuluun

texts.en: Enkhchuluun, 26 years old, lives with his parents and brother in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a plumber at a private firm since 2013. His brother studies at the university. He is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD to buy an electric car. The advantage of an electric car is that it emits harmless pollutants into the air and wastes less fuel. The borrower will use this environmentally friendly car for personal use such as driving between home and work.

loans.use: to buy an electric car.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.en:
Consuelo is single and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Consuelo requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc., for her food-production business.

Consuelo has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Consuelo would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc., for her food-production business

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Chizi has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling goat meat in the community. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business. 

With the loan of 50,000 KES that Chizi is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of goats for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goats for resale

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is a married mother and has children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over three years, she has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of limited seats and tables in her business.

With the loan of Kshs 100,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and tea leaves, as well as cooking fat, tables, and chairs for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and tea leaves, as well as cooking fat, tables, and chairs for her business

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah is 44 years old and has two children. Jonah is married and both of her children are in school.

Jonah is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Jonah has requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jonah has been raising pigs for one year now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Jonah would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita works hard to support her family. Emerita is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Emerita requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Emerita has been in this business for 12 years now.

Emerita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Gemma works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Gemma is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy fruits to sell in her food stall.

Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fruits to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Chajembe

texts.en:
Chajembe is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling goat meat.  She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business. 

With the loan of 50,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of goats for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goats for resale.

loans.name: Sophin's Group

texts.en:
Sophin is 28 years old and married with one daughter. She and her husband earn a living through raising pigs and working as paid workers, which they have done for almost ten years. Their current business earns them about 43,000 KHR per day and they manage to save about 25,000 KHR each day for their future needs. 

Sophin’s group consists of four female members who are just with VisionFund for this cycle. She is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy pig feed and more pigs to raise. She hopes to increase her current business to better her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and more pigs to raise

loans.name: Çlirim

texts.en:
Çlirim is 24 years old and single. He is living with his mother and sister, as his father has passed away. He is the main source of income and has had to stop his education in order to support his family. 

Starting at a very young age, he started to work, earning income by painting various buildings. He currently is working for a private construction company, but his salary is low and only enough to meet their daily needs. Therefore, when he is finished with his work, he does freelance and contract work painting as well. 

Although Çlirim's family has received some support from relatives in western European countries, the assistance is low and not reliable. He hopes in the future to be able to make enough money to provide for his family adequately and independently and to be able to start his own private business so he can employ others and continue with his education. 

Çlirim is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders for their support, helping him to buy working tools.

loans.use: to buy working tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothing for her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Matimtiman

texts.en:
Matimtiman sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan greatly established her business. She was able to purchase additional frozen goods and meat products, which were needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her to provide the educational expenses of her children and pay for their daily needs.

Matimtiman is very positive that she can improve her business if you will lend her an amount of 25,000 PHP. This new loan will be used to purchase additional meat and frozen products. Her customers will likely buy more items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also help her business to become viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Aside from growing her business, Matimtiman hopes that her family will have a better life someday. She is pretty sure that if she gives the best for her children's education, their lives will become more improved and successful. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional processed and frozen meat products.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a hardworking lady who lives in her house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Halima has operated a clothing, shoes and handbag-selling business, selling from home and door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

With the KES 25,000 loan Halima is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes and shoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes and shoes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Aniana

texts.en:
Aniana is 57 years old and married with five children.

Aniana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like beverages, eggs, canned goods, groceries, etc.

Aniana has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

Aniana aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like beverages, eggs, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Savorn's Group

texts.en:
Savorn is a resident of Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. She is 55 years old and married with three children. Her main sources of income are from rice farming and cassava plantation, which she has done for 35 years. She also works as a paid worker for extra income. She manages to save approximately 5 USD a day. 

Savorn has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for three loan cycles now, and as the leader of her group she is applying for a loan of 1,500,000 KHR. Her portion of the loan will be used to buy potash for her cassava plantation. Her goal is for her plantation to produce higher yields.

loans.use: to buy potash

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sreynin's Group

texts.en:
Sreynin is 26 years old and married with two children and she lives in a rural village of Kratie province’s Prey Prorsob district. She and her husband earn a living through planting rice, which they have done for eight years. To earn extra income, she also sells snacks. Their current business earns them about 20,000 KHR per day. 

Sreynin’s group consists of two female members who are just with VisionFund for this cycle. She is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland, and will also use a portion of it to spend on labor. She hopes to grow her rice successfully and increase her current business to better her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Song's Group

texts.en:
An elderly mother of three, Song is living with her children in a small village of Koh Sotin district, Kampong Cham province. After her husband passed away, she had to handle much more of the family burden. She has been a rice farmer for 41 years and it enables her to save around $7 USD a day. 

Twice, Song has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is leading a group of eight in order to apply for a loan of 11,200,000 KHR for the group. She intends to use her portion to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and oil for her rice farm. She hopes her rice farm will be productive.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and oil

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mlongo operates a grocery stall selling vegetables; she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing rental houses in the future. 

With the 10,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Lorn's Group

texts.en:
Fifty-one-year-old Lorn is married with seven children. Four of her children are living with her and her husband in a small rural village of Ponhea Krek district, Kampong Cham. 

For 31 years, she and her husband have been planting cassava and farming rice to support the family. They can save $5 USD daily. 

Lorn has been a member with Kiva’s partner VisionFund once before. Leading her group, she is applying for a 1,600,000 KHR loan for her cassava plantation. It will be used to buy potash and cassava for planting. She wishes that the cassava plantation will be fruitful.

loans.use: to buy potash and cassava for planting

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Nai's Group

texts.en:
Nai is a 22-year-old married woman with two young kids under the age of 6. She is living in Thbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. 

To finance the family, she has been planting cassava for 4 years. She can earn around 8 USD a day and is able to keep half of it for saving. 

Being a new member of VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and a leader of her group, Nai is applying for a 1,000,000 KHR loan for her cassava plantation. Her plan is to hire workers to weed the land for plantation. 

She hopes that her cassava plantation will give a higher yield.

loans.use: to hire workers to weed the land

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy raw material for her husband's shuttering work

loans.name: Seanghourn's Group

texts.en:
A villager in Koh Sotin district, Kampong Cham province, Seanghuon, is a 45 year-old widow with one child living with her. 

Together, they have been weaving Kroma, Cambodia’s traditional scarf, for 27 years. They manage to keep $5 (USD) in savings every day. During this time, Seanghuon has been with Kiva’s partner, VisonFund for two cycles. 

Seanghuon is now leading her group to seek a loan of 4,500,000 KHR for them. Her portion of the loan will be used to buy weaving supplies such as cotton thread and artificial colouring. She believes it will improve her family's financial condition to have a better living space.

loans.use: to buy cotton thread and artificial colouring

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Sokchea's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of Kratie province’s Prek Prorsob district, Sokchea is a 51-year-old married mother of four children. She and her husband have earned a living through farming rice for 33 years. To better support the family, her husband also works as a barber in a village. This current business earns her about 20,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day for the family's future needs. 

This is a group loan for Sokchea’s group. She has been a member of VisionFund for two cycles already, while the other member has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Her past loans have helped Sokchea to better support her family and increase her business. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Sokchea will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her current business and also hopes to make more income to improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Sineng's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in the Prey Prorsob district of Kratie province, Sineng is age 49 and married. She has six children. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for six years, and they supplement the family’s income by working as paid workers. Their current business earns them about 20,000 riels (KHR) per day, and they manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

This is a first micro loan for Sineng with VisionFund. She is leading her group to request a loan. She wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow her business and earn a larger income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy incense, fabrics and other merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Virgen De Copacabana Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL COPACABANA”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco. 
La socia es la Sra. Ghina, la socia tiene 26 años de edad  y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de refrigerios para los distintos clientes que le solicitan como jardines, la socia trabaja conjuntamente con su mama, la socia lleva buen tiempo con el negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día, siendo de esta manera que la socia sale adelante.
 La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como carnes, papas entre otros.
 Los otros socios se dedican a la venta de artesanía elaboración de refrigerios, venta de anticuchos, maestro constructor, brindando el servicio de taxi, agronomía.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to Virgen del Copacabana Communal Bank, located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

The member, Ghina, is 26 years old and single.  She alternates her daily activities with her business selling snacks to a variety of customers like kindergartens.  She works with her mother and has had the business for some time.  It's going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it every day, because it's how she gets ahead.

She's requesting the loan to buy meat, potatoes, and other ingredients.

The businesses of the other members are handicraft sales, snack sales, "anticucho" [kebab] sales, master builder, taxi services, and agriculture.

Ghina's grateful to those who share her dream through this loan, and she promises to make her payments by the deadline.

loans.use: to buy meat, potatoes, and other ingredients

loans.name: Margena

texts.en:
Margena is 43 years old. Margena works very hard to provide for her daily needs.

Margena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like eggs, canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

Margena has been in this business for 22 years now. 

In the future, Margena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like eggs, canned goods, beverages, groceries.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 32 years old and married. Jenelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jenelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Jenelyn has been in this business for 7 years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, shampoo, cereals, toothpaste, bath soap, etc. 

Jenelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity but not piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past four years, selling goat meat to the community. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business. 

With the loan of 50,000 KES she is requesting she wants to purchase a stock of goats for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of goats for resale.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lorna is 55 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Lorna has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Lorna requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Lorna has been in this business for a year. Lorna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

loans.name: Norma Arely

texts.es:
Norma, de 28 años de edad, solo tiene un hijo que aún vive con ella, ellos viven con su mamá y su hermana.

Norma, es una joven madre, que se dedica al negocio de venta de productos de belleza femenina y de ropa juvenil, este negocio lo realiza desde hace un par de años y fue su madre de quien aprendió el oficio.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar más productos para la venta, ya que viene una temporada fuerte y sus clientes ya comienzan a hacerle pedidos.

Norma, desea darle lo mejor a su pequeño hijo, para que crezca sano y que en un futuro estudie para que sea un excelente profesional.
texts.en: 28-year-old Norma has only a son who still lives with her, her mother and sister. Norma is a young mother whose business involves selling women's beauty products and children's clothing. She has been running her business for a couple of years, having learned about it from her mother. She needs the loan to buy more goods to sell, as a busy trading season is approaching and her customers have already started to place orders. Norma wants to do the best she can for her little boy, to ensure that he grows up healthy and will one day be able to study for a professional career.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is aged, 38; she is a responsible mother of five children living happily in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. As a return member, this is a repeat loan with BRAC; she has been taking loans according to the needs of her family.

Yasmeen belongs to a poor family and it is very difficult for her to fulfill all the household expenses at low earnings. Her husband owns a fish selling business. He has been alternating the nature of his business according to the weather; he sells fish in winter seasons. Nowadays, the winter season is going on, but he does not have money to buy different kinds of fish because the prices of fish have become inflated this past year. 

Therefore, Yasmeen requested a loan for her husband, so that he can buy different kinds of fish to carry on his business. Yasmeen is very impressed with this honourable support. She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of fish to carry on her husband's fish selling business

loans.name: Bopha's Group

texts.en:
Bopha is a 25-year-old married woman with one small kid under six years old. She is living with her family in Ponhea Krek district, Kampong Cham. 

She is a rubber tapping worker and has been planting her own rubber for 7 years. 

Bopha has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for three cycles now and she is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR for her rubber plantation. It is to buy fertilizer. 

She hopes the plantation will be more productive.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Savang

texts.en:
A resident of Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, Savang is 35 years of age and married with five children who are her dependents. She has been farming rice for 17 years, while her husband is a construction worker, to manage the family budget. 

This is her first time as a member with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She is requesting a loan to build a house. She hopes that her family can have a nicer house to live in.

loans.use: to build a house.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Vok

texts.en:
From Kandal Stoeng, Kandal province, Vok is an elderly mother of five. Two of her children are living with her. To earn a living, Vok has been a rice farmer for 33 years. 

Her first time with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, Vok is seeking for a loan to buy a motorbike to travel to work. She believes that with a motorbike, she can travel around more easily and it is much safer than walking, especially at night.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food to sell

loans.name: San Pablo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN PABLO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Huayopata, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convencion y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Valentina ella es casada y tiene 54 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de agricultura, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva café, plátanos y cacao,la socia tambien se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales como cuyes,patos y gallinas,la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m , el sueño de la socia es ampliar el terreno de cultivo y tambien ampliar el negocio de crianza de animales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar animales como patos,cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los animales.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de cafe, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de agricultura.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These people are members of the “SAN PABLO” communal bank, which is located in the district of Huayopata, in the La Convención province of Cusco department.

54-year-old Valentina is married with 4 children. She works in agriculture, growing coffee, bananas and cocoa on her plot of land. She also raises animals such as guinea pigs, ducks and hens. She fattens them and waits for them to grow and the sells them at various fairs. She works from 8am to 6pm and her dream is to expand both her land and her animal-rearing business. She is applying for the loan to buy animals such as ducks, guinea pigs and hens, as well as food for the animals. 

The other members of the group sell animals, coffee, groceries and agricultural produce.

Valentina is those who her helping her achieve her dream in this way and guarantees that she will make her repayments within the set period.

loans.use: to buy animals such as ducks, guinea pigs and hens, as well as food for the animals.

location.town: Sector san pablo/distrito de la convencion

loans.name: Dúo Gozo Y Paz Group

texts.es:
Dúo Gozo y paz
Formado por Zoila es originaria de San Martin Jilotepeque, Zoila se dedica desde hace más de siete años a la elaboración de bordados y tejidos a mano tales como: tapetes, cojines, servilletas, manteles, ropa para niños y mucho mas, ella solicita el prestamo para invertir más en su negocio para así obtener más ingresos y aumentar sus ganancias para apoyar a sus hijos dándoles estudio  y por eso solicitan el crédito para la compra de materia prima para tejidos.
texts.en:
Dúo Gozo y Paz [The Joy and Peace Duo] was formed by Zoila, who is a native of San Martin Jilotepeque.  Zoila has been hand embroidering and knitting for more than 7 years, making table runners, cushions, napkins, tablecloths, children´s garments, and much more.  

She is requesting the loan in order to invest more in her business, so that she can obtain more income and increase her earnings to support her children and provide them with an education. That is why she is requesting the loan for the purchase of raw materials for knitting.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for knitting.

loans.name: 020402240002 Liên Minh _ Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thực is 31 years old and she is married with three children. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. Thực is a fisherman. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Thực faces in her business is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more tools to catch fish for sale.

In 2006, Thực joined Thanh Hoa Fund (FPW) for Poor Women to improve her business. Thực has successfully repaid nine loans from FPW. Thực is the leader of a six member group, the 020402240002 Liên Minh - Hoằng Trường Solidarity Group. 

In the future, Thực hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more tools to catch fish for sale

loans.name: Datuna

texts.en:
Datuna is a 35-year-old married man. He lives in Zugdidi district with his wife and two children (4 and 6 years old). His wife is unemployed; she stays home and looks after the children. 

Datuna is an artisan. He has a workshop where he repairs cars and generates income. He has a good number of clients and they are satisfied with his services. Datuna decided to expand his activity and start additional business.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 3000 GEL. With the received credit, he will purchase used spare parts of different cars and will resell them in his workshop. He will also have spare parts to use on damaged cars and will be able to offer additional services to his clients. They will not have to go and purchase spare parts in different shops. 

Datuna thinks that the business will be profitable as he has experience in this field.

loans.use: to start trading with spare parts and offer his clients additional services

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 49 years old and has two children. Juliet is married, and one of her children is in school.

Juliet is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Juliet requested an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Juliet has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Juliet would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Gumercindo Antonio

texts.es:
Gumercindo, de 25 años de edad, está acompañado, tiene dos hijas y su pareja se dedica a los oficios del hogar y a la venta y compra de ganado.

A él le gusta vender y comprar ganado en los tiangues que se hacen en los pueblos cercanos, todo esto lo aprendió gracias a la enseñanza que le dio su padre.

Gumercindo, necesita el crédito para comprar un par de reses que ha visto en muy buenas condiciones.

Gumercindo, desea en el futuro ser dueño de su propia granja y ser uno de los mejores productores de El Salvador.
texts.en: 25-year-old Gumercindo is married and has 2 daughters. His wife looks after the home and buys and sells livestock. He likes to buy and sell livestock in the small markets in nearby towns.  He learned all he knows from his father. Gumercindo needs the loan to buy a couple of very healthy cows he has seen. In the future, he would like to own his own farm and be one of El Salvador's leading producers.

loans.use: to buy a couple of cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more tools for her husband's electrician work

loans.name: Nhóm 02_Thôn 2_Minh Châu Group

texts.en:
Mrs Gái operates a food stall selling vegetables. She is requesting a loan to purchase more vegetables to resell.

Gái is 33 years old and she is married with 3 children. Gái is the group leader of the Nhóm 02_thôn 2_Minh Châu solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. 

This is Gái's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Gái has been involved in this business for 3 years. The main hardship that Gái faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Gái hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to resell

loans.name: Merilene

texts.en:
Merilene works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Merilene requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for fifteen years now.

Merilene would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Jose Irene

texts.es:
José, está solicitando un nuevo un crédito para comprar repuestos para su vehículo propio para trasladar la mercadería de su negocio, además invertirá en la compra de hierro, cemento, cobre, etc., para seguir comercializando chatarra.
El préstamo anterior le ha permitido a José mantener la continuidad y mejoramiento de su negocio, se siente satisfecho por poder dar a su familia el sustento diario.
texts.en:
José is requesting a new loan to purchase replacement parts for his own vehicle, in order to transport his business’s merchandise.  Additionally, he will invest in the purchase of iron, cement, copper, etc., in order to continue selling scrap.  

The previous loan has allowed José to maintain the continuity and improvement of his business, and he feels gratified to be able to provide for his family every day.

loans.use: to purchase iron, cement, copper, etc., in order to continue selling scrap.

loans.name: Bon's Group

texts.en:
Bon is a 59-year-old married woman with seven children, living in a village in Srey Snom district, Siem Reap province. Bon has been a rice farmer for 39 years and she also raises a pig for sale. She is able to earn $5 US a day. 

Bon has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for 7 cycles, including this one. Leading her group of two, she is applying for a loan of 500,000 KHR each. Bon's portion of the loan will be used to buy a piece of land for rice farming. She hopes to keep expanding her rice field.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land for rice farming

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Fredis Antonio

texts.es:
Fredis, se dedica a trabajar en el campo cultivando maíz y en ocasiones realiza otro tipo de cultivo, ya cuenta con 30 años de tener su propio negocio, trabaja de lunes a sábado, vive con su familia la cual está formada por su esposa y cuatro hijos de 26, 23, 20 y 13 años de edad, por el momento no presenta dificultades en su negocio.
Invertirá en insumos agrícolas y preparación del terreno para sembrar maíz, el crédito será de ayuda para tener todo listo en la temporada de siembra, espera que su cosecha sea abundante pues así su familia tendrá mejor alimentación y el resto lo venderá para tener ingresos que serán de utilidad para cancelar la deuda y cubrir otras necesidades de su hogar.
Las aspiraciones que tiene Fredis son mantenerse trabajando para que sus hijos puedan aprender el oficio y que cada día pueda compartir con su familia un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en: Fredis works in the countryside, growing corn and, occasionally, other things. He has had his own business for 30 years and works from Monday to Saturday. He lives with his family: his wife and 4 children of 26, 23, 20 and 13 years of age. He currently has no problems where his business is concerned. He will invest in agricultural supplies and prepare his land for growing corn. The loan will help him to have all this ready by sowing time. He hopes that he will have a plentiful harvest so his family can have better food.  He will sell the rest to have some income will enable him to repay his debt and cover other household necessities. Fredis' ambitions are to continue working so that his children can learn the trade and so that every day he can share a better lifestyle with his family.

loans.use: invest in agricultural supplies and to prepare his land for growing corn.

loans.name: Los Pinares Group

texts.es:
José  Luis, tiene 30 años de edad, esta soltero, vive con sus padres, y reside junto a ellos en una aldea del municipio de Gracias, Lempira. Siempre ha producido café, y lo vende en pergamino en la misma zona. Lleva 10 años de experiencia que aprendió con su padre. Esta solicitando un préstamo por 5,000 Lempiras en forma grupal para comprar abono y pagar mano de obra para fertilizar su cultivo de café, con el propósito de mejorar la producción. Su sueño es crecer como productor de café y tener mas fincas. 
El grupo se llama Los Pinares, integrado por 3 miembros que se dedican a la agricultura y café,  viven en la misma comunidad. El préstamo grupal es por 16,000 Lempira para invertirlo en la asistencia de café. En la foto está a la izquierda José Humberto, José Luis y José Francisco a la derecha.
texts.en: 30-year-old José Luis is single and lives with his parents in a village in the Gracias region of Lempira department. He has always grown coffee and sells it in parchment in his home area. He has 10 years' experience, having learned his trade from his father. He is applying for a 5,000 Lempira collective loan to buy manure and pay workers to fertilise his land, with the aim of boosting his production. His dream is to expand his coffee-growing business and own more plantations. The group is called Los Pinares and is made up of 3 members who all live in the same community and  work in agriculture and grow coffee. The collective loan is for 16,000 Lempiras to invest in tending coffee plants. In the photo, José Humberto is the man on the left, then there is José Luis and, finally, José Francisco is on the right.

loans.use: to buy manure and pay for workers to fertilise his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en:
The man in the photo is Gagik. He is from Gyumri town where he lives with his wife. They have three children, but currently Gagik and his wife live alone: their two daughters are married and their only son serves in the army. 

Gagik has been involved in retail for many years. He trades in flowers in the Republic Square of Gyumri town. 

To be able to purchase new stock of flowers for his retail business, Gagik has applied for this loan. His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of flowers for his retail business

loans.name: Nhóm 44 - Trường Thi - P.điện Biên Group

texts.en:
For two years Hòe, a 64-year-old married mother of three, has been operating a food stall selling vegetables in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. Her main business hardship is a lack of capital.

In 2010, Hòe joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She is now the leader of the Nhóm 44 - Trường Thi - P.Điện Biên solidarity group, which consists of three members. Having borrowed and repaid five previous loans,  Hòe is requesting a new loan to purchase more vegetables to resell.

With her profits, Hòe hopes to build a new house, ensure that her business does well and that her family is healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to resell

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Milagros is 53 years old, and two of her children are still in school.

Milagros has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more packs to sell to her customers.

Milagros has been in this business for 23 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more packs to sell to her customers

loans.name: Thuận

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuận works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle.

Thuận is 43 years old and she is married with 3 children. Thuận lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Thuận joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thuận has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 

Thuận has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Thuận faces in her life is not having a biogas system. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a biogas system.

With her business profit, Thuận hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a biogas system.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en: Aileen, 42 years old, is married and has three children, two of them currently in school. Aileen is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 1 year and has previously borrowed 2 times from NWTF to sustain it. Aileen has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, Aileen would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en: Felisa, 60 years old, is married and has six children, one of them still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 8 years, Felisa has operated a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her business. Felisa would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Janeth has been in this business for 6 years. Janeth earns additional income from coconut wine vending.

Janeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman with three children, all attending school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Chizi has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling mats in the market. Her major business challenge is seasonality. Chizi has requested a loan of KES 10,000 to purchase stock of weaving materials for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of weaving materials for resale

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a young farmer from Chebiemit, a remote village in Kapsowar, Kenya, who has defied the common thinking among Kenyans that agriculture is for the older generation. She is a loving mother who has been farming for the last ten years so that she can supplement her income. 

Susan farms crops and keeps cattle and she enjoys farming a lot. Her biggest challenges are diseases and the lack of finances to improve her farming, which has caused her to seek a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase sheep. Her projections are that, by the end of the year, these sheep will have given birth to at least four other sheep. Through sheep-keeping, Susan will be able to get sheep wool, which is very expensive and fetches more profits. This translates into more income and improved living conditions for her family. Also, Susan will be able to sell sheep meat and sheepskin, which will increase her income. The profits will be used to repay the loan on time and to grow the business.

loans.use: to buy a quality breed of sheep

loans.name: Maychel

texts.en: Maychel, 25 years old, is married and has one child. She works very hard to provide for her family. For the past 2 years, Maychel has run a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell. In the future, Maychel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
For the past year, Amina has operated a cosmetics shop business, her potential customers being town dwellers and neighbors, especially women. She is requesting a loan to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions to expand her business.

Amina owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. Amina dreams of expanding her business to meet her family's basic needs. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions

loans.name: Jose Saul

texts.es:
José, con el préstamo anterior ha tendido materiales de calidad para seguir realizando su trabajo en la foto estudio, manifiesta que sus ingresos han mejorado un poco, su familia ha tenido que atravesar  una situación muy dolorosa al fallecer su padre.
Está optando por un nuevo crédito para comprar una cámara fotográfica moderna, al mejorar su equipo de trabajo tiene oportunidad de brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes y seguir cuidando del bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
With his previous loan, Jose was able to obtain quality materials to continue working in his photo studio. He says that his income has improved quite a bit. His family recently went through a painful situation after his father died. 

He would like to request a new loan to buy a modern camera, as updating his work equipment gives him the chance to provide a good service to his customers and to continue ensuring his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy a modern camera, as updating his work equipment will allow him to provide a good service to his customers.

loans.name: Basri

texts.en:
Basri wants to thank all of the lenders for their previous support. 

He was able to purchase a cow with his loan and reduced the cost to provide milk and dairy products for his family. He has been able to sell the excess milk locally and increase his income as well. He is still doing well in his agricultural business and has already been able to start raising calves to sell when they are older at profit. 

Now he is requesting a loan to purchase food for the calves. His goal is to continue to expand his farm and his business, making it successful enough to give his family a much better life. He wants to thank all of the lenders for their continued support.

loans.use: To purchase food for the calves

loans.name: Sandra Lisseth

texts.es:
Sandra, de 30 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive junto a su mamá y es con ella con quien comparte sus gastos, tiene tres hijos, de los cuales dos ya van a la escuela.

Sandra, ha trabajado alrededor de 5 años en la venta de motocicletas y actualmente, trabaja como administradora de una tienda de motocicletas en la ciudad.

Sandra, necesita el dinero del crédito para colocar una pequeña tienda, para que su madre la administre, ya que últimamente ha estado un poco enferma y Sandra, ya no quiere que su madre se esfuerce demasiado y de esta manera ella ya no se cansara demasiado porque trabajará desde su casa.

Sandra, planea seguir trabajando para darles a sus hijos, un mejor porvenir del que ella tuvo en su juventud.
texts.en:
30-year-old Sandra is a single mother. She lives with her mother, with whom she shares her expenses. She has three children, two of which are already in school.

Sandra has worked for about 5 years selling motorcycles and currently is the manager of a motorcycle store in her city. 

Sandra is requesting this loan to open a small convenience store that will be administered by her mother. Her mother has been a bit ill recently and Sandra does not want her to work very hard anymore. The convenience store will allow Sandra's mother not to get too tired as she will work at home. 

Sandra plans on continuing to work to provide a better future to her children.

loans.use: to open a small convenience store.

loans.name: Paul Nilo

texts.es:
Los esfuerzos, trasnochadas y sacrificios siempre valen la pena cuando se trata de estudios, porque son la única herramienta segura de mejorar la calidad de vida de las personas. Paul es consciente de ello, pues siempre ha tenido marcada su meta, ser un gran odontólogo. Ahora está a un paso de finalizar su carrera e iniciar la etapa laboral que todo profesional vive en algún momento. 

Paul solicita el crédito para cancelar el curso de titulación y cumplir con su sueño.  También, desea especializarse en ortodoncia o endodoncia, y a largo plazo poner una clínica dental.  Este joven entusiasta de solo 23 años, insta a la juventud a esforzarse por sus sueños porque igual que él pueden salir a delante.
texts.en:
Extra efforts, all-nighters, and sacrifices are always worth it when it come to studies because studies are the only sure way to improve one’s quality of life.  Paul is well aware of this, because he has always counted his goal as becoming a great odontologist.  Now he has reached the last step in completing his degree and entering the working era that any professional lives in.

Paul is asking for a loan to pay off his degree fees and accomplish his dream.  He also hopes to specialize in orthodontics and endodontics, and in the long run, to open a dental clinic.  This enthusiastic young man of only 23 years urges young people to make an effort reaching for their dreams because, just like him, they can get ahead.

loans.use: to pay off the fees associated with getting his degree

loans.name: Natia

texts.en:
Natia is a 32-year-old married woman from the village of Mokhisi. She lives with her husband and two school-aged daughters.

Natia generates income from selling agricultural products at the local market. She cultivates family-owned land and harvests cereals. The family lives in a bad economic condition, as they have only seasonal income and have social assistance from local government.

In order to make an additional source of income and somehow improve the living condition of her family, Natia decided to start a family business and involve her husband in this activity. She couldn’t receive a loan from the local financial institutions because of their requirements to have stable revenue, until the Start-Up program, which is a joint product of Kiva and Credo, began. The Start-Up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

With the requested amount, Natia plans to purchase a car and involve her husband in a taxi business. He will serve local people and transfer them in the other districts through the country.

With the help of the loan, Natia will get the chance to make a significant source of income for her family and make a better style of life and a good education for her daughters.

loans.use: to make an additional source of income and start a taxi business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: Justina, 62 years old, is widowed and has six children. Justina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years and has previously borrowed twice from NWTF to sustain it. Justina has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, Justina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman who owns a house that has piped water but no electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.
 
Mwanasiti has operated a tailoring business for the past 4 years, making women's and men's suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. Mwanasiti wants to use this KES 50,000 loan to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
