Kadzo  is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge in the business is high cost of transportation.

With the loan of Kes 20,000, she wants to purchase 20 bags of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 20 bags of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes, 52 years old, is married and has two children, one of them still in school. Lourdes is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year and has previously borrowed twice from NWTF to sustain it. Lourdes has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs. Lourdes would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is married and has three children, all attending school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Chizi has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling goat meat in the community. Her major business challenge is transportation. Chizi is requesting a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase stock of goats for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goats for resale

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman and has been blessed with children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a fish selling business for over ten years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish and a cooler for her business. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish and a cooler for her business

loans.name: Argam

texts.en:
Argam lives in the town of Kapan with his mother and sister. He has been driving taxi in Kapan and nearby communities for five years. The car which he drives is damaged and needs to be repaired. Argam has applied for this loan to pay for car repairs and to purchase tires. 

Argam's loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for car repairs and to purchase tires

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel, de 24 años de edad, es un joven que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser trabajador y responsable, está acompañado y tiene un hijo.

Manuel, tiene alrededor de 4 años de trabajar en una granja de su comunidad y es así como le ha dado lo necesario a su familia.

El necesita el crédito para comenzar a construir su casa, ya que solamente así podrá darle un lugar más seguro para vivir a su familia.

El deseo de Manuel es continuar trabajando, hasta lograr tener construida su casita y ver crecer a su hijo.
texts.en:
Manuel, age 24, is a young man who has always been known to be responsible and hard-working.  He is in a relationship and has a child.

Manuel has been working on a farm in his community for about four years; this is how he gives his family what they need.

He needs this loan to begin to build his house, because this is the only way he will be able to give his family a safer place to live.

Manuel’s desire is to keep working until he manages to build his little house and sees his son grown up.

loans.use: to begin to build his house

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
This is Hasmik. She is a lovely mother of two children and is a  teacher with seven years of experience.  Besides working at local school in Gyumri town, Hasmik also works at home.  She provides individual courses to students preparing for entrance exams.

Hasmiik has applied for his loan to be able to purchase a laptop computer needed for organizing her classes effectively. Her loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions, to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for laptop needed for providing individual classes to students

loans.name: Beverly Julissa

texts.es:
El apoyo de su abuela y sus tíos ha sido fundamental para que Beverly, pueda cumplir su sueño de ser Odontóloga. Meta  que desde infancia ha tenido marcada; porque en ese entonces admiraba a su madrina que ejercía esa profesión. Esta joven de 22 años se esforzó y aprovecho la oportunidad que le brindo su familia de acceder a la educación superior y hoy está a punto de finalizarla, para convertirse en toda una profesional.   

Beverly solicita el crédito para cancelar los trámites de titulación, lo cual será de mucho provecho, porque al ser egresada podrá comenzar a trabajar en su campo laboral. Además, planea estudiar una especialidad en maxilofacial y poner una clínica dental.
texts.en:
The support of her grandmother and her uncles and aunts has been essential for Beverly to achieve her dream of being a dentist. She has dreamed of this since childhood, because at the time she admired her godmother, who was a dentist.

This 22-year old young woman worked hard and made the most of the opportunity given to her by her family to access higher education, and today, she is about to complete her studies and become a professional.

Beverly is requesting this loan to pay for her degree certificate. This will be very useful, because once she has graduated, she can begin working. She also plans to carry out further studies in maxillofacial surgery and set up a dental clinic.

loans.use: to pay to get her degree certificate.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his vehicle and register it for use as a taxi.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 49 years old and married.  She has five children.

Gina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell, like canned goods, soft-drinks, noodles, coffee, sugar, milk, spices, etc.

Gina has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Gina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell, like canned goods, soft-drinks, noodles, coffee, sugar, milk, spices, etc

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 59 years old and has seven children. She is married and has two children who are still in school.

Merlinda is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Merlinda has been in pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Merlinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Irish

texts.en: Irish, 28 years old, is married and has three children, one of them still in school. Irish works very hard to provide for her family. For the past 4 years, Irish has run a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock such as canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, coffee, sugar, milk, spices, etc. to sell. Irish would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock such as canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, coffee, sugar, milk, spices, etc. to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 64 years old and married.  She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Mary requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Mary has been farming for eight years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine is 38 years old and she lives with her nice family in Ijevan in the Tavush region. Narine now works as an administrator of a hotel in her native city. They have two sons; the elder son is now in the army passing his military service and the youngest is still in school. Narine’s husband has a track on which he makes cargo transfers around his region. He works by order and sometimes his work lasts all day long, driving without having a rest. So this kind of tense work already caused harm to the health of Narine’s beloved husband. Unfortunately now he has serious problems with his heart; particularly heart failure.

Narine is asking for this loan since her husband must have urgent heart surgery by the doctor’s direction. She sends thanks beforehand and hopes to be supported in such a serious problem which is very important for all her family.

loans.use: to pay for her husband's urgent heart surgery

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva works hard to support her family.  She is married, has seven children, and has a ready to wear business in the Philippines. Eva has been in this business for 2 years now, and also earns additional income from food vending.

Eva requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more ready to wear products like pants, shirts, t-shirts, slippers, etc.  She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more ready to wear products like pants, shirts, t-shirts, slippers, etc.

loans.name: Levon

texts.en:
Levon has already been providing taxi service for five years. He is not married and lives with his parents, brother and sister in Gyumri town.

Levon is an enthusiastic and hardworking man who does his best to sustain his family's living. He has applied for this loan and asks lenders for support. Levon needs this loan to renovate his car and purchase new tires. His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to renovate his car and purchase new tires.

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en:
Mupa is married and has four school aged children.  She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Mupa has operated a business of selling paraffin for use in cooking to neighbors.  She faces a challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan of 50,000, she wants to establish rental houses, to purchase cements and sand for construction. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cements and sand for construction.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann, 29, is a small-scale farmer who specializes in horticulture. She is based in a small village called Olenguse, near Nandihills, Kenya. This charming mother has been doing agriculture on her small, fertile piece of land for 10 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops. Ann is seeking a loan to expand her horticulture farm. Her biggest challenge over the years as a farmer has been the lack of adequate capital. It is very hard for small farmers to save enough capital for expansion, since farming is marred with all sorts of external risks, such as climatic conditions, pests and diseases, political instability, fluctuation of prices and high costs of inputs. Because of these factors, the sure way farmers can obtain adequate capital is through leveraging their businesses. With your loan investment, Ann is going to expand her horticultural farm in order to increase its output. If and when the investment pays off, Ann will plow the profits back into the farm and increase her asset base.

loans.use: to expand her farm

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
The agriculture sector accounts for forty-five percent of Kenya's gross domestic product. Despite the importance of agriculture to Kenya and its economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as high-risk. For this reason, farmers in Kenya remain underserved by financial institutions. Juhudi Kilimo is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Kenyan farmers.

Meet Margaret, an ever-smiling, hardworking, and honest mother who is 38 years of age! She hails from the Kapsowar area of Kenya. She is the proud mother of school-going children. She loves and treasures her children and will go the extra mile to make sure that they are comfortable.

Margaret’s primary sources of income come from selling milk, crop farming, and poultry farming. Through these ventures, she has been able to earn a decent income. She is a very determined and dedicated farmer who has been farming for ten years, and throughout, she has never regretted going into farming. This humble mum has been making profits, but not everything has been a bed of roses. She still faces financial challenges.

Because the Kapsowar area has proven a ready market for sheep farming, she is requesting a loan to buy a sheep. Through the loan, she plans to buy a merino sheep. Merinos are regarded as having some of the finest and softest wool of any sheep. Through the loan, she will increase her income from wool and meat-selling. She will also benefit from the manure, which will increase the fertility level of her farm.

loans.use: to buy a quality breed of sheep.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina, de 52 años de edad, está acompañada y vive junto a su esposo, su hijo, su nuera y un nieto, todos trabajan para ayudarse mutuamente en las actividades de la casa.

Paulina, tiene una pupusería en su casa y también vende frutas a los estudiantes de las escuelas que quedan cerca.

Paulina, necesita el crédito para comprar insumos para su pupusería, para que sus ingresos puedan subir un poco más ahora que ya comenzó la temporada escolar.

Paulina, busca consolidar su estado económico mediante la estabilidad de su negocio y de esta manera ayudar a su familia a superarse.
texts.en:
Paulina, age 52, lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and grandson. They all work together to take care of the home. 

Paulina has a pupusa business in her house and also sells fruit to students from the nearby schools. 

Paulina needs the loan to buy supplies for her pupusa business, so her income can grow a bit now that the school year has started. 

Paulina is seeking to solidify her financial status by stabilizing her business, and in that way help her family get ahead.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her pupusa business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
From Cavite, Philippines, Joseph is married and has children. He is employed in a garment factory in Cavite through the auspices of the Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT). Joseph works as a tailor, sewing clothing according to the company or client’s demands. He uses a sewing machine and other stitching machines, as well as handstitches hems and linings.

One of the main dilemmas of employees like Joseph is meeting family expenses without access to savings or credit. Workers can become heavily indebted to money lenders, who take their ATM cards as loan collateral. 

For this reason, Joseph is asking for your assistance to help him circumvent loan sharks. He has previously accessed loans through CCT and had no problem repaying them since the loan payments were automatically deducted from his paycheck. He is seeking a 12,000 PHP loan to use as additional capital, which he needs to buy groceries for a general store.

Joseph wants his family to be always happy and healthy. He looks forward to your positive response and says any amount will surely be of great help. 

CCT works to provide local communities with a trained labor force and equipped with the skills required for employment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative assists its members in acquiring those skills necessary for quality jobs, cultivating savings consciousness and providing decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs include Professional Staff Services, Workers Guild Development, Enterprise Development and Consultancy Services.

CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for factory workers such as Levita before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions, spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and after-work hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to buy groceries for a general store.

loans.name: Sarat'group

texts.en:
Sarat was selected to be group leader for a loan requested from Maxima.  In the group there are two members and they are in a village in Phnom Penh.
1- Sarat (pictured) is 40 years old, lives at Chroy Changva district, Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She has been married since 1994 and has two daughters. They are garment factory workers.
Sarat has sold roast chicken for seven years, while her husband has been in the same job for seven years.  She would like to apply for a $300 loan. 

2-Sophea (pictured) is 28 years old, lives at Chroy Changva district, Phnom Penh Cambodia. She has been married since 2004, has two sons and four daughters. They are young and attending school.
Sophea has sold roast chicken for two years, while her husband has been in the same job for seven years .She would like to apply for a loan of $300 to purchase materials for her business.

Photo: Sarat on the left and Sophea on the right.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her daughters to take to their work, and materials for her business.

location.town: Chroy Changva district Phnom Penh city

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
From Cavite, Philippines, Rosemarie is married and has a child. She is employed in a garment factory in Cavite through the auspices of the Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT). Rosemarie works as a seamstress, sewing clothing according to the company or client’s dictates. She uses a sewing machine and other stitching machines as well as handstitching hems and linings.

One of the main dilemmas of employees like Rosemarie is meeting family expenses without access to savings or credit. Workers can become heavily indebted to money lenders who take their ATM cards as loan collateral. 

For this reason Rosemarie is asking for your assistance to help her circumvent loan sharks. She has previously accessed loans through CCT and had no problem in repaying them since the loan payments were automatically deducted from her paycheck. She is seeking a 15,000 PHP loan to redeem their foreclosed house.

Rosemarie dreams of giving her family a better future. She looks forward to your positive response and says any amount will surely be of great help. 

CCT works to provide local communities with a trained labor force and equipped with the skills required for employment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative assists its members in acquiring those skills necessary for quality jobs, cultivating savings consciousness and providing decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs include Professional Staff Services, Workers Guild Development, Enterprise Development and Consultancy Services.

CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for factory workers such as Levita before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions, spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and after-work hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: To recover their ownership of their residential house.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is a woman with the spirit for work, and she resides in a remote village in the Molo area of Kenya. This is a region with good weather patterns that favor crop and animal farming. She resides with her husband and they are blessed with a lovely family. 

Judy has been actively involved in mixed farming for the past ten years and she sells milk, eggs and various varieties of food crops at a local market and to her neighbors.She also keeps sheep. One big challenge that Judy faces is lack of farm supplies, such as fertilizer and modern farming equipment. 

She is kindly requesting a loan to buy farm supplies. With the loan, she will be able to buy good fertilizer, which will boost her crop production and hence increase income levels. This loan will turn Judy’s life around. All that she waits for is your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Prescila

texts.en:
Prescila is 63 years old, married and has nine children.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Prescila requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feed for her pigs.

Prescila has been raising pigs for seven years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She earns additional income from a tailoring business.

In the future, she wants to save enough to provide a secure future for her family

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Roberto William

texts.es:
Roberto, necesita ayuda con más capital para poder comprar insumos agrícolas, algunos repuestos para la bomba achicadora y pagar obreros para preparar el terreno en el que cultiva plátanos, maíz y pipían, esta inversión le permitirá cuidar de sus cultivos y tener un equipo de riego en buenas condiciones.
Al invertir el crédito anterior le ha generado múltiples beneficios como lo son una mejoría en su situación económica, ha adquirido una motocicleta para facilitar su desplazamiento, su área de cultivo actualmente es más grande y su familia tiene un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Roberto needs help in the form of more capital to buy agricultural inputs and spare parts for his water pump, and to pay for labourers to prepare the ground in which he grows bananas, corn and pipian. This investment will allow him to look after his crops better, and keep his irrigation equipment in good condition.

Investing his previous loan brought him multiple benefits such as an improvement in his economic situation, he has purchased a motorbike to facilitate his travel, his current plot of land is bigger and his family have a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs, spare parts for the

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in corn, lime, firewood, and propane gas.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit is from Kapan, where he lives with his wife and two sons (ages 12 and six years old).
 
Davit runs a bakery. He makes Armenian national bread called "lavash" in his small bakery. To be able to purchase flour for bread production (85 pockets), Davit has applied for this loan. His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Davit hopes for lenders' support and their goodwill to support his small bakery in developing further.

loans.use: to pay for flour.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina, de 49 años de edad, es una señora muy trabajadora y emprendedora, ya que tiene una gran experiencia en los negocios de comida.- Actualmente, está acompañada y vive con sus 2 hijos, uno de 23 años de edad y una niña de 15 años que está estudiando.

Catalina, tiene 14 años de experiencia en el área gastronómica, ofreciendo todo tipo de tortas con diferentes ingredientes, en su municipio es bien reconocida por la calidad de sus tortas, es por eso que la prefieren sus clientes.

El dinero lo necesita para comprar materia prima para sus tortas y remodelar su local, para que su negocio sea más atractivo a la vista de los clientes. 

Catalina, quiere en un futuro tener un negocio más grande y un local propio, porque actualmente está es bien caro rentar un local.
texts.en:
Catalina, 49, is a very hard-working, enterprising lady, with a lot of experience in the restaurant business. She lives with her partner and their two children, a 23-year-old and a 15-year-old girl who is studying.

Catalina has 14 years’ restaurant experience, offering all kinds of sandwiches with different ingredients. She is well known in her town for the quality of her sandwiches, and that is why her customers prefer her.

She needs the money to purchase ingredients for her sandwiches, and to refurbish her shop so that it will look more attractive for her customers. 

In the future Catalina wants to have a bigger business and a shop of her own, because nowadays, renting a shop is very expensive.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her sandwiches and refurbish her shop.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia and her son live in Kapan town. Her son is an army officer and Lilia herself is a hairdresser. She has worked at a local beauty salon for two years. 

Lilia has applied for this loan to purchase materials and accessories needed for her hairdressing service. This will greatly help her to organize her work and provide better conditions to her customers. 

Lilia's loan loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions, to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for materials and accessories needed for hairdressing service

loans.name: Saroen

texts.en:
Saroen is 31 years old, living with her husband and two children in a rural village of the Kos Krolor district. One of her children is in school while another one is too young for school. Rice farming is the only main source of her family’s income, which she and husband have been doing for nine years.

This is the third loan for Saroen with VisionFund. Now she is applying for another loan to buy rice seeds for her farming business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to earn more crops from her business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds for her farming business

loans.name: Vong

texts.en:
Vong, aged 30, is living in a rural village of the Kos Krolor district with four dependent children, all of whom are still in school. She and her husband are farmers who have been growing rice for 14 years. The current business earns her about 37,000 KHR per day.

This is the third loan for Vong with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and seed for her farmland. She hopes to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seed for her farmland

loans.name: Los Leones De Umamarca Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS LEONES DE UMAMARCA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Paucartambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Modesta ella es conviviente y tiene 46 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de cereales, la socia vende maíz, trigo y quinua, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar trigo, maíz y quinua.
	
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de cereales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the community banking group, “LOS LEONES DE UMAMARCA”. This group is located in the district of Paucartambo, which belongs to the province of Paucartambo in the department of Cusco.

The member named Modesta is easy-going. She is 46 years old and has 3 children. The member works in her business selling grains. She sells corn, wheat and quinoa. The member works from 8:00 a.m to 5:00 p.m. She has been in this business for 5 years and she's doing well. Her dream is to have a commercial space where she can sell the grains. The member is requesting a loan to buy wheat, corn and quinoa. 

The other members have a business selling animals, grains, prepared foods and one has a convenience store. 

The member appreciates anyone who participates in this dream through Kiva and promises to comply with making her payments in the established timelines.

loans.use: To buy wheat, corn and quinoa.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel Angel tiene 28 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia junto a su esposa e hijo en el distrito de Cayaltí que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral como cerdos, cuyes, gallinas, patos, entre otros. Además tiene un vehículo mototaxi en el cual brinda servicio de transporte en su distrito y comunidades cercanas. El préstamo será para realizar reparaciones en su vivienda ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, con esto Miguel Angel espera tener en mejores condiciones su vivienda lo que le va a permitir llevar una vida más comoda y con esto mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel Angel is 28 years old, has a partner, and lives in his own home with his partner and son in the district of Cayaltí located in Chiclayo province, Lambayeque province, on the northern coast of Peru. He lives in a community dedicated to trade, agriculture and livestock.

He makes a living rearing and selling farm animals such as pigs, hens, ducks and others. He also has a motorbike taxi with which he provides transportation services in his district and nearby communities. 

He will use the loan to make repairs to his home, as it is currently in a bad state of repair. Miguel Angel hopes that this will improve the condition of his home, which will allow him to live a more comfortable life and improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to make repairs to his home, as it is currently in a bad state of repair.

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en:
Vardan lives in the frontier village Sevkar, in Tavush region. This region is very common for sheep breeding and Vardan’s family is also engaged in this business. All of his family -- his father and his young wife -- greatly help Vardan, both in farming and other agricultural activities. 

On his farm, Vardan has 20 sheep, 20 lambs and 15 chickens. From his farm, Vardan sells a great range of farm products, such as mutton, lamb, cheese made of sheep's milk, eggs and also the harvest of his plot of land, such as potatoes, tomatoes, peppers and beans, and fruit, such as apples, pears and plums. Varden sells half of his farm products through retailers, and also to his fellow villagers. 

Vardan runs farming and also works as a turner. As farming is the most beloved occupation for him and the main source of income for his family, he dreams of making it a larger business and richer with cattle.
 
This loan Vardan plans to use for the purchase of ten more sheep, since he is seriously engaged in sheep breeding and making his farm larger.

loans.use: to buy ten more sheep.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is married and has six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has owned a food stall business, selling to neighbors and town residents. She faces a major challenge of fluctuation in number of clients, hence goods perishing and leading to losses.

With the 40,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking oil. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Tazmin

texts.en:
Tazmin is a married woman and has children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water.

She has operated a photography business for the past three years, taking photographs at functions and in the neighborhood. She faces a major challenge of seasonality, especially when no functions are held, resulting in less business.

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase a new photo machine for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans in order to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new photo machine for her business.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman. She owns a house that has water but not electricity.

Mariam has operated a water vending business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to have big water storage in the near future.

With the KES 30,150 she wants to purchase a water tank for storing water for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank for storing water for resale

loans.name: Nzara

texts.en:
Nzara is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past six years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors waiting too long to repay for goods taken on credit.

With the loan of 50,000 KES she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own home that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop for one year, selling goat meat in the community. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan of 30,000 KES that she is requesting, she wants to purchase goats for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans in order to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats for resale.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
When life gives you lemons, you could complain about it or else make lemonade. Mercy, an enterprising 25-year-old farmer from the Salama, Nandihills area of Kenya, chose the latter. She is a hardworking and energetic farmer. For the past five years, she has been a farmer, gaining a lot of practical experience in doing so. With her farming income, she has always assured her family of a decent meal and other basic needs. 

Mercy is now applying for a 30,000 KES loan through Juhudi Kilimo to buy another posho mill (which grinds maize grain) that is more reliable and stronger. The Salama, Nandihills area is served by only one diesel posho mill (operated by Mercy) that keeps breaking down. With the loan, she will be able to offer a solution to the people in her area. 

Being a woman and accessing funds in Africa is very challenging, but Mercy feels relieved knowing there are institutions, such as Kiva, that help enterprising women like her. She is very disciplined with her finances and hopes that through her accumulated profits, she will be able to improve her living conditions and also secure the future of her children.

loans.use: to buy another posho mill.

loans.name: Sophorn's Group

texts.en:
Sophorn is 34 years old and married with two children, who are still in school. She lives in a rural village in the Thala Borivath district, where crop farming is a common way to make a living. Like other villagers, rice farming and growing cassava have been her family’s main source of income for ten years. 

Sophorn’s group consists of three members who are all female. Sophorn has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle. The past loan has helped her family with obtaining sufficient food and helped to better support the business. 

Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. She wants to use her portion to buy pigs to raise in order to earn additional income for her family. She hopes to earn more income so as to have decent house for living in.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise in order to earn additional income for her family.

location.town: Steung Treng Province, Thala Barivat District

loans.name: Zebojon

texts.ru: Зебочон женщина 45 лет, замужем, мать четверых детей. Зебочон  после окончания школы вышла замуж , и занималась только домашними делами. Её муж работает таксистом, поэтому ему было сложно содержать и свою семью и родителей. Поэтому Зебочон решила открыть свой бизнес. На накопленные деньги она сняла в аренду помещение на рынке и начала продавать овощи. Сейчас у нее много клиентов, которые закупаются именно в ее магазине. Её старшая дочь помогает ей во всем. Несмотря на это Зебочон приходится сложно, так как кроме работы на рынке, она должна делать и работу по дому. Зебочон в скором времени планирует расширить свой бизнес, закупить товар для продажи, но у нее нет полной суммы денег. Поэтому она обратилась в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой.
texts.en:
Zebojon is 45 and married with four children. She got married right after finishing school and worked only on domestic chores. Her husband works as a taxi driver and it was hard for him to provide for both his parents and his family. Therefore Zebojon decided to start her own business. She used her savings to rent a space at the market and started selling vegetables. Now she has a lot of customers who shop specifically in her store. Her oldest daughter helps her with everything. Despite this, it has become difficult for Zebojon, because besides the work at the market, she has to keep up with work at home, too. 

In the near future, Zebojon plans to expand her business by buying goods for sale, but she doesn't have the full amount of money. Therefore she has turned to Arvand for financial support.

loans.use: to expand her retail business

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru: Чамшед  молодой мужчина женат, имеет 3-х детей  Чамшед занимается пошивом чехлов для автомашины. Его жена также является портнихой, они открыли семейный бизнес и хотят его расширить. Так как у них всего 2 швейной  машинки,  и обе для шитья одежды им необходимо более профессиональная швейная машинка, так как машинки которые у них имеется старые и всегда выходят из строя во время пошив чехлов.  Обсудив со своей женой Чамшед решил получить кредит для приобретения машинки , что бы можно было легче и качественней  шить чехлы.
texts.en: Jamshed is a married young man with three children. He works sewing car covers. His wife is also a seamstress, and they opened a family business and want to expand it. Since they have only two sewing machines and both are for sewing clothing, they need a more professional sewing machine - the two that they have are old and always breaking down when sewing the covers. Having consulted with his wife, Jamshed decided to take out a loan to buy a new sewing machine, so that it will be easier for him to sew quality covers.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Angel

texts.es: Angel tiene 64 años de edad y habita junto a su esposa, su hija y dos nietos. Angel es un hombre increíble quien hace todo lo que este en sus manos para dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. Él es agricultor y de esta forma es como se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Angel desea, dar inicio a la construcción de su vivienda con materiales más resistentes y de esta forma dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, hierro, ladrillo, etc.
texts.en:
Angel is 64 years old and lives with his wife, daughter and two grandchildren. Angel is an incredible man who does whatever is within his grasp to improve the living conditions of his family. He is a farmer and that is how he earns a living and puts food on the table. 

Angel would like to start construction of his home with more durable materials, so that he can improve his family's living conditions. With the sum requested, he will buy cement, sand, rebar, bricks, etc.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand, rebar, bricks, etc. to build a house.

loans.name: Nhóm 30 - Ngô Quyền - P. Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Thảo is 53 years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

Thảo operates a food stall, selling soft drinks. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks to resell.

In 2009, Thảo joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid six loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 30 - Ngô Quyền - P. Điện Biên solidarity group, which consists of three members.

With her business profit, Thảo hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks to resell.

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot is 48 years old and he lives in the village of Ddmashen, in Gegharkunik region. Ashot has a big family: he lives with his wife, daughter, son (who, because of an accident, became blind) and daughter-in-law. Ashot is the only breadwinner in his family and all his life has been engaged in farming. At his farm, he has cows, a calf, a bull, a pig, sheep, rabbits and chickens. 

Ashot’s wife organizes the sale of their farm products, such as milk, macun (national dairy-product), meat and eggs. Potatoes that he sells from his farm, Ashot usually sells a lot, but unfortunately not at a good price. He says that his region is very rich with this vegetable and the competition of potato sales is also great. Nevertheless, its cultivation here is very easy and popular.

Ashot wants to use the loan of 700,000 AMD Ashot to purchase potato seedlings, and also animal fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings, and also animal fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen lives with his large family in the frontier village Aygehovit, in Tavush region. He, with the help of his father, takes care of a big farm that is rich with cattle. At his farm, he has 15 cows, five calves, two bulls, 20 pigs, 30 chickens and 13 beehives. 

Thanks to his farming income, Karen managed to buy a truck, which he now uses frequently, both for making paid cargo transfers and for selling his farm products, such as meat (beef and pork), milk, cheese, honey and eggs. His farm’s vegetables and fruit (potatoes, cucumbers, tomatoes, greens, apples, peaches, plums, etc.) are consumed primarily by his family.  

Karen says that he likes farming very much since his father taught him to do it when he was just six years old, and now he is already skilled and experienced in this field. 

Karen requests this loan to buy a lot of fodder for his cattle, since all his stored fodder (for winter months) is already gone.

loans.use: to buy a lot of fodder for his cattle, since all his stored fodder (for winter months) is already gone.

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.en:
Nazokat is a hardworking woman. She was born in a remote area. She is widow. 

She has 15 years’ experience of doing business. She works at home, where she produces traditional textiles. She is the owner of that production business.

Nazokat wants to attract more customers to her products. She is planning to buy thread for making traditional textiles. For the further development of her business, she hopes her activity will expand into fabric. She sells her textiles in the domestic market. 

Nazokat is asking for financial support to buy thread for making a textiles.

loans.use: to buy thread for making textiles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock up her business with products such as sugar, butter, rice, beans, cold cuts, dairy products, meats, "churros" (a doughnut-like treat), bread, eggs and sodas.

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia is 43 years old. She lives alone. She works as a nurse and earns a small monthly income. 

Maia decided to start her own business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,000 GEL. With the loan, she will start buying and selling fruits and vegetables. Maia plans to purchase fruits and vegetables at wholesale prices and will resell with a price markup. 

Maia plans to expand the trading business in the future. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin buying and selling fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana, who is a 68-year-old single woman, lives in Khobi district. She lives alone and earns a living with a small agricultural business. Specifically, she cultivates a plot of land, where she harvests maize and also cares for several chickens and sells eggs. The income is hardly enough to cover even basic needs, so Svetlana lives in poverty and requires financial support to become more financially stable. 

She has great desire to be involved in a trading business and sought a loan from local credit providers. Her attempts were unsuccessful as the creditors didn't find enough income to be sufficient to approve a loan. 

The start up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enabled her to get a loan of 600 GEL for purchasing stocks of various home products at wholesale prices and to start buying and selling the products in her community. She will take private orders also and get her own customers. 
The loan will be great help to Svetlana. 

She is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving the chance to generate enough income.

loans.use: to start buying and selling various home products.

loans.name: Shehnaz Begum

texts.en:
Shehnaz begum is 44 years old, and the mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a vegetable vendor by profession; he sells vegetables, such as potatoes, carrots, corn, flowers, onions, etc. He is solely responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Shehnaz begum's husband needs to purchase different types of vegetables for reselling so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profits. But due to an unfavorable financial position, he is not in a condition to purchase vegetables for his business purposes.

Therefore Shehnaz begum has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to assist her husband with purchasing different types of vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina is 48 years old. She is the mother of two children and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband provides local rural transport in the form of a van to the people of his community. He has been running the van as a loader and cargo transport business as well. He has had his own van for the past 12 years. 

Due to excessive and continuous use, the van needs some maintenance, so he has decided to repair his van as soon as possible. But due to lack of finances, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairs. Therefore, Sakina has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his van. Sakina is so thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing her husband's van used in his passenger transport business.

loans.name: Jose Alexander

texts.es:
José, es panadero, su vida la comparte con su esposa y cuatro hijos menores de edad, todos colaboran para desempeñar las actividades de la panadería, el oficio lo aprendió trabajando en panaderías de otras personas y hace varios años fundo su propio negocio para tener recursos económicos y salir adelante con su familia.
El préstamo lo utilizara para reparar el vehículo que utiliza para salir a repartir el  pan y llevar la leña que necesita para que su negocio siga produciendo pan,  su propósito es atraer nuevos clientes para que sus demandas sean mayores y de esa forma tener ingresos estables.
Sus sueños son no tener deudas, trabajar con capital propio y tener junto a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
José is a baker who shares his life with his wife and four minor children, who all help out with the bakery. José learned how to be a baker working in other people's bakeries and several years ago, he set up his own business to generate an income and support his family.

José will use the loan to make repairs to the vehicle he uses to deliver bread and transport the firewood he needs for his business to continue baking bread. His aim is to attract new customers to increase orders, and in this way, ensure a stable income.

He dreams of being loan-free, of working with his own capital, and to enjoy better living conditions with his family.

loans.use: to make repairs to the vehicle he uses to deliver bread and transport the firewood he needs for his business to continue baking bread.

loans.name: Fanny Aracely

texts.es: Fanny, tiene 30 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene dos hijos y reside en el municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. Ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, lleva 10 años de vender ropa como blusas, faldas, camisas, pantalones, shorts usada y nueva, esta ropa la vende de forma ambulante y por pedidos en la misma comunidad. Ha solicitado varios prestamos en la institución, con el actual es el séptimo ciclo y es por 7,000 lempiras para comprar mas ropa como blusas, ropa intima, vestidos, pantalones y short y poder aumentar el inventario y las ventas. Su plan es que el negocio crezca para darles buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en: Fanny is 30 years old. She is in a common-law marriage with her husband, with whom she has two children. She lives in the municipality of Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. She has always worked in commerce. For 10 years she has been selling clothing, such as blouses, skirts, shirts, pants, and shorts, used and new. She sells this clothing as a street vendor and also by order from people in the community. She has had several loans from the institution. This request is her seventh and it’s for 7,000 HNL (Honduran Lempiras), to buy more clothing, such as blouses, intimate clothing, dresses, pants, and shorts, so she can increase her inventory and sales. Her plan is to grow her business so she can give a good education to her children.

loans.use: to buy more clothing, such as blouses, intimate clothing, dresses, pants, and shorts for resale.

loans.name: Jose Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
José, es un comerciante que ofrece en su negocio frutas, verduras, granos básicos y calzado, desde muy joven emprendió su negocio como una forma de ir mejorando su estilo de vida y posteriormente se convirtió en la fuente de ingresos para dar a su familia el sustento diario, vive con su esposa, su hija y dos nietos, solo su esposa depende económicamente de él, sus otros hijos ya son independientes.
El financiamiento le servirá para poder comprar repollos, tomates, cebollas, papayas, melones, frijoles, maíz, maicillo, etc., con la inversión fortalecerá su negocio esperando generar nuevos ingresos.
Su visión es hacer buen uso del préstamo para tener ganancias que piensa utilizar para tener un mejor estilo de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en:
José has a business selling fruit, vegetables, grains, and footwear. As a young man he started a business as a means of improving his standard of living. Then it became the way he earned his living so he could support his family. José lives with his wife, daughter and two grandchildren, but only his wife is financially dependent on him. His other children are already independent.

The loan will help him buy cabbage, tomatoes, onions, papaya, melons, beans, corn, sorghum etc. Then he will be able to strengthen his business and earn more money. His plan is to make good use of the loan so he will increase his income and be able to provide his family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: buy cabbage, tomatoes, onions, papaya, melons, beans, corn, sorghum etc

loans.name: Dúo Esmeraldas Group

texts.es:
Dúo Esmeraldas
La señora Llenifer de 34 años de edad, es originaria de San Martin Jilotepeque. Llenifer se dedica a la crianza de marranos y a la elaboración de quesos. es madre de familia y ayuda a sus esposo con sus negocio para darles estudio a sus hijos. Desea invertir más en su negocio para aumentar sus ventas, sueña con un negocio más surtido y lucha por darle siempre un buen servicio al cliente. Agradecen a Kiva y Fape el apoyo brindado y se compromete a pagar puntualmente.
texts.en:
Duo Esmeraldas

Llenifer is 34 years old. She is from San Martin Jilotepeque. Llenifer raises pigs and makes cheese. She is a mother and helps her husband with his business in order to provide education to their children. She wants to invest more in her business so she can increase her sales. She dreams of a well-supplied business and works hard to always provide good service to her customers. They are both grateful to Kiva and Fape for the support provided and pledge to pay punctually.

loans.use: to buy pigs that she will raise.

location.town: Aldea Cruz Blanca San Juan Sacatepequez

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 26-year-old married woman who has been running an animal purchase and sale business with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is the mother of four children and is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.

Nasreen has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Meran

texts.en:
Meran is 57 years old; she is a married woman. She deals in business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate extra income.

Meran needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 36-year-old hardworking woman. She has been providing the service of stitching clothes in her locality. She is quite popular for her skills in stitching. Parveen’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele.

Parveen has requested a loan amount of 40 000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces so that she can meet the demands of her customers consistently. She aspires to save money for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces so that she can meet the demands of her customers consistently.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is a 40-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She is working hard to fulfill their needs, including food, health, clothing, and education.

She and her husband have been working in agriculture for some years. They crop different vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation.

Currently, in order to purchase different types of seeds along with packs of insecticides and pesticides, Kalsoom has applied for a loan of 55,000 PKR. This loan will help her to grow more crops, which will ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds along with packs of insecticides and pesticides

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es un padre de familia ejemplar, tiene 36 años de edad y es casado, el tiene una familia hermosa de 4 hijos de las edades de entre 4 y 17 años, vive en una comunidad de Jocopilas.
Juan es un hombre muy dedicado a su trabajo para generar los ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia se dedica a dos actividades a la albañilería desde hace 20 años y para generar otros ingresos trabaja en el campo cultivando café y banano, juan asegura que para él esta otra actividad es bastante rentable, pues le ayuda a mejorar  las condiciones de vida de su familia.
Juan se avisto ahora a la necesidad de un prestamo para remodelar su cocina, pues este lugar debe de permanecer en buenas condiciones por ser  el lugar donde se prepara los alimentos, pero lamentablemente Juan no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para poder hacerlo es por ello que necesita de este prestamo, para comprar cemento, cal arena, y otras cosas que se requiera para la remodelación.
Juan sueña con poder realizar la remodelación de su cocina este año y así tener en mejores condiciones la vida de su familia
texts.en:
Juan is an exemplary father of a family. He is 36 years old and is married. He has a lovely family of 4 children aged between 4 and 17 years old. He lives in a community in Jocopilas.

Juan is very dedicated to his work in order to generate income to sustain his family. He works at two activities. He has been a bricklayer for 20 years and to generate more income he works in the fields growing coffee and bananas. Juan professes that for him this other activity is quite profitable as it allows him to improve the living conditions of his family.

Juan sees the need now of a loan to remodel his kitchen as this room should be in good condition as it is where you prepare food. But unfortunately Juan does not have enough money to do this. This is why he needs the loan to buy cement, lime, sand and other things needed to make the renovations. Juan dreams of undertaking this renovation this year and doing so improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy lime, cement and re-bar.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is 38 years old. She is the mother of five children. She  lives in Lahore, Pakistan. 

Razia's husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past several days, his rickshaw is not working properly, which is causing him to be unable to generate any income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. 

Therefore, Razia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Razia is so thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es:
Domingo es un muchacho muy trabajador y muy honrado el tienen 30 años de edad y es soltero,  vive junto a sus padres en una comunidad de santa Catarina Ixtahuacan.
Domingo genera sus ingresos a través de dos actividades que realiza, él trabaja cuidado un molino de nixtamal que tienen en su casa, pero también trabaja cultivando café para luego secarlas y venderlas, según cuenta Domingo que gracias a estas dos actividades el a logrado mantener  a su familia. Pero Domingo  es un hombre que se preocupa por la necesidades de su familia y una de las necesidades prioritarias ahora es la de comprar un terreno para poder tener donde construir, pero lamentablemente Domingo no cuenta con suficiente dinero para poder  realizar esta compra, por tal motivo él se solicita su prestamo. El sueño de Domingo es poder  conseguir este crédito para que él le pueda ofrecer a su familia un lugar propio donde vivir.
texts.en:
Domingo is a very hardworking and honorable young man. He is 30 years old and is single. He lives with his parents in the community of Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan.

Domingo earns a living through two businesses that he has. He runs a corn grinding mill that he has in his house, and he also cultivates coffee, which he dries and then sells. As Domingo explains, it's thanks to these two businesses that he's been able to provide for his family. But Domingo is a person who worries for his family’s needs, and one of the biggest ones right now is to buy a piece of land where they can build. Unfortunately, Domingo doesn’t have sufficient funds to make this purchase, so that's why he's requesting the loan. Domingo’s dream is to get this loan so he can offer his family their own place where they can live.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Nazima

texts.en:
Nazima is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is 33 years old and a mother of four children.

Her husband has been making furniture for 25 years. He is responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. Nazima's husband wants to buy pieces of wood and other tools for his business, but due to insufficient financial means, he cannot afford to buy these items. Therefore, Nazima has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, her husband can purchase the relevant items for his business and earn a profitable income to meet the daily needs of his family and business. Nazima is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband purchase wood and tools for his furniture business.

loans.name: Maqsooda Begum

texts.en:
Maqsooda begum is 61 years old, and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the responsible mother of eight children. 

Her husband has been running a meat shop for the past 25 years, and he is the only one responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family and management of the household.

Maqsooda begum's husband wants to purchase different types of meat, e.g., beef and chicken, to fulfill the demands of his customers, but due to financial constraints, he is not in the position to buy these items for resale. 

To fulfill her husband's business needs, Maqsooda begum has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these items and will also help him to increase his daily sales and earn more profitable income, in order to manage the business and his family's needs.

loans.use: her husband wanted to increase his business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy raw materials for her son's shuttering work.

loans.name: Nhóm 11 Thôn Hậu Áng Xã Công Liêm Group

texts.en:
Mrs Dân works in agriculture, raising livestock. She is requesting a loan to purchase more livestock to raise and sell in the future. Dân is 58 years old and  married with two children. 

Dân is the group leader of the Nhóm 11 Thôn Hậu áng xã Công Liêm solidarity group, which consists of four members. In 2012, Dân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Dân has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 

Dân has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is lack of capital. With her business profit, Dân hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Oscar Ovidio

texts.es:
Oscar, está acompañado y tiene una hija de 2 años, es reconocido entre sus vecinos por ser un hombre luchador y por desarrollar actividades agrícolas como crianza y venta de ganado y cerdos, su esposa le brinda apoya en el negocio, el oficio lo aprendió trabajando con sus padres, inicio a trabajar de manera independiente hace ya 5 años, su ventaja es que en los potreros en que pasta el ganado le pertenecen y no tiene que pagar alquiler.
Comprará dos vacas y concentrado para ganado, así su negocio se fortalecerá y el ganado estará saludable y en buenas condiciones para venderlo a mejor precio, sus riesgos son los precios variables del alimento para el ganado y la inseguridad social.
Su objetivo es trabajar con la ayuda de Dios y la facilidad de los créditos para lograr tener un negocio rentable que le permita tener ingresos económicos para darle a su familia mejor calidad de vida y un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Oscar and his wife have a 2-year old daughter. He is known amongst his neighbours as a hardworking man who has a built up his farm where he raises and sells cattle and pigs. His wife also helps on the farm. Oscar learned about farming by working with his parents. He started working independently five years ago. He has an important advantage in that the fields where his animals graze belong to him; he doesn’t have to rent them.

With the loan Oscar plans to buy two cows and special feed for the cattle in order to strengthen his business and have healthy vigorous animals to sell at a good price. The possible downsides are fluctuating food prices and social unrest.

With help from God and the loan, Oscar’s goal is to have a profitable business which will provide enough income that he can afford to give his family a better standard of living and future.

loans.use: buy two cows and special feed for his cattle

loans.name: María Santos

texts.es:
María, de 36 años de edad, está acompañado y vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, su esposo se dedica a las actividades de agricultura, albañilería y soldadura, ella es empleada en una panadería de la ciudad. 

María, ha estado trabajando desde hace varios años en una panadería y es una de las mejores trabajadoras, según lo que dicen sus patrones, tiene un record de asistencias al trabajo impresionante.

María, necesita el crédito para reparar varias partes de su casa, ya que pronto se avecina el invierno y no quiere poner en riesgo a su familia.

María, sueña con ver a sus hijos crecer sanos y fuertes.
texts.en:
María is 36 years old and married. She lives with her husband and their two children. Her husband works in agriculture, construction, and soldering. She is employed in one of the city’s bakeries. 

María has been working for several years in the bakery and is one of the best workers, according to her employers. She has an impressive attendence record at her job.

María needs the loan to repair several areas of her house, since winter will come soon and she doesn’t want to put her family at risk.

María dreams of seeing her children grow up healthy and strong.

loans.use: to repair several ares of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to assist her son with buying raw materials for his shoe making business.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia, along with her husband (who is also shown in the photo with her), has successfully built her business of cropping with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By this time, they have maintained a good number of customers and make a good amount of income to contribute to the family income.

Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand their business. Now she is in her sixth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 55,000 PKR to purchase different types of seeds along with good quality soil and insecticides. It will allow them to increase their sales to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds along with good quality soil and insecticides.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana, along with her husband (who is also shown in the photo), has successfully built her milk-selling business with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By this time, she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income.

Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her eighth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 60,000 PKR to purchase another cow. This will enable her to increase her milk sales to more cities and to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a 42-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family, she began a milk-selling business. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk.

Khadija owns buffaloes for milking and is happily supporting her family with the income generated. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo so that she can increase her sales and generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo so that she can increase her sales and generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Sr. De Coyllority De Arin Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SR DE COYLLORITY DE ARIN”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Emiliana ella es viuda y tiene 70 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de crianza de pollos y cuyes, la socia los pollos y cuyes los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes mercados, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los pollos y cuyes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pollos y cuyes y alimentos para los pollos y cuyes.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de verduras, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Señor de Coyllority de Arin” communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Calca, in the province of Calca, in the department of Cusco.

Emiliana is a widow, 70 years old, and has two children. She has a business raising chickens and guinea pigs; she fattens them and then sells them in the different markets. She has been in this business for several years and it’s going very well for her. Her dream is to have a shop where she could sell the chickens and guinea pigs. She is requesting the loan to buy chickens and guinea pigs and feed for them.

The other members sell animals, sell vegetables, have a small grocery store, and have a restaurant.

Emiliana is grateful to those who are part of her dream through this organization and she pledges to make her repayments in the established timeframe.

loans.use: to buy chickens and guinea pigs and feed for them.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Mrs Hoa works in agriculture, farming food. Hoa is 55 years old and she is married with four children. Hoa lives with three dependents in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hoa's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hoa has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hoa faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Hoa hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 40-year-old married mother of three children. She has been running a profitable general store in Narok town for 23 years. 

Her previous loans repaid, Grace is requesting her fifth one from VisionFund Kenya to buy more stocks of household items to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.  

Grace's hopes are to grow her business, be prosperous and be able to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of assorted household items to sell

loans.name: Salome

texts.en: Salome has a small farm in the village of Sambirir in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. This area is a primary milk and maize producing area. Salome is involved in both milk and maize production to provide for her family. She has also invested in poultry farming and other side-businesses to earn additional income. She requests a loan to fence her farm. She has been facing challenge of controlling her cows that normally stray away to her neighbor's farm, creating much loss and damage. She has been having conflicts with her neighbors because of the cows. Through this loan, she will save money that she used to spend to pay for damages and losses caused by her cows. All that Salome is waiting for is your kindness.

loans.use: To fence her farm

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 33-year-old farmer from Namwichula, a remote village in the Kitale area of Kenya. For the past six years, she has been involved in mixed farming, and her primary source of income has been growing maize, poultry, tomatoes and also keeping dairy cows. Margaret has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. Margaret is most passionate about horticulture farming. She takes pride in being a part of the fastest-growing agriculture industry category in Kenya. However, she is facing serious challenges brought about by harsh weather conditions. 

Margaret is seeking a loan to invest in the expansion of her horticulture farm. She sees a lot of room for improvement and growth. What is lacking is the capital to drive positive change. With your loan, Margaret will make enough income to take care of her family and other farming expenses. She wakes up early and goes to sleep very late every day to give her family a decent living and to afford proper education for her children. An improved income level will assure her family of a secure future. 

By joining Juhudi Kilimo, which assists smallholder farmers, she will also benefit from free extension services and links to markets. Margaret believes that if female farmers had the same access to resources as men, the number of the world's hungry could be reduced by half.

loans.use: To expand her horticulture farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his horticulture farm

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en: Mejumaa is a married woman and has been blessed with six kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. Mejumaa operates a poultry selling business, which has been operational for over four years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. With the 10,000 KES, she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feeds. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over twenty years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Edith De La Cruz

texts.es:
Edith, vive con su esposo y tres hijos, hace 18 años tiene un negocio que consiste en el destazo de cerdos y venta de chicharrones, aprendió está actividad de su esposo e inicio su negocio para tener ingresos económicos con los cuales apoyaría en los gasto de su hogar, trabaja todos los días sin horario establecido.
Invertirá en cerdos, para vender su carne y tener materia prima para elaborar la venta de chicharrones, espera que su negocio siga mejorando y que las demandas crezcan para obtener ganancias que respaldaran el pago de la deuda.
Su proyecto es aumentar la productividad de su negocio y estabilizarse económicamente para disminuir las necesidades familiares.
texts.en:
Edith lives with her husband and three children. For 18 years she has had a pork butchering business and sells chicharrones [known as “carnitas” in some places]. She learned how to do this from her husband and started her business in order to have income she could use to contribute toward the household expenses. She works every day, without an established schedule. 

She will buy pigs so she can sell their meat and have the materials she needs to make and sell chicharrones. She expects that her business will continue improving and that demand will grow so she will have profits that will support the repayment of the debt.

Her plan is to increase the productivity of her business and establish herself economically so she can address her family’s needs.

loans.use: buy pigs so she can sell their meat and have the materials to make and sell chicharrones [carnitas].

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margretis is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Margretis has operated a retail shop for the past two years, selling household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces a major challenge of customers taking too long to pay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan of 50,000 KES that she is requesting, Margretis wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman and has been blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for over five years, selling from her home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale
