loans.name: Mesalim

texts.en:
Mesalim is a married mother of one child who does not attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For over 20 years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kes 50,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors staying for long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan of 50,000 KES that she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Mnwar

texts.en: Mnwar is a happily-married woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting a business of tailoring at her home, as her husband's income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. Mnwar is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw material, she is facing difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business. Therefore, she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000. With the requested loan, she wants to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to stitch up more dresses on time to generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to stitch up more dresses on time to generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.name: Bismillah

texts.en: Bismillah is a 34-year-old married woman. She has run a business of milk selling for many years with the help of her husband. She has buffalo for milking purposes. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has two children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales, to earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales, to earn a good amount of income.

loans.name: Imtiaz

texts.en:
Imtiaz has successfully built her business of cloth trade with the support of Kiva and Kashf Foundation. She purchases a variety of cloth at low prices from the city market and then sells it to the people of her locality. She has a strong customer base.

Now, Imtiaz has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR. She wants to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business, to get a boost in her earnings.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business, to get a boost in her earnings.

loans.name: Reena Ramzan

texts.en:
Reena Ramzan is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives with her one child and husband in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is the guardian of her family. He has been running his own tyre shop for the past four years.

Reena Ramzan's husband wants to purchase different types of tyres for his business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to purchase these tyres. Therefore, Reena Ramzan has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, she’ll enable her husband to purchase relevant items for his business purpose so that he can earn more profitable income to manage his business and household.

Reena Ramzan is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's tyre business.

loans.name: Ghazala

texts.en: Ghazala is a 33-year-old married woman. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family, she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns three buffalo and one cow. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. Now she wants to increase her business; therefore, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. She is hopeful that an increase in milk production will help her in generating more income.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en: Farzana along with her husband has successfully built her business of a general store with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By this time, she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her fourth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy more stock of biscuits, sugar, salt, oil, etc. to increase her revenues. She wishes to provide her family with better facilities.

loans.use: to buy more stock of biscuits, sugar, salt, oil, etc. to increase her revenues.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is a 60-year-old married woman who has been running a milk-selling business for many years with the help of her husband. She has buffaloes for milking and sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses.

Nargis has five children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo to increase her milk sales.

She aspires to earn a good amount of income and fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo so that she can increase her milk sales and earn a good amount of income.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, a youthful 48-year-old farmer from Siongiroi area of Kenya, is elegant and admirable in spirit and effort. He is a role model, a mentor and an inspiration to many young farmers in his village because of his resilience despite personal challenges and his passion to support his children as a primary caregiver. The living conditions in the Siongiroi area are very tough and you need to have tough skin in order to survive. John has always shown the resilience to beat all odds. Because of the hardcore poverty in his village, John started practicing mixed farming and has been doing it for the past 10 years. John's sources of income are vegetables, milk, and egg selling; these products are very perishable and require timely delivery to the market, and one problem that he faces is delivering to the market on time. The Siongiroi area has a poor road network and poor feeder roads that really hamper timely delivery of products to the market. That is why John is kindly seeking a loan to buy a motorbike.

With the motorbike, he will deliver products to the market on time and reap more profits because the products will still be fresh. John is very determined to succeed and because he is much disciplined with finances, he plans that through accumulated profits he will be able to provide a secure future for himself and for his grandchildren to come. John's dream is to provide a secure future for his children through paying tuition fees for them. Through your loan, you will help him realize his dream.

loans.use: To pay for a motorbike

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman and has been blessed with three kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Mwanakombo operates a poultry selling business, which has been operational for over four years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Mwanakombo dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future

With the Kes 40,000, she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feeds. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Tucked away in the countryside near the Cheptuiget, Kericho area of Kenya is a farmer named Daniel and his family. He is a hardworking man and aggressive with the principle of truth on his lips; he is honest and faithful to what he does and what he says. The Cheptuiget area has hardcore poverty which pervades every homestead, yet every day when you look beyond the numbers, you will see bright, vibrant, open faces of young people searching and yearning for the opportunity to live a life of dignity and respect. They have the conviction that it’s possible. 

Daniel has kept hope and has been toiling on his farm for the past 15 years. His primary sources of income have been milk, poultry and some “side hustles” he does to supplement the meager income he earns from farming. The Cheptuiget area has few diesel posho mills that serve a sea of people but the mills keeps breaking down, hence farmers are not able to grind their maize. Daniel intends to change this and is requesting a loan to buy an electric posho mill which will grind corn or maize into flour.

Maize meal is very common in Kenya and is a staple food for many communities. Many Kenyan families consume the maize product “ugali“ (hard porridge) regularly. The market usually provides sifted flour, but the cost is higher because of the sifting and packaging. Cheaper flour can be obtained by milling the maize directly using a posho mill. Through this loan, Daniel will be able to grind maize faster because he will use an electric posho mill. Cases of breakdown will be long-ago history because electric posho mills are more reliable. 

This loan will assist Daniel in permanently changing his life and achieving his life mission of driving economic development. Profits from the posho mill will be used to comfortably repay the loan, which Daniel promises to fully repay on time. In the next two years, Daniel sees himself as a very established businessman who will be running more than one posho mill in his remote village. Daniel patiently waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy an electric posho mill

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is married and has school-going children. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her kids.

For the past five years, she has operated a food vending business, selling at the market to market dwellers and passersby. Dorcas cites seasonality to be her major challenge. She dreams of expanding and establishing to a restaurant in the future.

With the 33,990 KES, she wants to pay school fees for her school-going kids. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her school-going kids

loans.name: Karuwa

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a married woman with four children, all of whom still attend school and are still under her care. They live at their own house that has neither  electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Kwekwe has operated a clothes-selling business. She sells at the market to her town dwellers and her neighbours. She cites her major challenge to be the rate of stock turnover which is affected by seasons. 

With the loan of 50,000 KES she is requesting, she wants to purchase one bale of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase one bale of clothes for resale

loans.name: Evarline

texts.en:
Evarline is a married woman and has two kids who attend school. Her husband is a businessman and together they live at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Evarline has operated a tailoring business for the past six years. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the 50,000 KES she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Fifty-three year old Justus does not boast of a university degree or even a certificate from an agricultural institute, but he is an accomplished farmer from the Chuka area of Kenya and commands a lot of respect. He is happily married, and together with his beautiful wife they are blessed with a beautiful family. For the past 10 years he has been involved in mixed farming and because of the immense knowledge he has in farming, farmers from his village and neighboring villages troop to his home to seek technical advice on the best farming techniques. 

His primary source of income has been milk, eggs, maize, and some personal businesses he engages in to make the extra income. Justus sells cereals to his neighbors and to the local market and makes more money ,although his work is not without challenges he says, though he is regarded as the best cereal seller in his village. He has been unable to meet the market demand which has resulted in a loss of tenders. One of his neighbors ordered 100 bags of maize which he was unable to supply. 

He is seeking a loan to buy more cereals so that he can satisfy the demand. He intends to buy different varieties of cereals such as millet, rice, sorghum and maize. Through Juhudi Kilimo, which is a micro finance that supports small scale farmers, Justus is confident that this loan will permanently change his life. Increased profits from cereal selling will allow him to afford his highest monthly expenses; farm related comforts and the ability to channel a surplus amount to his children's education. Justus is a visionary and plans to buy a maize-milling machine through accumulated profits.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en: Farzana is 35 years old and married. She is a mother of six children. She has been doing a business of animal sale and purchase for many years. She makes enough to contribute to the family income. She wants to provide a good quality life to her children through all her hard work. Now, she has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen lives with his wife and two school-aged children in Kapan town. He is involved in a retail business: Karen trades in fruits and vegetables in the center of Kapan town.

To be able to purchase new stock of fruits and vegetables and cover last month's credit, he will be very grateful to lenders for their support.

Karen's loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of fruits and vegetables and cover last month's credit.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is 46 years of age. Her great skill in hand embroidery and experience of three years in this field has given her a very good reputation in her community. Over time, the demand for her hand embroidery has grown, and she uses the income generated to pay for the expenses of her family.

Rukhsana has now requested a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR, with which she wants to purchase more spools of thread, measuring tape, embroidery scissors, frames, and tracing paper.

She hopes that her skill will help in providing for her family’s health expenses.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread, measuring tape, embroidery scissors, frames, and tracing paper.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For the past year Agnes has operated a retail shop selling goat meat to the community. She faces a major challenge of competition from other operators.

With the loan of 40,000 Kes that she is requesting, Agnes wants to purchase  goats for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats for resale

loans.name: Nyomo Jormo Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called Nyormo Jormo and are beginning their third loan cycle with ID-Ghana. The Nyomo Jormo Group is made up of four members who are into the sale of plantain, groceries, assorted bowls, rice and noodles.

The loan they are taking out will benefit these small entrepreneurs, one of whom is Evelyn. She says that she joined ID-Ghana two years ago, at the invitation of a relative who was a client of the institution. At present, Evelyn has a business in the sale of plantain, charcoal, and cooking oil. She began this business with the third loan that she obtained through ID-Ghana.

The loan that she will obtain this time is for an increase in capital for the purchase of more plantain, charcoal, and cooking oil from the market at a wholesale price. Later, she will sell the plantain, charcoal, and cooking oil to her clients from door to door.

This kind of work enables her to generate resources to take care of herself, since she stays alone. When she was asked what she liked about ID-Ghana, she replied that she was pleased with the loan and with the training that the institution offers her.

loans.use: to purchase more plantain, charcoal, and cooking oil from the market at a wholesale price.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Mwaka has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces the major challenge of creditors taking too long to pay for goods taken on credit. 

Mwaka decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the requested 20,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is a 52-year-old widow and the mother of four children. One of her sons (shown in the photo) operates a construction business, which is the primary source of their income. He is responsible for building the roofs of houses during their construction. In this way, he is able to earn a sufficient income to provide for their family. However, in order to meet the everyday household expenditures, more income is required. For the growth of her son's business, Naseem has requested a Murabaha-type loan of 25,000 PKR. This will allow him to purchase good quality timber, metal, and slate to meet customers’ demands without any delays.

loans.use: to purchase good quality timber, metal, and slate to meet customers’ demands without any delays.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro es un padre de familia  comprometido con su familia, él tienen 44 años de edad tiene una hermosa familia de 8 hijos de las edades de entre 4 y 25 años  y tres de ellos ya están casados, pedro vive en una comunidad de san Antonio.
Pedro es jornalero  y caporal en una finca de su comunidad, el realiza esta actividad desde hace 20 año, él lo hace con el fin de generar sus ingresos y así poder   sacar adelante a su familia, Pedro viendo las necesidades de su familia a tomando en cuenta muchas de ellas pero lo más importante es la remodelación del techo de la casa que por el año que ya tienen ya no se encuentran en buen estado,  por la época de lluvia que ya se ha cerca es necesario realizar este cambio lo mas pronto posible, pero una de las limitaciones de pedro es de que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para poder comprar laminas y hacer el respectivo cambio, es por ello que él considera que debe realizar un prestamo para cubrir emergente mente esta necesidad.
El sueño de pedro es poder contar con este prestamo para que su familia tenga una casa más segura.
texts.en:
Pedro is a father who is committed to his family.  He is 44-years old and has a beautiful family of eight children between the ages of 4- and 25-years.  Three of his children are married.  Pedro lives in a community that is a part of San Antonio.
Pedro is a day-laborer and foreman at a farm in his community.  He has been in this work for twenty years, which generates the income he needs to get his family ahead.  Pedro took into consideration many of his family's needs and saw that the most pressing was refurbishing their home's roof.  It has been in disrepair for most of this year.  The rainy season is approaching, and so Pedro needs to replace the roof as soon as possible.  However, one of Pedro's constraints is that he doesn't have enough money to purchase the sheet metal needed to replace the roof.  That is why he decided he should take out a loan and take care of this emergency. 
Pedro's hope is that he can count on the loan so his family can have a safer home.

loans.use: to purchase sheet metal for his roof.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is 33 years old and the mother of three children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. Her husband sells dairy products like milk, curd, and butter. He owns a small dairy farm consisting of buffaloes and cows. He sells milk daily to different tea stalls.

Razia's husband  is an honest man. He manages their household necessities from his earnings from milk sales. He speaks in a soft tone of voice which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of his clients. He was in need of one buffalo to increase his income from his milk sales business. So, Razia requested this loan. In this way, she can support her husband's business.

She thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new buffalo for her husband's milk sales business

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 32 years old. She lives in Johannesburg with her two school-going sisters. Lilian has professional training in computerized accounting and Microsoft Office. She is employed as a secretary in a company where she does general secretarial work. Her employers are relocating from Johannesburg to Cape Town and she will soon be jobless. 

Lilian is looking for a loan to enable her to buy computers, printers and a photocopier to start her own typesetting and printing business. She will locate her business in Orange Grove, which is a very busy and highly populated part of Johannesburg. She will use the profits from the business to keep her sisters in school and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy computers, printers and a photocopier

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 34-year-old married man from Dier Al-Balah. He is the father of one small son. Mohammad works as an employee in the public sector and earns a low income. He also has a stall for selling small electrical home appliances like charging lights and batteries. This is very useful in Gaza as electricity is not always available. This stall provides the family with a good income.

Mohammad has taken out a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more home electrical appliances for his stall to sell.

Mohammad appears in the photo next to his stall.

loans.use: to buy more home electrical appliances for his stall to sell.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas, aged 56, started farming approximately 15 years ago and, although he began farming as a hobby, it eventually became his career. His half-acre of land, located in the Nyamira area of Kenya, houses poultry and dairy cows. Thomas passionately loves poultry farming. The Nyamira area is populated, and has a ready market for poultry products. Poultry farming is one of the profitable business ventures in Kenya and you don’t need to be a large-scale farmer to benefit from it. The demand for chicken is always high, being such a popular meal for many people as can be proved when you visit fast food joints in his area. 

However, with his biggest challenge being lack of funds, Thomas is kindly seeking a loan to buy additional poultry. Through the loan, Thomas will be able to sell eggs, meat and poultry feathers to the already existing market. Even though he has been facing challenges accessing finances, he feels relieved knowing that institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva are there to make his dream come true. 

Thomas chose Juhudi Kilimo because the interest rate on their loans is low, and is on a reducing basis. He underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, learning that saving is a continuous process in many microfinance institutions. Through the loan, Thomas' income will increase and his life will permanently change, leading to better living conditions for his family and a positive impact on the community.

loans.use: to buy additional poultry

loans.name: Dúo Ester Group

texts.es:
DUO ESTER
Este dúo está formado por doña Miriam de 30 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos y desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de leña y  venta de refacciones, los fines de semana, ella necesita que la apoyen ya que quiere comprar una camionada de leña de pino y encino, porque le están ofreciendo a buen precio y quiere que fape le pueda apoyar.desde ya les agradece su apoyo en su negocio.
texts.en:
DUO ESTER
Miriam, who belongs to this group, is 30 years old, married, and has four children. For the last 10 years, she has been dedicated to selling firewood and on weekends, spare parts. Miriam needs our help to buy a truckload of pine and oak firewood while it is being offered at a good price. She is requesting the help of FAPE, whose assistance with her business she has always been grateful for.

loans.use: purchase firewood to sell.

loans.name: Milagro Guadalupe

texts.es:
Milagro, con el apoyo de los préstamos mantiene la tienda de consumos surtida con productos de primera necesidad y ofrece a sus clientes un mejor servicio en el molino nixtamal, con sus ingresos ha podido cubrir sus gastos personales y ayudar económica a sus padres.
Opta por un nuevo préstamo por que siente que la institución y los inversionistas kiva le brindan apoyo cuando lo necesita, comprara pan, aceite, bebidas, toallas sanitarias, jabón, detergentes, etc., para ofertar a sus clientes los productos que necesitan.
texts.en:
Milagro, with the support of her loans, maintains the consumer goods store supplied with basic consumer goods and offers her clients better service in the corn mill. With her income, she has been able to cover her personal expenses and help her parents economically.

She is opting for a new loan because she feels that the institution and the Kiva investors provide help to her when she needs it. She will purchase bread, oil, drinks, toilet paper, soap, detergent, etc., to offer her customers the products they need.

loans.use: to purchase bread, oil, drinks, toilet paper, soap, detergent, etc., to offer her customers the products they need.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a married woman: she has four children, all of whom attend school. Nancy owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. Nancy operates a charcoal-selling business from home, selling to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she sells washing detergents. 
 
Nancy decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the Kshs 80,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal and washing detergents to sell.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal and washing detergents to sell

loans.name: Nighat Shaheen

texts.en:
Nighat Shaheen is an active borrower with BRAC Pakistan. She lives with her four children and husband in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is the guardian of her family. He has been running his own tyre business for 22 years.

Nighat Shaheen's husband wants to purchase different types of tyres for his business purposes, but due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to purchase these tyres. Therefore, Nighat Shaheen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, she’ll enable her husband to purchase relevant items for his business purposes so that he can earn a more profitable income to manage his business and household.

Nighat Shaheen is very thankful for Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enable her husband to purchase tyres for his business

loans.name: Los Rosales Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS ROSALES”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Santa Ana, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convencion y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nely ella es conviviente y tiene 37 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 10 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carne y verduras.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de ganaderia, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “Los Rosales” (The Rose Bushes) communal bank.  The communal bank is located in Santa Ana District, which is in La Convencion Province and Cusco Department.

Sra. Nely is a member who is 37-years old and has two children.  Her business is a restaurant.  She prepares different dishes such as chicken and potatoes, soups and pan-seared meats.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.  She has had her business for ten years, and it has been going very well for her.  Her dream is to expand her restaurant.  Sra. Nely is requesting the loan to purchase cooking supplies such as chicken, meat and vegetables. 

The other communal bank members make their living selling animals, with livestock businesses, with grocery stores and running restaurants. 

Sra. Nely is grateful to those who are taking part in her dream by providing the loan.  She promises to comply with her established loan re-payment plan.

loans.use: to purchase cooking supplies such as chicken, meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food products to sell.

loans.name: Maria Amanda

texts.es:
María, de 49 años de edad, es madre soltera de 2 hijos, ella vive con sus hijos y un hermano, que no es capaz de valerse por sí mismo.

María, se dedica a la comercialización de especies menores como lo son pollos y cerdos de crianza, y fue desde que su esposo abandono el hogar que ella comenzó a trabajar de esta manera, para mantener a sus familiares.

María, necesita el crédito para comprar más aves de engorde, para poder incrementar sus ingresos en esta temporada.

María, ha soñado con ver a sus hijos, ir a la universidad para que se superen y que ellos ayuden a otros de su comunidad a ser mejores personas.
texts.en:
María, 49 years old, is the single mother of 2 children. She lives with her children and a brother, who is not able to support himself.

María makes a living from selling small animals, such as chickens and pigs for breeding. It has been since her husband abandoned her home that she began to work in this way to support her family.

María needs the loan to purchase more birds for fattening to be able to increase her income this season.

María has dreamed of seeing her children go to the university to improve themselves and so that they help others of their community to be better people.

loans.use: to purchase more birds to fatten.

loans.name: Wendy Walquiria

texts.es: Wendy, tiene 30 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos, reside en el municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. Cuenta con su propio negocio donde vende útiles escolares, desde hace 4 años  como ser cuadernos, diccionarios, lápices, marcadores, borradores, sacapuntas, hilos, cintas, cartulinas, papel blanco, papel china etc. Ella inició con fondos propios y ya lleva tres ciclos de prestamos, actualmente solicita otro por 18,000 Lempiras para surtir y vender en esta época escolar, comprará cuadernos, lápices, mochilas, colores, borradores, papel etc. Su meta es que el negocio crezca y darle mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Wendy is 30 years old, is married, and has two children. She lives in the municipality of Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. For 4 years, she has had her own business, where she sells school supplies, including notebooks, dictionaries, pencils, bookmarks, erasers, pencil sharpeners, thread, tape, poster board, blank paper, tissue paper, etc. She started the business with her own money, and has already had three cycles of loans.

Now, she requests another loan for 18,000 lempiras to supply and sell items during the school year. She will buy notebooks, pencils, backpacks, colors, erasers, paper, etc. Her goal is for her business to grow and to give a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pencils, backpacks, colors, erasers, paper, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Vidal Napoleon

texts.es:
Vidal, de 55 años de edad, estudió educación básica, actualmente está acompañado y su pareja trabaja en el mercado municipal, vendiendo tortillas y sus hijos aún están estudiando. 

Vidal, tiene más de 30 años de dedicarse a las estructuras metálicas, fue un amigo quien le enseño este trabajo; ahora, tiene su propio taller en el cual se dedica específicamente a poner techos de casas, elabora puertas para casas, ventanas, balcones entre otras cosas más.

El dinero del crédito lo necesita, para comprar hierro y un motor con el cual hace las soldaduras.

El sueño de Vidal, es que su negocio crezca y pueda tener más trabajo, para darle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Vidal is 55 years old. He has a basic education. Now, he is married, and his partner works in the municipal market, selling tortillas. His children are still in school.

Vidal has more than 30 years of experience doing metalwork. A friend taught Vidal this work. Now, he has his own workshop, in which he is dedicated specifically to making roofs for houses, doors for houses, and balconies, among other things.

The money from the loan he needs is to buy iron and a motor, with which he will do the welding.

Vidal’s dream is for his business to grow and for him to have more work. This will help him provide better conditions for life for his family.

loans.use: to buy iron and a motor, with which he will do the welding.

loans.name: Cholponai

texts.ru: Чолпонай, 25 лет, в прошлом году она вышла замуж, детей пока нет. У Чолпонай высшее образование. Два года назад начала заниматься животноводством. Супруг работает в школе. Благодаря упорному труду Чолпонай, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 1 корова, 20 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Чолпонай обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы для увеличения объемов реализации экологически чистого молока. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в постройку дома для семьи.
texts.en:
Cholponai is 25 years old. Last year she got married. She does not yet have children. Cholponai has higher education. Two years ago she started working with livestock breeding. Her husband works at a school. Thanks to Cholponai's persistent work, her farm currently has a cow and 20 sheep.

With an aim to further develop her business, Cholponai turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) to purchase a dairy cow to increase the volume of organic milk to sell. She plans to invest the income from the loan in building a home for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow to increase the volume of organic milk for selling

loans.name: Yokaira

texts.en:
Yokaira has been a professional manicurist in an upscale beauty salon for more than five years. With her experience and clientele, she now has the opportunity to purchase a nail salon business from her current employer.

A loan of $4125 will allow Yokaira to purchase the existing equipment and make the business her own. This will be a dream come true!

loans.use: to start her nail salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install electrical service in her home.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 29-year-old single man from Rafah city. He lives with his parents in a small house. Ahmad works as an employee in a local firm with a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.

He would like to improve the house living conditions and buy all the needed stuff. 

Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank. By taking this loan, Ahmad will be able to provide hot water for the house without using electricity.

Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank.

loans.name: Oscar Fuentes

texts.es:
Oscar, de 43 años de edad, se dedica a la albañilería desde hace más de 25 años de edad, su nivel académico fue hasta educación básica, actualmente está casado y tiene tres hijos, de los cuales los tres están estudiando en educación básica y educación media.

Oscar, anteriormente se dedicaba a la agricultura cuando era un niño, luego empezó a trabajar con un amigo en construcción y fue de esta manera como aprendió este oficio y ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia.  

El dinero de este crédito será para comprar láminas y hierro para la construcción del techo de su casa, ya que el techo que tiene actualmente, está picado.

El sueño de Oscar, es que sus hijos estudien y logren graduarse de una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Oscar is 43 years old and has been a bricklayer for more than 25 years. He has a basic education (through 9th grade) and is married with three children. They are in basic and middle levels of school. When he was a child Oscar worked in agriculture, but later he began to work in construction with a friend. This is how he learned this trade and was able to raise his family. 

The money from this loan will be used to buy metal sheets and iron to construct a roof for his house because the existing one has holes in it. 

Oscar's dream is for his children to stick with their studies and that they are able to graduate with a university degree.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets and iron to construct a roof for his house.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 28-year-old married man from Deir El balah. He is a father of two sons and one daughter. Mohammad works as an employee in a local firm with a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.

Mohammad and his wife would like to improve the house living conditions and buy all the needed stuff. Mohammad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to provide hot water for the house without using electricity.

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 21-year-old single man from Deir El balah. He lives with his family in a small simple house. Mohammad works as a taxi driver with a low income. He would like to improve the house living conditions and buy all the needed stuff.

Mohammad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to provide hot water for the house without using electricity.

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank.

loans.name: Abdurashid

texts.ru: Абдурашид очень  жизнерадостный человек. У него большая семья, он выбрал очень творческую и интересную работу, он музыкант. Он играет на нескольких инструментах, на  дуторе (национальный щипковый инструмент), карнае (национальный духовой инструмент)  и других инструментах. Его в основном приглашают на свадьбы и другие семейные торжества, где без этих важных инструментах он не может обойтись. Этим необычным способом он зарабатывает на жизнь. Его жена является поваром  в одном кафе, она очень вкусно готовит. В настоящий момент  Абдурашид планирует добавить еще несколько новых  инструментов, так как его клиенты уже просят разнообразную и интересную музыку и мелодию. Абдурашид хочет получить  кредит для покупки нового музыкального инструмента.
texts.en:
Abdurashid is a very happy man. He has a large family. He has a chosen a very creative and interesting type of work; he is a musician. 

Abdurashid plays several instruments such as the dutar (the national plucked string instrument), the karnay (the national wind instrument) and others. He mainly goes to weddings and other family events, where he cannot manage without these instruments. He earns money for living this unusual way. His wife is a cook at a cafe. She cooks really tasty food. 

Currently Abdurashid plans to add a few new instruments, as his customers already request different types of interesting music and tunes. Abdurashid would like to get a loan to purchase a new musical instrument.

loans.use: to purchase a new musical instrument

loans.name: Srdjan

texts.en: Srdjan is 52 years old and originally from Serbia. He has been working in the trucking business for the past 10 years. Initially, he started working with to trucks. Then when he purchased a third truck, he realized the potential in the trucking business. Eventually, he rented an office with a space to park the trucks. Now, he has six subcontractors working for him and he needs the funds to set up a fuel account that will allow him to provide diesel to the drivers.

loans.use: to set up a fuel account in order to provide diesel to his drivers.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 23-year-old single man from Deir El Balah city. He lives with his parents in a small house. Mahmoud works as an employee in a local firm with a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs. Mahmoud would like to improve the house living conditions and buy all the needed stuff.

He took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank. By taking this loan, Mahmoud will be able to provide hot water for the house without using electricity.

Mahmoud appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank.

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Ashraf is a 32-year-old married man from Deir El Balah city. He lives with his wide in a small house. Ashraf works as an employee in a local firm with a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs. Ashraf would like to improve the house living conditions and buy all the needed stuff.

He took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank. By taking this loan, Ashraf will be able to provide hot water for the house without using electricity.

Ashraf appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank.

loans.name: Dúo Jericó Group

texts.es:
DUO JERICO
El grupo formado por doña Maria Olivia de 31 años de edad, es casada, y tiene 3 hijos, es la líder de este grupo y nos cuenta que se dedica ha la venta de comida y refacciones, y tambien a la venta de tubo y prensa, y también hace costuras desde hace 4 años, ella es una mujer trabajadora, porque con su esfuerzo ayuda al gasto de su hogar juntamente con su esposo. Ella solicita este crédito para poder incrementar su negocio, ya que necesita comprar cortes para elaborar delantales, y comprar prensa para hacer tubo y vender la prensa, espera que fape le pueda apoyar con esta gran necesidad.
texts.en:
DUO JERICO is a group formed by Maria Olivia. Maria is 31 years old, is married and has 3 children. She is the group's leader and she tells us how she makes a living by selling food and refreshments. She also sells tubes and newspapers and has been sewing for 4 years. She is a very hardworking woman and through her efforts she helps her husband with the household expenses. 

She is asking for this loan to be able to expand her business as she needs to buy fabric to make aprons. She also needs to buy newspapers to make tubes that she will sell. she hopes that FAPE might help her with what she needs.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make aprons to later sell

loans.name: Latifeh

texts.en: Latifeh is a 63-year-old Lebanese married woman with one child. Despite her older age, she doesn’t give up and does her best to continue supporting her family anyhow. She has been working for many years in producing food that she makes at her house. And now, Latifeh states that she lacks materials and supplies needed. This is why she is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to ensure acquiring those , hence increasing  productivity plus income. Latifeh is an optimistic person only searching for a way to earn a good living.

loans.use: to purchase materials and supplies needed

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es:
Salvador, de 72 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, desde muy pequeño tuvo que trabajar junto a su padre, para contribuir al sustento diario de su familia.- Actualmente, está casado y tiene un hijo, pero ya no vive junto a él, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Salvador, tiene muchos años de experiencia en los trabajos agrícolas, actualmente trabaja dos hectáreas de cultivos de maíz y también trabaja la ganadería, tiene vacas lecheras. 

El dinero de este crédito será para comprar insumos agrícolas y para rentar la tierra en donde sembrará.

El sueño de Salvador es continuar trabajando en sus cultivos, como hasta ahora lo ha hecho.
texts.en:
Salvador, 72, didn't have the opportunity to study.  From a young age, he had to work with his father in order to contribute to the daily sustenance of his family.  Nowadays, he is married and has one son, who no longer lives with him.  His wife does housework.
Salvador has many years of experience in farm work.  These days, he works two hectares of a corn crop and he also works raising livestock.  He has milk cows.
The money from this loan will be for the purchase of agricultural supplies and to rent the land where he will plant.
Salvador's dream is to continue working his crops as he has done all along.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to rent the land where he will plant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her husband to buy repair parts for his workshop

loans.name: Gs - Camino Al Exito-Ccotañe Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “GS - CAMINO AL EXITO-CCOTAÑE”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Colquepata, perteneciente a la provincia de Paucratambo y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria ella es casada y tiene 37 años y tiene 7 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de agricultura, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva maiz,quinua y papas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes y semillas.

Este préstamo es parte de una de las líneas de crédito de la Asociación Arariwa su nombre es Credi Yapa, esta línea de crédito es otorgado a los prestatarios con buen historial crediticio, siendo este un grupo que cumple dichas características.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de agricultura, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The partners belong to the communal bank “GS - CAMINO AL EXITO-CCOTAÑE”.  This bank is located in the Colquepata District, and belongs to the Paucartambo Province and the Cusco Department.
The partner Maria, 37, is married and has seven children.  She works in her agriculture business.  The partner has a plot of land where she plants corn, quinoa, and potatoes.  She works from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.  She has been in this business for five years and it is going well.  Her dream is to expand her cultivation land.  The partner is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and seeds.
This loan is part of one of the lines of credit of the Asociacion Arariwa which is called Credi Yapa.  This line of credit is offered to borrowers with good credit history.  This group is one with such characteristics.
The other partners make a living in the agriculture business, animal sales business, grocery store business, and the restaurant business.
The partner thanks those who form part of her dream in this way and promises to comply with the terms of repayment in the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Hejazi

texts.en:
Hejazi is a 20-year-old single man from a village near Jenin city. He lives with his parents in a small house. Hejazi's father works as a taxi driver with a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.

Hejazi would like to improve the house living conditions and buy all the needed stuff. He took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank. By taking this loan, Hejazi will be able to provide hot water for the house without using electricity.

Hejazi appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank

loans.name: Congolon Group

texts.es:
Doña María Fernanda, tiene 34 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene 6 hijos, y reside en una aldea de Gracias, Lempira. Toda su vida la ha dedicado a la agricultura de granos básicos maíz y frijol, hace 13 años decidió cultivar café el cual vende en la zoca local. El préstamo que solicita es por 5,000 Lempiras en forma grupal, y es el segundo ciclo. Este préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de abonos y en limpieza de la finca de café. Su plan es mejorar la finca y obtener mejor cosecha de café. Con las ganancias piensa en mejorar su vivienda para que su familia viva mejor.
El grupo a que pertenece se llama Congolon que esta formado por 9 integrantes, que viven en la misma comunidad, se dedican a la agricultura, de los cuales 5 de ellos han solicitado otro préstamo que es por 25,000 lempiras en total, y lo utilizaran para fertilizar y limpiar su finca de café. En la foto se identifican así: a la izquierda esta María Fernanda, María Juana, Juan, José y Melquiades a la derecha.
texts.en:
Doña María Fernanda, age 34, has a husband and 6 children. She lives in a neighbourhood of Gracias, Lempira. She has worked in agriculture all her life, cultivating corn and beans. She decided to start growing coffee 13 years ago, and sells it locally.
She is requesting a loan of 5,000 lempiras with a group. This is the group's second loan cycle. She will invest this loan in the purchase of fertilizer and to clean up the coffee farm.
Her plan is to improve the farm and obtain a better coffee harvest. With her earnings she plans to improve her home so that her family lives better.
She belongs to the Congolon group, which has nine members who live in the same community and work in agriculture. Five of them have requested another loan for a total of 25,000 lempiras, which they will use on fertilizer and to clean up their farms.
They are pictured as follows: left to right, María Fernanda, María Juana, Juan, José and Melquiades.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and tidy up the coffee farm.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a clean ccok stove.

loans.name: Grupo Chuachinup 2 Group

texts.es:
María es una mujer muy competitiva y generosa ella tiene 36 años de edad, tiene una hermosa familia de 2 dos hijos y sus edades son de 5 y 8 años y es simplemente unida de hecho con su esposo esta familia vive en una comunidad de Chuachinup.
María ( se encuentra en el lado derecho de la fotográfica la de blusa rosada con blanco) es una mujer que le gusta trabajar pues ella actualmente se dedica a la  producción de bananos, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad,  con esta actividad ella obtienen mejores  ingresos para mantener a su familia. María ahora se ve a la necesidad de darle mantenimiento a su la producción de banano que tiene pero ella en este momento no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para hacerlo, es por ello que solicita un prestamo que lo utilizara para  pagar la mano de obra de los obreros que realizan la limpieza dentro de la parcela de banano.
 María es líder del grupo Chuachinup 2 las integrantes de su grupo también tienen la misma necesidad pues ellas también se dedican a la producción de banano, todas ellas han considerado que realizar un prestamo será la mejor manera de poder hacer que su producción pueda salir con la mejor calidad. María y su grupo tienen la esperanza de contar con este prestamo para seguir manteniendo la producción y así obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
María is a competitive and generous woman. She is 36 years old. She has a beautiful family with two sons who are 5 and 8 years old. She and her husband are in a domestic partnership. Their family lives in the community of Chauchinup. María (who is pictured on the right side of the photo in the pink blouse with white) is a woman who likes to work. She currently works as a banana farmer. She has been in this business for 20 years, and through this business she obtains the income with which she supports her family. María currently needs to maintain her banana crop, but she does not have enough money to do it. So she requests a loan which she will use to pay the laborers who will clean the plantation. 

María is the leader of the group "Chuachinup 2". The other members of the group also have the same need, because they also grow bananas. All of the women have decided that getting a loan will be the best way to ensure that their crops are of the highest quality. María and her group hope to be able to count on this loan to continue caring for their crops and thereby increasing their earnings.

loans.use: to cultivate her banana crop.

loans.name: Fausto De Jesús

texts.es:
Fausto, de 64 años de edad, no posee ningún tipo de nivel académico, actualmente está acompañado y tiene dos hijos y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos. 

Fausto, tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con ganado, él compra ganado joven para castrarlo y dejarlo un par de meses o en ocasiones hasta medio año y luego lo vende.- También, trabaja la agricultura, actualmente trabaja una hectárea de maíz y otra de frijol.

El dinero del crédito será para comprar reces, para pastarlas seis meses, porque tiene pasto de las cosechas que corto últimamente y con eso podrá mantener su ganado y venderlo cuando sea oportuno. 

El sueño que tiene es mejorar la vivienda en donde vive, ya que está en muy malas condiciones y sabe que al realizar esa actividad, tendrá ingresos para realizar su proyecto.
texts.en:
Fuasto is 64 years old. He did not go to school. He is in a relationship and has two children. His partner is a housewife.

Fausto has been working with cattle for a long time. He purchases male calves and castrates them, then a few months (or on occasion half a year) later, he sells them. He also works in agriculture. Currently he is cultivating one hectare of corn and another of beans.

The money from this loan will be used to purchase cattle, which he will feed for six months on hay from recent harvests, and with this he will be able to maintain his cattle and sell them when the time is right. 

Fausto knows that if he pursue this activity, he will have enough income to fulfill his dream of improving the dwelling where he lives, which is in very poor condition.

loans.use: para comprar cattle.

loans.name: Panti Pallay De Ampay Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PANTI PALLAY DE AMPAY”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Pisaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Concepcion ella es casada y tiene 48 años y tiene 5 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de crianza de animales, la socia cria los pollos y cuyes y  los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes mercados, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los pollos y cuyes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pollos y cuyes y alimentos para los pollos y cuyes.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de ganaderia, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de artesania.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Panti Pallay De Ampay” communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Pisac, which belongs to the province of Calca in the department of Cusco.

Concepción is married. She is 48 years old and has five children. She has her own business, which consists of raising animals. She raises chickens and guinea pigs, fattens them up, and then sells them at the different markets. She has had this business for several years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to have a fixed location from which she can sell her chickens and guinea pigs. She is requesting the loan in order to buy more chickens and guinea pigs, as well as feed for them.

The other members make a living by selling animals, selling livestock, running a grocery store, and selling artisanal products.

The member is grateful to those who are part of her dream through this site and is committed to making her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy chickens, guinea pigs, and feed for her animals

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es: Marcos tiene 32 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos de 6 años y un año de edad. Marcos es un hombre trabajador quien para ganarse la vida se gana la vida mediante la prestación de servicios de corte de cabello. Marcos, actualmente, no cuenta con el servicio de energía eléctrica por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para pagar la mano de obra necesaria para a instalación de la energía eléctrica y de esta forma brindar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Marcos is 32 years old. He lives in his own house with his partner and their two children, aged six and one. Marcos is a hard-working man who earns a living as a barber. Marcos currently has no electricity, which is why he has made the decision to request this loan from FUSAI. He will use it to pay for workers to install electricity and, in this way, give his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay workers to install electricity in his house

loans.name: Joel Daniel

texts.es:
Joel Daniel tiene 29 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su hermano y su padre en el distrito de Cayaltí que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en mototaxi, realiza esta actividad desde hace más de 03 años contando con experiencia en el sector y con buenas referencias por parte de sus clientes. Además se dedica a realizar labores de mecánica en un conocido taller de la zona de Cayaltí. El destino del préstamo será para la compra de algunos accesorios y mantenimiento de su vehículo ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado. Esto le permitirá brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos y tendrá un impacto positivo en su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Joel Daniel is 29 years old. He lives in his own home with his brother and his father in the Cayaltí district which is located in the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Perú. He lives in a community which is dedicated to commerce, agriculture and livestock.

Joel offers transportation services on his mototaxi. He has been in this business for over three years. He counts on his experience in this sector and has good references from his clients. In addition, he works as a mechanic in a well-known workshop in the Cayaltí area. 

The loan will be used to purchase a few accessories for, and to do maintenance on his vehicle, which is currently in bad condition. This will enable him to provide a better service to his clients, which will help him earn more money and have a positive impact in the quality and life of his family.

loans.use: to purchase accessories which will be used to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy an ELSA clean cook stove

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a clean cook stove

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy an ELSA clean cook stove

loans.name: Celso

texts.en:
Celso is 67 years old and lives in Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is married with two adult children. Celso is a retired government employee and presently enjoys a monthly pension of not less than 11,000 PHP. He has been receiving this for five years already. He also receives income from his agricultural land, particularly cocoland. 

He has requested a loan to be used in purchasing maintenance medicines for his loving wife. Celso has been a member of PMPC for two years.  In the future, Celso hopes to expand his agricultural business.

loans.use: to purchase maintenance medicines

loans.name: Joniel

texts.en:
Joniel wants to fulfill his dreams by completing a degree. His father is a farmer. Joniel religiously pays attention to making good marks in every semester he enters, to pay off the sacrifices and hardship of his father for their family. 

For another school year, Joniel is in need of money to pay for his school fees. Joniel has big dreams to help his family and for his siblings as well, which is the reason why he works and strives hard for his education.

loans.use: to pay for his school fees

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en: Rosario is 35 years old and she has five children. She was abandoned by her husband many years ago, and she lives at her parent’s house. Rosario makes and sells bread. She wakes up at 5:00 a.m. and it is the only thing that supports her family. She needs a loan to buy supplies to make bread She hopes you can help her.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make bread.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a clean cook stove

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a clean cook stove

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a clean cook stove

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is from Looc Proper, Plaridel, in the Philippines. He is 58 years old and is married. Edwin owns and manages a retail store in a rented space in the public market where he displays and sells assorted goods. He has been engaged in his business for two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month. 

In 2009, Edwin joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Edwin is requesting a new loan of 7,500 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to be used as working capital. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and to increase his working capital.

loans.name: Vencita

texts.en:
Vencita is 55 years old and married with four children. The family lives in Plaridel, Philippines. Vencita has rented a space in the fish market where she displays her fish to sell. She has been in this business for many years already, earning a good return, enabling her to support the needs of their big family. 

Since she wants to generate more income, Vencita joined Paglaum MPC to gain insurance and financial assistance, purchasing fish in bulk for resale at market. She has now applied for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy more fish to sell. She is hoping that with Paglaum’s help, she can become a successful vendor someday and eventually a fish stockholder in the public market at nearby towns.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy an Elsa clean cook stove.

loans.name: Sergia

texts.en:
Sergia is 72 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with four children now at their adult age. Sergia earns a living from her monthly pension and support from her son and daughters.  She earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month. This amount is so helpful to meet her needs. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing cement and paying the labor costs for their house completion. Sergia has been a member of PMPC for 10 years. At present, she is enjoying the programs and services of PMPC, particularly on insurances and savings.

loans.use: to purchase cement and to pay the labor costs for their house completion.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en: Alberto is 63 years old. He is a widow and has five adult sons. Alberto is alone and he is working at a dry cleaning now.  Also, he receives a retirement payment. Alberto needs another loan because he needs to pay for the repairs at his house. The recent rains caused damage to the walls, and they need some repairs. Alberto is healthy and he hopes you can help him with the loan. As you can see in the picture, Albert is in trouble.

loans.use: to pay to fix the walls of his house.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia thought of good fortune when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she could request financial assistance for her chosen business. Lilia has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. Recently, she requested a loan to purchase additional piglets for commercial sale and bags of feed for her growing hogs. She wishes to continue to manage her business more effectively with the support of her family. Someday, she hopes to repair her house, to provide her family a safe and decent living.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets for commercial sale and bags of feed for her growing hogs

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Lydia is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina is 51 years old and a widow. She is residing in Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She joined PMPC in May of 2012 in order to access the programs and services of the said co-op. Recently, she is accessing her third loan in the amount of PHP 14,900 to have additional working capital for her existing business in order to buy more salt, oil, soy sauce and coconut vinegar for retail sale. Rosalina hopes that her business will grow to continuously support her youngest daughter in getting a degree in college.

loans.use: to buy more salt, oil, soy sauce and coconut vinegar for retail sale

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en: Sandra is 41 years old and lives in Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children who are now at their school and infant ages. Sandra earns a living from her sari-sari store, vulcanizing shop, motor wash and boarding house business. She's been in these businesses for three years already and earns approximately PHP10,000 each month doing these types of business activities. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing one motorcycle for business purposes. Sandra has been a member of PMPC for almost four years. In the future, Sandra hopes to expand her boarding house and motor wash businesses.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 45 years old and lives in Seti, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with one child of school age. Teodora earns a living from her coconut and copra (dried coconut meat) buying and trading business. She's been in the business for 10 years already. She earns approximately PHP 7,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She is also receiving a monthly pension as a surviving spouse.

Teodora has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional coconuts and copra for resale. Teodora has been a member of PMPC for almost 2 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her coconut and copra trading business.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconuts and copra

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is 45 years old and lives in Seti, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children who are now adults and of school age. Juliet has been engaged in vegetable gardening and copra production businesses for 15 years already. At present, she's also engaged in a hog raising activity. She earns approximately PHP 4,000 each month doing these types of business activities. She has requested a loan to acquire a parcel of agricultural land pawned to her. Juliet has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, she hopes to expand her copra production business.

loans.use: To acquire a parcel of agricultural land

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Violeta has switched from selling snacks to selling "longganisa" (processed meat) and vending dried fish. Her business is doing well when she doubles her time perfecting her own "longganisa" recipe, and with her dedication to her dried fish vending. With her husband's help, she has maximized her profits and keeps pursuing her goals for the good of her family. The reason why she availed herself of another loan from PMPC was to buy more kilos of meat for her "longganisa" business and pay for more dried fish to sell. Today, Violeta is able to help others do retailing business with her "longganisa" and dried fish, so they as well earn for their own families.

loans.use: to buy more kilos of meat for her "longganisa"  business and pay for more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase merchandise, such as clothing, shoes, sandals, and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Francia Group

texts.en:
In the western highlands of Guatemala at an altitude of over 8,000 feet, rests the municipality of San Francisco El Alto. San Francisco is known for its large conifer forests that encompass its rural communities, filling the air with the scent of pines and cypress. These communities are almost entirely indigenous Maya K’iche, who in addition to raising animals and growing corn, beans, and other staple vegetables, are major producers of typical indigenous textiles and fabrics.
 
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Franica” is made up of 10 women from one of San Francisco El Alto’s rural communities. “Francia” is an experienced group, with over half of the women returning for their fifth loan cycle or greater with Friendship Bridge.  Paulina is the most experienced member, returning to Friendship Bridge for her ninth loan cycle. As a veteran, Paulina uses her extensive knowledge to effectively lead and provide support for newer group members. Paulina has five years of business experience, owning and operating a small pharmacy, where she applies her knowledge as a nurse’s assistant to treat community members with basic medicines. Paulina provides her community with health care, in a region where access is sparse. Paulina is applying for a loan to increase and improve her inventory of medicine in order to effectively care for her customers. With the continued success of her business, Paulina hopes to continue providing education for her young daughter, so that she can graduate from school with a degree and have a higher quality of life than her mother. Paulina and the rest of the members of “Francia” are excited to work with Friendship Bridge again, particularly because of the monthly educational training from their loan officer. They are hopeful that this year will bring continued improvement in their businesses and personal lives.

With the support of investors, “Francia” will have the opportunity to determine their own futures and the futures of their families with the returns from their business pursuits. Thank you, Kiva lenders, for your support of Paulina and her Trust Bank “Francia.”

loans.use: to increase and improve her inventory of medicine in order to effectively care for her customers

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elsa is 47 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Elsa has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business like fish net, bamboo, etc.

Elsa has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business like fish net and bamboo

loans.name: Johna

texts.en:
Johna is 46 years old and married with two children.

Johna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, noodles, sugar, milk coffee, etc.

Johna has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and earns additional income from her ready to wear business.

Johna aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, noodles, sugar, milk and coffee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Sirena Group

texts.es:
Está conformado por tres mujeres de la etnia miskita: Alice Jule, Alicia Rafaela y Betty, viven en la comunidad de Lamlaya, en lengua miskita significa agua mansa, localizada a 15 kilómetros de la ciudad de Bilwi, Municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Las tres tienen establecidos sus respectivos negocios de: Pulpería, venta de ropa nueva y  venta de fritos. Con el deseo de mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias; se organizaron hace aproximadamente un año para poder accesar a préstamos con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana. 

Betty: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una señora amable de 49 años de edad, madre soltera de 6 hijos: Dos adolescentes que estudian su secundaria y 4 están cursando su primaria, sus hijos son su inspiración para seguir luchando. Desde hace 2 años elabora en su casa de tambo de madera pan de coco, en un horno artesanal y fritos. De esta manera genera sus propios ingresos y para asumir los gastos del hogar y estudios de sus hijos. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar insumos e ingredientes: harina, levadura, aceite, coco, azúcar, soda, filipitas, repollo, tomate, vinagre, pollo. Ella sueña con tener una pulpería y ser una comerciante exitosa.
texts.en:
This group is composed of three women of the Miskita ethnic group: Alice Jule, Alicia Rafaela, and Betty. They live in the Lamlaya community, which in the Miskita language means "gentle waters". It is located 15 kilometers from the city of Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas. The three of them have established their own businesses: a small grocery store, new clothing sales, and fried food sales, respectively. With the desire of improving the quality of life of their families, they got together approximately one year ago in order to have access to loans with solidarity group guarantee from Pana Pana. 

Betty is a member of this solidarity group. She is 49 years old. She is a kind woman and a single mother of six children: two teenagers who are in middle school and four who are in elementary school. Her children inspire her to continue working hard. For the past two years, she has made coconut bread in an artisanal oven as well as fried foods in her wooden stilt house. In this way, she earns her own income in order to cover household expenses and the cost of her children's education. She is requesting a loan to buy supplies and ingredients such as flour, yeast, oil, coconut, sugar, soda, filipitas (a banana variety), cabbage, tomatoes, vinegar, and chicken. Her dream is to have a small grocery store and to be a successful merchant.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients to make coconut bread and fried foods.

loans.name: Elido

texts.en: Elido has 10 years of experience and was able to stay in business during the past few years through the slowdown in the economy. With this loan, he wants to purchase equipment and build his credit score in order to access financial institutions in the future.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for his auto body shop

loans.name: Bella Vista Group

texts.en:
San Pedro La Laguna, on the shores of Lake Atitlan, resting in the shadow of a volcano, has an international reputation. 

The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Bella Vista” is made up of seven women from San Pedro, who have come together to apply for their second loan funded by Kiva lenders. In our first report about the group, we told the story of Julia, the president of “Bella Vista.” Julia, now in her sixth loan cycle with Friendship Bridge, continues to provide leadership and guidance to the other six members of the Trust Bank. Doña Maria, a 56-year-old grandmother, is one of the newest members of the Trust Bank. Maria joined the group to continue to expand her bakery business. She is applying for a loan to buy ingredients, utensils, and cookware, to continue selling her popular breads, pastries, cakes and pizzas. Due to her expertise and the variety of goods that Maria offers, she has been able to expand her bakery business from her small storefront. Now, Maria sells her freshly baked goods all over San Pedro to small stores, reaching a wider range of customers. With this loan, Maria will be able to maintain her growing bakery business. Maria hopes to improve the quality of her bakery as well of the quality of her life with the support of this small loan.

On behalf of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Bella Vista,” Julia would like to thank Kiva for the support and belief in the group.
