Without the support of Kiva, Julia and her Trust Bank would be without the opportunity to create a better future for themselves and their families. Thank you, Kiva, for your continued support!

loans.use: to buy ingredients, utensils, and cookware, to continue selling her popular breads, pastries, cakes and pizzas.

loans.name: Lerna

texts.en:
Lerna is 59 years old and has three children. She is married and has one child who is still in school.

Lerna is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lerna has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Lilibeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Ma. Lilibeth works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Ma. Lilibeth is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her fishing business.

Ma. Lilibeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials needed

loans.name: Augusto Jose

texts.es:
Augusto es padre de dos niños, los que son su principal motivación para mejorar y esforzarse día a día en ser un profesional de calidad. Él estudia Contaduría pública y auditoria, pero aún no trabaja en esa área sino en ventas y servicios de una empresa de la capital. Él se esfuerza y aprovecha todos los medios para avanzar en su carrera  y graduarse lo más pronto posible, porque así mejorará su condición de vida. 

El financiamiento lo solicita para la compra de una computadora, que le servirá para desarrollarse e impulsarse más como estudiante y como profesional, pues esta herramienta es básica para cualquier tipo de  educación. Augusto desea finalizar con éxitos su carrera y comenzar en su campo laboral.
texts.en:
Augusto is a father to two children, who are his main motivation for improving himself and for making an effort each day to be successful. He studies public accounting and auditing, but he does not work in that area yet, as he works in sales and services for a company in the capital. He makes an effort and he takes advantage of the means available to advance in his career and to graduate as soon as possible, because that is how he will improve his life.

The loan he is requesting is to buy a computer, which he will use to develop and motivate himself more as a student and professionally, this is a basic tool for any type of education. Augusto hopes to finish his degree successfully and to start in his field of work.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es: Don Marco, tiene 53 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 5 hijos y reside en una aldea del Municipio de Gracias, Lempira. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura de granos básicos y lleva 15 años cultivando café. El café que produce lo vende en oro en la misma zona.  Don Marco ha solicitado un préstamo por 12,000 lempiras para comprar abonos y fertilizantes para aplicar a su finca de café, esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar la cosecha y calidad de producción. El plan que tiene es continuar con la siembra de café y ayudar a sus hijos a que terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Don Marco is 53 years old. He is married and has 5 children. He lives in a village in the township of Gracias, Lempira. He has grown basic grains all his life, and for 15 years he has been raising coffee. He sells the unroasted, unhulled coffee that he produces in the same area. Don Marco has applied for a loan of 12,000 lempiras to buy compost and fertilizers to apply to his coffee farm. This investment will help him to improve the harvest and quality of production. 

His plan is to continue planting coffee and to help his children finish school.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers for his coffee planting

loans.name: Myra

texts.en: Myra is 46 years old and married with three children. Two children are in school. Myra works very hard to provide for her children. Myra runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for five years. She has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, to purchase more items to sell such as canned goods, coffee, spices, shampoo, soft drinks, etc. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en: Juan is a small dairy farmer who was looking for solutions to reduce his operating costs, which mostly consist of expensive LP gas and chemical fertilizers. By asking for a loan to invest in a 12 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa Biodigester, he will become self-sufficient in his energy and fertilizer supply, as he will transform his cows' manure into biogas and nutrient-rich organic fertilizer. Not only will Juan save money, but he will also protect the environment by treating the waste instead of letting it contaminate underground water sources. In addition, his wife will no longer cook using wood, which will drastically improve her health, as the toxic smoke is eliminated from the house. Juan will apply the organic fertilizer on his corn field, nourishing the soils and increasing their yield in a sustainable way. As his productivity increases and he saves money by displacing LP gas and chemical fertilizers, Juan plans to use his savings to buy more cows, improve the infrastructure of his farm and invest in his children's education. This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester; the remaining part is covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a biodigester for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to build bio-digester and utilization of biogas residue as organic fertilizer

loans.name: Grupo Guineales Sector Loma Group

texts.es:
Dina es una mujer unida de hecho con su esposo, tienen 24 años de edad vive junto a su familia en una comunidad de Guineales, Dina tiene 2 hijos con las edades de 4 y 7 años de edad y solo uno está estudiando en una escuela de su  comunidad.
Dina (la de blusa blanca se encuentra en el lado derecho de la fotografía) es una mujer que lucha cada día para apoyar a su familia pues ella desde hace 5 años se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, le gusta hacer esta actividad pues se relaciona con mucha gente de su comunidad y esto también le permite a ella realizar otras actividades, ella con los ingresos  que genera contribuye con su esposo para el sostenimiento de su familia, Dina con el afán de seguir realizando  su negocio ha tomado la decisión de hacer un prestamo que lo utilizara para comprar más ropa típica y poderlas vender a un buen precio.
Dina y su grupo sueñan que con esta inversión podrán mejorar sus ingresos para seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
Dina is a woman who is in a domestic partnership with her husband. She is 24 years old, and she lives with her family in the community of Guineales. Dina has two children who are 4 and 7 years old. One of them is studying at a school in the community.

Dina (the woman wearing a white blouse that is on the right side of the photograph) is a woman who fights every day in order to support her family. For the past 5 years, she has made a living buying and selling traditional clothing. She enjoys this work, as it allows her to interact with many people from her community. In addition, this work allows her to perform other work. With the income that she earns, she is able to help her husband support their family. 

Dina, with the desire to continue with her business, has decided to request a loan, which she will use to buy more traditional clothing that she will later sell at good prices. Dina and her group hope that this loan will help them improve their incomes so that they can continue supporting their families.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing for sale.

loans.name: Dúo Abejitas De Santo Tomas Group

texts.es:
Dúo Abejitas de Santo Tomas
Este dúo está formado por doña Ana Lucrecia, ella tiene 39 años de edad y se dedica  al venta de ropa para dama, caballero niño y niña así como calzado en general, se ha dedicado desde ya hace varios años a esta actividad en el área de Santo Tomas, ella está solicitando el crédito para la inversión de ropa para caballero, dama y niños como blusas, playeras, y zapatos, su deseo es seguir invirtiendo y seguir creciendo su negocio, para asi seguir construyendo su casa.
texts.en:
The "Little Bees of Santo Tomas" duo was formed by Ana Lucrecia. She is 39 years old, and she sells clothing for women, men, and boys and girls, as well as footwear in general. She has already worked in this business for a number of years in the area of Santo Tomas. She is applying for the loan to invest in clothing for men, women, and children, such as blouses, beachwear, and shoes. 

Her wish is to continue investing and continue growing her business, so that in this way she can continue building her house.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Getchimany

texts.en:
Getchimany is 32 years old and married with three children. With three children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Getchimany runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like condiments, eggs, canned goods, groceries, etc.

Getchimany has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Getchimany would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like condiments, eggs, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Petra

texts.en:
Petra is an experienced dairy farmer who raises her cows and cultivates corn to feed them with forage. She is looking forward to taking advantage of her cows' and sheep's manure to produce her own biogas and organic fertilizer, thereby being able to displace the costly and unsustainable LP gas and chemical fertilizer she used to buy. The biogas will be directly connected to the cookstove and boiler in the house, while the nutrient-rich fertilizer will allow Petra to nourish the soil of her field in a natural way, increasing the yield of her crops in a sustainable manner. She would like to plant more trees and the potent fertilizer will help them grow strong. As she saves money, she plans to buy more cows to expand her milk production and improve the quality of the food for her animals.

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to invest in a 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is a married woman with four children. She is 45 years old and her four children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Esterlita has a seaweed business in the Philippines. Esterlita requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy raw materials for her seaweed plantation business.

Esterlita has been in this business for five years. In the future, Esterlita would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her seaweed plantation business

loans.name: Marie Char

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Marie Char works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. She is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her fishing business.

Marie Char has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials needed.

loans.name: Julie Ann

texts.en:
Julie Ann is a married woman with four children. She is 28 years old, and three of her children are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Julie Ann has a seaweed business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy raw materials for her seaweed plantation business. Julie Ann has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her seaweed plantation business.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 31 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Mary Grace is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Mary Grace has been in this business for six years and also earns additional income from a buy and sell ready to wear clothing business.

Mary Grace is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Charita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Charita works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling beverages in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Charita is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy more beverages to sell, like coconut wine, etc. for her business.

Charita has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more beverages to sell, like coconut wine, etc.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is a married woman with four children. She is 40 years old and all of her children are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a seaweed business in the Philippines. 

Esterlita has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy raw materials for her seaweed plantation business. She has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her seaweed plantation business

loans.name: Analee

texts.en:
Analee is a married woman. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Analee is 29 years old now.

Analee has a buy and sell coconut wine business in the Philippines. Analee requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase containers of coconut wine to sell.

Analee has been in this business for four years. In the future, Analee would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Cristina is 53 years old and two of her children are in school.

Cristina has a fishing business in the Philippines. Cristina requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business.

Cristina has been in this business for 29 years. In the future, Cristina would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials needed

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es:
Luis, de 26 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, actualmente trabaja como agricultor desde hace 6 años, está casado y su esposa trabaja como docente en un centro educativo, desde hace 11 años, tiene solo un hijo, el cual está estudiando en la escuela.

Luis, desde que estaba joven trabajaba junto a su padre, cultivando hortaliza tales como tomates y chile verde.- Luego, cuando tenía 20 años empezó a trabajar en sus propios cultivos, actualmente trabaja una hectárea de maíz y también se dedica a la ganadería,  el compra ganado para repastar un cierto periodo de tiempo y luego vender. 

El dinero del crédito será invertido para comprar insumos agrícolas y para comprar una res, para castizarlas y luego venderlas. 

El sueño de Luis, es poder trabajar con sus cultivos y engordar sus reses para tener mayores ingresos y darle la oportunidad a su hijo para que culmine sus estudios.
texts.en:
Luis, 26, has a high school education and he has been working as a farmer for the past six years. He is married and his wife has worked as a teacher in an educational center for the past eleven years. He only has one child, who attends school.

Since Luis was young, he has worked with his father, growing vegetables such as tamales and green chilies. Then when he was twenty years old he started to work on his own crops. Now he grows a hectare of corn as well as raising livestock. He buys cattle to raise for a certain period of time to later sell.

The money from the loan will be used to buy farming supplies and livestock, to breed and later sell.

Luis' dream is to be able to work with his crops and to fatten his livestock to increase his income and to give his son the opportunity to finish school.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and livestock.

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina is a woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Merlina is 44 years old and three of her children are in school.

Merlina has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Merlina requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other materials needed for her business.

Merlina has been in this business for two years. In the future, Merlina would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other materials needed

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose tiene 41 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Pucará que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercio de ganado vacuno y animales de corral como gallinas, cerdos, cuyes, entre otros, cuenta con 06 años de experiencia en este negocio y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. El crédito será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales así como para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento del lugar donde los cría (corrales). Con esto Jose espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes lo que le permitirá generar mayores ingresos que le permitirán tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose is 41-years old. He lives with his wife and their two children in Pucará District, which is located in Jaén Province and the Cajamarca Region of Perú's northern mountains. Life in their district is tranquil. The people there make their livings in agriculture, by raising livestock and in trade.

Jose makes his living raising and selling cattle and barnyard animals such as hens, pigs, guinea pigs and others. He has six years of experience in this business and has regular customers who have given postive personal and work references on his behalf. Jose will use the loan to purchase a larger quantity of animals and to repair and provide maintenance for the place he raises them (the corral). With this, Jose hopes to offer a greater variety of animals to his customers, which will allow him to generate a greater income, which in turn will allow him to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a greater number of animals and to make some repairs and provide maintenance to the place he raises them (the corral).

loans.name: Marie Cris

texts.en:
Marie Cris is a married woman with two children. She is 23 years old and one of her children is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a seaweed business in the Philippines. 

Marie Cris has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy raw materials for her seaweed plantation business. She has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her seaweed plantation business.

loans.name: Norelita

texts.en:
Norelita is a married woman with four children. Norelita is 53 years old now. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Norelita has a fishing business in the Philippines. Norelita requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets, etc. for her business.

Norelita has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Norelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish nets for her business

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a married woman with six children. She is 38 years old and five of her children are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a seaweed business in the Philippines. 

Margie has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy raw materials for her seaweed plantation business. She has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her seaweed plantation business.

loans.name: Timotea

texts.en:
Timotea is a married woman with one child. Timotea is 56 years old now. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Timotea has a buy and sell fish business in the Philippines. Timotea requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Timotea has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Timotea would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Sotencia

texts.en:
Sotencia is a married woman with four children. She is 58 years old and all of her children are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a business fishing for shellfish in the Philippines. 

Sotencia has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy raw materials for her business. She has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her shellfish fishing business.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Her name is Delia, 50, a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Villamor and has four children of which three are working and the youngest is still in High School. She works to augment their income to meet their daily personal, household needs and for the education of her child.

Delia has a native cakes and "halo-halo"stand. She makes and sells native rice cakes and "halo-halo" which is a traditional Filipino treat consisting of a blend of fruits, sweet preserves, evaporated milk, and shaved ice. It is frequently topped with a scoop of ice cream. The name literally means "Mix-Mix". Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Aside from her food stand she also has a small piggery farm at their backyard. She earns a minimum net income of Php 700 a day.

To help her continue operations of her business she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan to pay for the sticky, rice, coconut milk, sugar, sweet preserved and local fruits, ice for making rice cakes and "halo-halo" for sale. Part of the loan she will use to buy the ingredients needed for her "halo-halo" stand. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given her which will surely help fund their daily needs.

Delia hopes to maintain and grow her business and find a good location to rent for her snacks stand. She prays for the health and protection for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the ingredients for her rice cake and "halo-halo" for sale.

loans.name: Niagai

texts.en:
Niagai is a 44-year-old unwed mother of 2 children. To earn a living, she makes and sells barbeque in her community. She has a year of experience in this business. 

Niagai needs a loan in order to buy a BBQ grill, sausages, mutton flaps, chicken wings, mayonnaise, and a sack of potatoes. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

Niagai has been a member of South Pacific Business Development since 2015.

loans.use: to buy a BBQ grill, sausages, mutton flaps, chicken wings, mayonnaise, and a sack of potatoes.

loans.name: Bernadita

texts.en:
Bernadita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has had a food vending business in the Philippines for four years. She earns additional income from a general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. A loan of PHP 20000 through NWTF will help Bernadita to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business.

 She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 57 years old and married with seven children, three of whom are in school. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream:  to save enough money to send her children to college.

For four years, Estelita has been farming sugarcane in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from pig fattening and dried fish delivery. A loan of  PHP 13000 through NWTF will help Estelita buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 42 years old and is married with 2 children, 1 of whom is in school.

Ofelia is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years now, and she has borrowed 8 times in the past from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to sustain it. 

Ofelia has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Ofelia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 25 years now.

Jocelyn has requested a 18,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she can expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Jolyn

texts.en:
Jolyn works hard to support her family. Jolyn is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net and other fishing materials.

Jolyn has been in this business for two years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net and other fishing materials

loans.name: Jonnah

texts.en:
Jonnah works hard to support her family. Jonnah is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Jonnah has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Jonnah would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Liliosa

texts.en:
Liliosa is 56 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like soap, shampoo, and milk to sell.

Liliosa has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like soap, shampoo, and milk to sell.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables and fruits to sell for her buy and sell fruits and vegetables business.

Lourdes has been in this business for one year. Lourdes earns more income from farming rice.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables and fruits to sell

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Matilde is 61 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like noodles, sardines, coffee, can goods, and chips to sell.

Matilde has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 16 years and also earns an income from buy and sell nipa roofing and restaurant.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like noodles, sardines, coffee, can goods, and chips to sell.

loans.name: Reinheart

texts.en:
Reinheart is 38 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of household goods to sell.

Reinheart has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: May Ann

texts.en:
May Ann is 32 years old and single. She earns a living by cultivating flowering plants in the Philippines. 

May Ann is borrowing 30,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation so she can purchase additional materials like flower pots, fertilizers, and other flower seeds.

May Ann has been growing flowering plants for 4 years, and she also earns additional income from both farming sugarcane and selling pre-paid mobile phone credit.

May Ann is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials such as flower pots, fertilizers, and other flower seeds.

loans.name: Grupo Familia Panadera Group

texts.es:
Keila es una mujer de 34 años de edad, es soltera, vive en una comunidad de chocola.
Keila ( se encuentra en el lado izquierdo de la fotografía la de blusa gris   ) es  muy trabajadora, ella tiene un negocio  de venta de regalos para toda ocasión tales como boda, cumpleaños, graduaciones, Keila realiza esta actividad desde hace 7 años, pero según expresa Keila que con los ingresos que genera en este negocio no le alcanza para mantener a su familia, es por ello  que también se dedica a vender panes por las mañanas y tardes con este otro negocio Keila ha logrado mejorar sus ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia. Pero lo que ella quiere realizar ahora es mejor su negocio de venta de regalos, pero una de las limitaciones de Keila es que no cuenta con suficiente capital para poder hacerlo, por tal razón ella solicita un prestamo de para comprar, obsequios como: osos de peluche, cuadros de pared, lámparas y otras cosas.
Keila es una mujer muy participativa que le gusta colaborar con los demás es por eso que ella ha juntado a un grupo de mujeres que cuenta con la misma necesidad, para que todas juntas logren  sus objetivos y hacer que sus familias no parezcan de necesidades.
Keila cuenta que ella realiza este prestamo  grupal porque  ella no cuenta con una garantía propia, el sueño de Keila y su grupo es contar con este prestamo para poder hacer esta inversión y así poder obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Keila is a woman of 34. She is single and lives in a community of Chocla.

Keila (in the photograph she is on the left wearing a gray blouse) is very hard-working. She has a business of selling gifts for all occasions, such as weddings, birthdays, and graduations. Keila has had this business for 7 years, but according to what Keila states, the income that this business generates is not sufficient to support her family. It is for that reason that she also sells bread in the mornings, and in the afternoons she has this other business. Keila has managed to improve her income to raise her family. What she wants to accomplish now is to improve her business of selling gifts, but one of her limitations is that she doesn't have sufficient capital to be able to do it. For this reason, she is applying for a loan to buy gifts such as teddy bears, wall paintings, lamps, and other things.

Keila is a highly participating woman who likes to collaborate with the others. It is for this reason that she has joined a group of women who have the same need, so that together they can all reach their goals and see that their families don't lack the necessities.

Keila states that she is taking out this group loan because she doesn't have her own guarantee. The dream of Keila and her group is to have this loan in order to be able to make this investment and thus be able to obtain better earnings.

loans.use: to buy gift items such as teddy bears and wall paintings

loans.name: Fetuiai

texts.en: Fetuiai is 54 years old and married with 7 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 4 years. Fetuiai needs a loan to buy fertilizer, a spade, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a machete, a crowbar, a new sprayer and crops. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. Fetuiai will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a spade, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a machete, a crowbar, a new sprayer and crops

loans.name: Mataniu

texts.en: Mataniu is a 46-year-old unmarried woman with 5 children. She makes and sells barbeque in her community to earn a living. She has 5 years of experience with this business. Mataniu needs a loan to buy a BBQ grill, tongs, pots, soya sauce, Chinese onions, sacks of rice and potatoes, chicken leg quarters and sausages. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and also help with the expansion of her business in the future. Mataniu has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy a BBQ grill, tongs, pots, soya sauce, Chinese onions, sacks of rice and potatoes, chicken leg quarters and sausages

loans.name: Palepa

texts.en:
Palepa is a 37 year old unmarried woman with 5 children. With four years of experience, she makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living.

Palepa needs a loan to buy a large frying pan, a strainer, yeast, a bag of sugar, a barrel of cooking oil, tongs and plastic bags. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and also help pay for her children's education. Palepa has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy a large frying pan, a strainer, yeast, bag of sugar, barrel of cooking oil, tongs and plastic bags

loans.name: Vaoau

texts.en:
Vaoau is 30 years old and is married with 4 children. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that sells either in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years. 

Vaoau needs a loan to buy a new wheelbarrow, tiller, rake, watering hose, and gloves, as well as insecticide and fertilizer. 

Vaoau has been a member of South Pacific Business Development since 2013. She will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a new wheelbarrow, tiller, rake, watering hose, and gloves, as well as insecticide and fertilizer.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 32 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family and aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

Helen has been running her general store for 13 years and also earns an income from fish vending. In the past, Helen borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF. She has requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional household goods to sell.

loans.use: to purchase additional household goods to sell

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is 32 years old and married with five children who are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, rice, sugar, etc. to sell.

Sharon has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, rice, sugar, etc. to sell

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Shirley works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from pig fattening and rice farming. Shirley is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her buy and sell rice grains business.

Shirley has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Ernelyn

texts.en:
Ernelyn is 35 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ernelyn is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional pigs to raise and sacks of feed.

Ernelyn has been raising pigs for two years and earns additional income from pre-paid mobile load, food vending and selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs to raise and sacks of feed

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 37 years old and married with two children who are in school. Grace works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Grace has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Grace would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Jenielyn

texts.en:
Jenielyn, 28, is a married woman with five children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Jenielyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net.

Jenielyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, Jenielyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Ashuroy

texts.ru:
Ашурой позитивная и трудолюбивая женщина. Живёт она в небольшом сельском посёлке. С детства Ашурой мечтала стать учительницей, но так сложились обстоятельства, что она не смогла получить высшего образования из-за финансовой недостаточности в семье. Для того, чтобы иметь постоянный доход на пропитание Ашурой начала свой бизнес. Она занимается животноводством. Ашурой выращивает скот, затем продаёт полученное от скота мясо и молоко. От этого бизнеса Ашурой получает хороший доход. 
 В данный момент Ашурой хочет купить ещё несколько голов скота для откармливания. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет взять кредит на покупку скота. Ашурой заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Ashuroy is a positive and hardworking woman.  She lives in a small rural settlement.  Starting in childhood, Ashuroy used to dream of becoming a teacher, but her circumstances were such that she never managed to receive a university education; her family lacked the money to pay for it.  

In order to have a constant stream of income to provide for herself, Ashuroy started her own business.  She raises livestock for a living.  Ashuroy raises cattle, then sells the meat and milk she gets from them.  Ashuroy earns a good amount of income from this business.

Currently, Ashuroy wants to buy a few more heads of cattle for fattening.  For this reason, she's turned to Arvand and wants to take out a loan to buy cattle.  Ashuroy thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: buy cattle

loans.name: Ana Paula

texts.es: Ana tiene 35 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 17 años y 15 años de edad. Ana es una mujer emprendedora quien se dedica  a la venta de tamales desde hace mucho tiempo. De esta forma es como junto al apoyo de su esposo mantienen la economía del hogar. Ana desea  finalizar la construcción de su vivienda dado que por falta de recursos económicos no ha logrado terminar. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena, ladrillo, hierro, pago de mano de obra, etc.
texts.en: Ana is 35-years old and lives in her own home with her husband and her two children, who are 17- and 15-years old respectively.  Ana is an enterprising woman who has made her living selling tamales for a long time, which is how she helps her husband to maintain their household finances.  Ana wants to finish construction on her home; due to a lack of financial resources she has not been able to do so yet.  She is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of cement, sand, brick, iron etc. and to pay for labor.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, brick, iron etc., and to pay for labor to finish construction on her home.

loans.name: Fuatino

texts.en: Fuatino is 30 years old and unmarried with four children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for three years. Fuatino needs a loan to buy a new display fridge, a chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, canned food, a sack of onions and potatoes. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She became a member of SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a new display fridge, a chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, canned food, a sack of onions and potatoes
